Review0.Review: Really good. Quality fish. The best tbh. Good chef. Not too talkative despite asking for info.But I don’t expect that.

Review1.Review: Absolutely fabulous the work stuff was just really a dream

Review2.Review: I was at Akiko’s several years ago when it was still in its very small location. Most of the time when an amazing place expands the restaurant loses some of what makes it special. Well - that myth was busted. The staff was friendly, the service impeccable, and the Omikase experience was one of the top 10 meals of my life. My husband, son and I had a most memorable meal.

Review3.Review: Best omakase experience in the city.  Aged fish beautifully presented.  Exquisite favors.  Plan to order beyond the set menu

Review4.Review: The sauce combination with the food was not working well

Review5.Review: 18 courses of pure bliss! Every dish was incredible! Service was superb.

Review6.Review: Ingredient quality was excellent and several of the bites were truly superb. Presentation was immaculate. Service was excellent. However, some bites were quite over-seasoned to the point that the fish flavors were clobbered. The scallop is one example; it was over-salted to the point that it burned my tongue (but the toasted goma was memorable). The botan ebi tasted only of coconut, but the texture was perfect. Barracuda was salt and char-forward. The alcohol prices are, um, “aggressive.”For example, a pour of Nikka from the Barrel is $35. An entire *bottle* costs less than $70 retail in the Bay Area, and a typical price for a pour is $18, if memory serves.

Review7.Review: Beautiful spot amazing food. They proudly display their aging boxes where they elevate the flavor of their offerings

Review8.Review: Omakase at Akiko‘s is one of the most amazing experiences for the palate. The creativity of the small bites is exquisite. The aged sushi melts in your mouth.  We loved every minute.

Review9.Review: Great Omakase experience! Everything was delicious and conveniently downtown. Certainly a bit pricey but also to be expected given the location and quality of food.

Review10.Review: Phenomenal food. Great service. Outstanding evening.

Review11.Review: This was a fantastic experience with amazing food and helpful staff. We had a great time. The sake pairing was perfect.

Review12.Review: Why this is not a Michelin starred restaurant is beyond me! From food to service to ambiance…Akikos is a 10 out of 10! The omikase menu is creative, pallet pleasing and the best food experience I’ve had in ….possibly ever! Our sake flight was equally as delicious …I now have a whole new appreciation and burgeoning obsession with sake thanks to my experience at Akikos!Can’t wait to come back!

Review13.Review: Truly outstanding tonight, my favorite menu of every time i’ve visited Akikos. Sublime. The service was absolutely perfect too. Incredible.

Review14.Review: We loved the food and service. A must visit place

Review15.Review: The omakase was amazing, and the experience did not disappoint.

Review16.Review: Came here for our anniversary. We sat at the sushi chef bar so we got to watch our chef make our food. We had omakase and it was delicious. The service was extremely good and the staff were very attentive.

Review17.Review: It is pricey but absolutely worth it!Food is as fantastic!

Review18.Review: A very special meal - the food, service and ambiance were all excellent. Prices make equivalent meals in Tokyo look inexpensive - but I didn't have to fly to Japan!

Review19.Review: Omakase is amazing and showcases the creativity of the chefs so well. Love this place so much

Review20.Review: Service and drinks were great, but the food was pretty middling especially considering the price.

Review21.Review: The food is delicious but with one drink, sparkling water and tip - it was not worth over $700.  They have out priced themselves which is too bad because I have always loved their food and service.  Lovely for a special night if in your budget.

Review22.Review: Excellent experience and quality.  Will go again when in town.

Review23.Review: phenomenal!! Best omakase experience I’ve ever had

Review24.Review: Fantastic experience! Went for lunch with my beautiful wife to celebrate my birthday. Very chill vibe which was perfect and the food was amazing. Service was spot on and got to enjoy a nice glass of Yamazaki 12. Georgeous! :)

Review25.Review: The experience of dining here for my wife’s birthday was truly perfect and I have been happier because of it. The service is top notch. Friendly, professional and attentive staff made the whole evening feel comfortable. The dining room itself was amazing to look at while we waited for the dishes. The selection of food was perfect to be adventurous and safe for inexperienced taste buds. Really and truly grateful for the evening. Thank you again.

Review26.Review: Expensive but worth the experience… would recommend it

Review27.Review: We celebrated our 15 year anniversary here, and had a wonderful experience! Each course was well explained to us, and everything was beautifully presented and delicious.It would have been nice if they gave us some chocolates or sweets after the one dessert course, but they didn’t give us anything extra. I think it would have been a nice touch, considering how much the degustation set costs. Wine list was pretty good too, although a little limited. Overall, it was a very enjoyable meal.

Review28.Review: First time here.  Excellent all around.  I eat out a lot and never photograph my food, yet I took two photos here. Can’t wait to return.

Review29.Review: What an amazing Omakase experience. Every course was better than the last. They were able to accommodate my gluten allergy and my wife’s shellfish one. We had a very memorable meal. Contrary to the shown menu they do not offer a la cart menu only omakase. Also expect to pay around $300 per person.  The lunch Omakase is about half that if you want to experience the awesomeness that is Akikos.

Review30.Review: Must try at least once! Sushi was phenomenal. Wagu is a must! ￼

Review31.Review: The D best Japanese restaurant. Never disappoints. Would go again and again and again.

Review32.Review: This place was amazing! Dinner was expensive I mean expensive but worth it. Every dish was made beautifully and had the best service

Review33.Review: Very good food. You will get to try items you may not be familiar with prepared in unique and inventive ways.

Review34.Review: Outstanding as always. Lunch here is my favorite. Great atmosphere, great food, and drinks! Stand outs were the o-toro, scallop, and waygu Nigri...

Review35.Review: Food was GreatSuper fresh FishService was Excellent

Review36.Review: Great experience, great service, and really good menu selection

Review37.Review: Simply amazing. The food, the staff, the atmosphere all contributed to make this evening an unforgettable experience!

Review38.Review: A great start with complimentary bubbles to celebrate our wedding anniversary. It was an 18 course omakase first half being Otsumami and second half with Nigiri. We love abalone and uni so it was awesome that they were in the menu. The only negative feedback for this review is that on the bill, there was a 5% “Health mandate.” When asked the host what this extra charge, they explained that this mandate was passed to the consumer to help out the employees with health insurance. As a dinner, I am not sure why this is passed to the diners versus the owner should be paying for. Each person costs $250 to dine, not including tax, tips, and “health mandate” fee so you can imagine what it will cost for the entire bill. I love the food experience but paying the extra 5% health mandate would shy me from returning.

Review39.Review: Very good experience. We choose this restaurant for celebrating our anniversary, we got champagnes and oyster on the house. Very impressive services as well. Atmosphere also very nice. Food is fabulous! Recommend to try!

Review40.Review: Very good sushi and phenomenal service and atmosphere.

Review41.Review: The service was good, honestly all we got was them just bring out the food as far as them coming to our table. The food was dry - not sure how I can explain this - fave thing on the menu for me was the lobster…Enjoyed the bottle of saké.We were celebrating a birthday and they called day before to confirm this but they still didn’t even bring a celebratory cake or the dessert with a candle lol no recognition all good though.Overall gets a 2.8 - not my top Omakase’s in SF

Review42.Review: This was an amazing dining experience. The sushi was some of the best we have ever had. I believe their aging process is in part responsible and also flying it in from Japan. The staff was friendly and professional. We had someone with us who we weren't aware was not a fish fan until right before we dined. The restaurant bent over backwards to accommodate him without complaint. Remember this is a fine dining experience and as such is not inexpensive, however I believe worth it.

Review43.Review: Service was amazing! With them well in their new location!

Review44.Review: 不一般的OMAKASE，这店处处显心思！高水准的Dish creativity, 优秀的食材，现代化、简单不失雅致的装潢，把不利于设计的三角形大厅格局变身成为更具备空间感的设计。Signature dish是采用肥美的TORO代替黄油的鱼子酱多士，创意无限、美味绝伦。漂亮优雅的服务员带来丰富的产品介绍和满载的仪式感，让每一位客人留下深刻的印象！！

Review45.Review: Absolutely delicious lunch. Great service, the ambiance was wonderful.

Review46.Review: Incredible restaurant.  Seems like Akiko’s could get a Michelin star.  Can’t  wait to go back next time I’m in SF

Review47.Review: This was my 2nd time here. Last time was over a year ago and we did lunch omakase. This time it was for dinner. All items were different and tasted great. Sake was also on point. Would highly recommend this place for their omakase.

Review48.Review: One of the least warm of the omakase experiences. Too much of the menu was preprepared. Looks like they are cutting corners on food and preparation.

Review49.Review: The star of the show at Akiko's was unquestionably the food, as would be expected at an omakase restaurant.  And the food did not disappoint - it was absolutely superb. Every bite was delicious and layered with flavor.  The toro nigiri and the lobster at the start were true standouts.  The food is reason enough to go to Akiko's but we were also blown away by the warm, welcoming service from literally every staff member! Everyone was friendly and attentive, and this made the evening a really special experience.  I highly recommend Akiko's and we cannot wait to go back!

Review50.Review: Amazing dinner - every bite was delicious, service was great and the sake pairing was great! Can’t wait to go back!

Review51.Review: This was our 2nd time at Akikos and we loved our experience as much as the first time. The food was delicious and the sake pairing was excellent. Top-notch experience in every way.

Review52.Review: Fantastic omakase with some amazing sake choices.  One of our favorites in SF.  Lovely attentive service.  Delicious cocktails.

Review53.Review: Fabulous omikase! I’m a fairly picky sushi eater and I can eat everything because the fish was so fresh and beautifully prepared. This locations is gorgeous and a wonderful fine dining experience!

Review54.Review: We had lunch at Akikos and were lucky that it was Spring break week.  The result. Fewer than a dozen people sharing lunch and a very quiet experience ( the way my wife and I prefer to eat)!The service was excellent.  The presentation exquisite.  The food - so fresh - delicious.  Served as a tasting menu, with the use of fresh vegetables and seafood, it was a culinary delight. My favorite was the cherry trout and the crab and lobster bisque.A fabulous meal for those who love seafood  especially lobster!

Review55.Review: 18 piece dinner omakase was so dank. I would say the appetizers were better than the actual nigiri because they were more unique in flavor and texture. However, the fish was all around outstanding.

Review56.Review: The food is incredibly delicious, the flavors are so well balanced, I wish the taste would last as long as possible. I've eaten at quite a few omakase, but this one is something else, wow.

Review57.Review: Amazing lunch omakase! Fresh sushi, wonderful appetizers and love that we were able to add on some uni!

Review58.Review: Best omakase experience I've had! Wonderful service throughout as well!

Review59.Review: Flawless service, top-notch food! The best omakase in SF!

Review60.Review: Stunningly beautiful and delicious sushi. Get the sake pairing! An all around fabulous experience.

Review61.Review: Exceptional food. Outstanding service. Excellent atmosphere. Honestly, under-priced for the quality of produce. Also, their wine list is extensive and has a good price point range for all possible customers. Highly recommend.

Review62.Review: Superb! We would recommend this restaurant with no hesitation.

Review63.Review: Food and service were very good. The music is not good: too noisy, loud, and distracts from the wonderful food and conversation. The ambience would be good if there were either no music at all or simply soft, low volume jazz.

Review64.Review: Food was very high quality but the overall experience was not worth the high price.  The service was nothing special. We sat at the counter in the hope of having more engagement with the chefs/servers but it was perfunctory.  And the amount of the food left us still hungry.

Review65.Review: We had an amazing Valentine’s Day lunch! Service and food were outstanding. We will definitely be back! Thank you.

Review66.Review: We had a wonderful experience! The staff were professional, friendly, informative, and even helped cater to our specific dining needs as a family. A la carte extras (from same omakase menu) could be ordered and were every fairly priced. We would 100% recommend.

Review67.Review: For the price of a flight to Japan, dine at this sublime San Francisco omakase restaurant instead! Seriously the best sushi we’ve ever had. Impeccable. Interesting. Perfectly paced. This was a special occasion for us and absolutely worth it.

Review68.Review: Wonderful omakase menu, both the fish and the sushi rice are supurb. Every course was a winner! We added the sake pairing and truly enjoyed it. The space is sleek and beautiful and very welcoming. I do with the seating around the bar was more comfortable but everything else was splendid.

Review69.Review: An amazing dining experience!   The food is exceptional and brings a truly modern Japanese omakase sushi experience to San Francisco.  The drinks menu is also very well done and complemented the food. Most of all we really enjoyed the service, from the staff to the wonderful conversation we had with Chef Hayashi.  We can’t wait to return!

Review70.Review: Wonderful experience, food, and staff! We’ve been here twice and would come again

Review71.Review: Amazing and unique food. Great attentive service and fantastic presentation.

Review72.Review: From the moment we walked in the door, our experience was magical. Celebrating my nephew's 24 birthday ( brain cancer survivor from the age of 17 ), our meal could not have been more perfect. Our servers were knowledgeable and friendly, not stuffy as often at a high end restaurant. The Chef who prepared our food was a delight, very engaging, was eager to educate, brought out a whole fish for us to investigate. At the end of the evening I met  Chef Ray, had Chef. Had a lovely chat about the bounties of the north valley

Review73.Review: The food and service were wonderful. Absolutely wonderful. The music way too loud. I wish there were no music at all or quiet, soothing jazz.  The music takes away from the delicious meal.Because of the music, I may not return.I actually liked the ambience and intimate setting of the old Akiko’s on Bush.

Review74.Review: Amazing food, service, and ambiance! Would definitely recommend

Review75.Review: Akikos was one of the best omakase experiences I've had. Incredible service and truly mouthwatering food. The location is also perfect, walking distance to all nearby offices in FiDi, SoMa, and South Beach. 12/10 recommend this spot.

Review76.Review: I NEVER give perfect review but today I have to defy myself. I had such a memorable lunch at Akiko’s, and was blown away by the thoughtfully curated Omakase course as well as the artful presentation and gorgeous yet comforting décor. The four “tsumami” dishes were all fantastic with highlights being the Chawanmushi, the warm and savory, umami-packed “An” gravy with crab and shaved black truffles, and the ever so sexy Shokupan (milk bread) with Toro “butter” and Kaluga caviar with gold flakes – a conversation stopper! The well-paired Sake made the experience amplified. But the highlight of the meal was their Nigiri course – the hyper-seasonal fish (“Tenjo” Winter Buri!!) that were perfectly dry-aged to the peak of its flavor while retaining excellent texture. Every morsel was a superbly balanced, seasoned to bring out the best of each fish, from caramel-colored “tare” on Blue Fin Tuna to simply delicious salt with citrus zest on Hokkaido scallop. Shari was perfectly warm to the touch, and individual grains defined yet cohesive. I think Akiko’s is the best value in town for the overall quality level. I can’t wait to return for a full dinner, and drink more Sake from their great menu!

Review77.Review: The BEST omakase I’ve ever had! The service and attention to detail and kindness of the staff was beyond my expectations. Thank you AKIKOS 🤌🏾

Review78.Review: We dine out quite a bit and this was one of our most memorable meals in recent memory.

Review79.Review: This was our first time at the new location. The restaurant was beautifully decorated and spacious. We sat at the bar and had a great time. The sake pairing was delicious!  The menu was updated with new items. Overall, a great meal!  The price is steep… but you get what you paid for.

Review80.Review: One of the best restaurants in San Francisco. The service is outstanding from the moment you walk in. The food is not only delicious but presented in such a beautiful way. Incredible sake selection and the cocktails were tasty too. The splurge is definitely worth it.

Review81.Review: Best sushi in the US. I know that’s a bold statement, but it is what it is.

Review82.Review: Took my spouse to a bday lunch omakase. It was an exquisite experience. It’s a birthday tradition to celebrate with an omakase meal. AKIKOS delivered on all levels. To the chef and staff; thank you for a memorable experience.

Review83.Review: The best omakase experience! . Everything was delicious and fresh and the service impeccable. Thank you so much for such a memorable evening!

Review84.Review: Amazing, friendly and attentive service. Exceptional sake.

Review85.Review: The appetizers were delicious and the sake pairing was ideal.

Review86.Review: My experience at AKIKOS was delightful and they made my night special. The omakase dinner was superb and flavors were delicious. I greatly enjoyed the flavors of the dishes and the nigiris were amazing! The countertop seating was a plus as I got to chat with the chef. The hospitality of this place was top-notch and I love their attention to detail. Can't wait to be back soon!

Review87.Review: I already replied once but I would like to know more about Ray.s other sushi bar closer to me I think it is on California st

Review88.Review: Amazing, beautiful new space- great to see the evolution of an already amazing restaurant!

Review89.Review: Delish, attentive and delightful. Omakase at Akiko’s new location did not disappoint. The Sake pairing was delicious

Review90.Review: Fun omakase. Not totally traditional but well-done nonetheless.

Review91.Review: One of the best Japanese food I SF. The service and location is impeccable.

Review92.Review: Outstanding spot. I had a wonderful experience, and their focus on the cut of the fish and flavors was outstanding.

Review93.Review: The omakase experience at Akiko’s is one of the best in North America, it’s always exceptional and creative.

Review94.Review: Always amazing! The wagyu and goldeneye snapper are my favorites

Review95.Review: A great dining experience, was blown away by the wide selection of different fish

Review96.Review: I came with my best friend here and we were the last two that were seated. The staff here are really friendly, kind and accommodating. However they ran out of two fish that were supposed to be on the tasting menu and were replace with two other that was not up to par. We were really disappointed but we enjoyed the overall experience and the other dishes!

Review97.Review: It was a wonderful experience. AKIKOS blends the traditional with the modern tastefully. A new way to experience Japanese cuisine!

Review98.Review: A+ on all fronts -- exquisite dining experience.  Every single time.

Review99.Review: BEST SUSHI ON THE PLANETBEST SUSHI ON THE PLANETBEST SUSHI ON THE PLANETBEST SUSHI ON THE PLANETBEST SUSHI ON THE PLANETBEST SUSHI ON THE PLANET

Review100.Review: Very Modern, cool, and yummy!  I will definitely go back for every Work Anniversary!

Review101.Review: I’m not sure how they are able to execute a 12 course lunch menu for so little money, but they do so flawlessly.

Review102.Review: Exceptional.  Chef, the meal, service and sake pairings - all simply exceptional.  Will visit again next time in San Francisco.  My wife and I made a memory last night.

Review103.Review: The experience changed me. It was a random pick for my wife. Earned a lot of brownie points.

Review104.Review: Excellent experience all around. The service was delightful and the menu was very creative.

Review105.Review: The entire experience was out of this world! Highly recommend!

Review106.Review: Lovely Omakase experience.  Lobster was amazing as were all of the nigiri.  So fresh and truly exquisite!

Review107.Review: Great sushi, creative presentations and flavor pairing

Review108.Review: Best omakase ever, fresh and delicious fish, espectacular rice, attentive and warm Service.

Review109.Review: Akikos is my default sushi restaurant in SF. Expert japanese chefs with bona fide training in the worlds best edomae sushi establishments.

Review110.Review: Great for a special occasion. Inventive dishes and great service.

Review111.Review: This place is amazing. I don’t know what else to say.

Review112.Review: Such an amazing experience! Some of the best food I’ve ever eaten. Chefs really care about their craft and service was 10/10.

Review113.Review: This place was an all around disappointment. The food was not great. There were a few items that were delicious but the majority was not good. The chef was busy chatting with one of the customers almost the whole time and that was distracting. He was actually very nice when he turned his attention to us.I was disappointed and do not recommend.

Review114.Review: Amazing hospitality. Wonderful sushi chefs. Delightful seasonal omakase menu: tonight, the chawanmushi with snow crab, maitake mushrooms and I believe a hint of truffle was delectable!!

Review115.Review: Amazing Sushi. Best sushi restaurant in San Francisco!

Review116.Review: When only the best will do, Akikos can provide that experience. We love this place.

Review117.Review: I’ve been to a zillion high end sushi restaurants around the world and this one is in my top 5.  Not cheap, but worth it.

Review118.Review: I used to come to this restaurant for the chef’s tasting menu and it was all nigiri and the chef prepared pieces for as long as you liked. It was amazing! This was a different experience where half of the meal was cooked food and nigiri served at the end with the option to purchase more. I wish there was an option to experience their food the old way. Also, a sushi dinner for two with a couple glasses of sake each shouldn’t be over $900.00. That’s just insane.

Review119.Review: Simply perfection. I’ve not been wowed or had a complete experience like this in a very long time.

Review120.Review: Space was nice, the service was even better. The team there was great but the food just did not meet our expectations especially given the hype around the restaurant.

Review121.Review: Excellent omakase experience. Great quality fish, attentive service, beautiful presentation. Overall a great evening, pricey but worth celebrating a special occasion.

Review122.Review: Went for the omakase. Food was great with a few items being outstanding like the lobster claw, sea urchin, and bluefin tuna belly. Service was fantastic. Highly recommend for special events.

Review123.Review: I would probably not go back. Even though 85% of the food was excellent- but not 100%.The drinks menu is fun albeit quite pricey.The place has cool modern feel and a private conversation is possible. The service was efficient but I missed a personal touch. No coffee or tea was offered at the end.

Review124.Review: The food and the service was amazing. A great experience.

Review125.Review: It was a excellent diner and a perfect experience! Thank you to everyone

Review126.Review: Perfect and exceptional from food to service, great experience

Review127.Review: Went for lunch.  Beautifully constructed sushi.  Excellent service. A well-planned omakase!

Review128.Review: Service was prompt, on time, and all the staff were very attentive. They even went as far as plating things to fit a left-handed vs. right handed person. My drinks were always filled and plates were taken away at the appropriate times. I was really lucky to be seated in front of Chef Matt and to have the opportunity to watch an artist work on his craft. Along with his high skill, he was very knowledgeable and I appreciate that he saw I wasn't such a talkative person and let me eat in peace.  The quality of the fish was fantastic and I had some flashbacks to being in japan eating sushi. The dishes were unique in that there were some twists and flavors that I hadn't considered before with traditional sushi ingredients. Thank you for a great dinner! I'm glad I finally got to experience your dinner service.

Review129.Review: This place is one of the best sushi restaurants in SF. Their omakase menu is a must, it will fill you up, you’ll try a bit of everything, each dish is explained by the chef or the server, the sushi master is preparing the sushi in front of you and makes the experience more memorable! Definitely will be back

Review130.Review: Highly recommended, it was one of the best meals I've had. Our chef and servers were very engaging. We had a great time and will definitely be back!

Review131.Review: Amazing experience! A little bit pricey for brazilians, but worth a visit.Food was unbelievable. One of the best meals I've ever had.Outstanding service as well.

Review132.Review: We did the Omakase lunch. Every dish was so delicious. All were favorites because every single course was so good and can't compare cause the flavors were so different from each other but the entire meal was all so balancing. The truffle ice cream dessert was to die for and the wagyu roll was so melting in the mouth!

Review133.Review: Delicious meal. Everyone was extremely kind. The sushi chef explained the how they dry age the fish. Perfect 12 yr wedding anniversary celebration dinner. Thank you Akikos!

Review134.Review: Way over priced. No traditional hot sake or Miso served.  Had the Omikase. Some dishes were good, but I have had better.

Review135.Review: Wonderful food and service. Price is too high. It was a very nice experience.

Review136.Review: Delicious. Refined. Well executed. Beautifully presented. Transcendent. Special. If you like sushi, you will love Akiko's restaurant.

Review137.Review: It's expensive. Let's get past that.It's the best I've ever eaten in the city.

Review138.Review: Great to have AKIKOS back in SF!  We missed the Bush St location so very much.  Fantastic omakase dining experience!!

Review139.Review: Ray is an artist with the sushi. Grab an opportunity to enjoy this experience Restaurant Review: AkikosI recently had the pleasure of dining at Akikos, and I must say, it was an exquisite culinary experience. From the moment I stepped into the restaurant, I was greeted with an ambiance that beautifully blended modern elegance with a hint of traditional Japanese charm. The attentive staff made me feel welcome and ensured that my dining experience would be nothing short of exceptional.Akikos is known for its sushi, and rightly so. Ray, the talented artist behind the sushi counter, showcased his skills with every delicate creation. Each piece of sushi was a work of art, meticulously crafted with precision and attention to detail. The freshness of the ingredients was evident with every bite, and the flavors were nothing short of remarkable. Whether it was the buttery texture of the toro or the subtle sweetness of the uni, each bite transported me to a realm of culinary bliss.The fusion of traditional and contemporary flavors was a delight to the palate, creating a harmonious symphony of taste.Apart from the exceptional food, the service at Akikos was impeccable. The staff members were knowledgeable, friendly, and went above and beyond to ensure that my dining experience was memorable. They attentively explained each dish, provided insightful recommendations, and ensured that I had everything I needed throughout the meal.The overall ambiance of Akikos was elegant and inviting. The minimalist decor and warm lighting created a serene atmosphere that allowed me to fully immerse myself in the culinary journey.I highly recommend Akikos to anyone looking to indulge in a culinary experience that is truly exceptional. With Ray’s artistic mastery of sushi, coupled with the exquisite flavors and impeccable service, Akikos presents an opportunity to savor the beauty of Japanese cuisine!

Review140.Review: Highly recommend, best staff and amazing experience.  Creative cocktails and the highest quality Japanese experience in the Bay Area with a one of a kind menu.

Review141.Review: Love Akiko's. They've always been amazing, and this new omakase spot in the Avery is no exception. The quality of food and the service are top. I recommend to anyone who loves omakase and wants an experience that's unique at the same time that it feels so comfortable.

Review142.Review: Overall good experience. We had the Omakase and at that price point, the expectations have a higher threshold than what we experienced. The spot offers a better value for their very interesting cocktails and à la carte menu.

Review143.Review: Most memorable dining experience ever ! Definitely would recommend

Review144.Review: Fantastic from food to service and a great new ambiance

Review145.Review: So far everything is good, only one park, not my unfortunately ￼because the sushi rice was warmed and a little ￼sour , I guess they add to much sushi ￼ vinegar so over ￼cover the sushi fish .

Review146.Review: Perfect experience, best sushi I've had with creative non-sushi dishes as well.

Review147.Review: Simply amazing! We would highly recommend and will definitely be back!

Review148.Review: Amazing experience!!!!! Got to try a few new things that I had not tried before

Review149.Review: We loved Akiko when it was on Bush St. We were really looking forward to trying the Omakase at the new, beautiful, location. However, the food wasn't the same, mediocre at best, which was a big disappointment. We will not return.

Review150.Review: It was really awesome. Sammy was great. The fish was absolutely delicious. Some of the best sushi rice I’ve ever had. The lobster bite was the best single bite I’ve had in a long time. ￼

Review151.Review: Very helpful and service-oriented staff & beautiful space. The menu did not live up to its aspirations and came across as pretentious. This place has all the trapping of an exquisite sushi experience (including the price), but the food did not back it up. It had a fancy steakhouse ‘bring people here to impress them with your money’ vibe vs true culinary appreciation.The food was good, but not great. I got to experience interesting types of fish that I’ve never had before. Presentation was good.

Review152.Review: The food, service, and ambience were perfect. I would have made reservations for the following two nights I was in town if I could have.

Review153.Review: I was a longtime fan of the original Akiko’s, but sadly this new concept retains none of the charms of the prior restaurant including most of their best dishes.The fish was fine, but nothing stood out. There are many better tasting and better value Japanese omakase restaurants out there.Some dishes were also subpar, like a fried shrimp head that clearly had been fried much earlier in the evening so it was cold and the texture was off. For the price, you would think they would go to the trouble of frying the shrimp fresh for your round of service.Service was technical but lacking in warmth.

Review154.Review: Amazing tasting menu and experience!  Loved the staff and the entire experience.

Review155.Review: My husband and I had omakase at the chef counter. We were very disappointed. It was the most flavorless omakase experience we’ve ever had. The staff were very nice but the food was so bland.

Review156.Review: I remember dining at Akiko’s before its remodeling. Still great food and service, but the dining area and sushi bar lighting were extremely, unusually bright. I was disappointed my omakase dinner were out of miso soup, its second to last course; as were my requested 2 uni ala carte. Go figure.¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Review157.Review: New space was very nice.  Service was great and the food was delicious.

Review158.Review: Wow! Amazing amazing amazing!!! Best sushi/sashimi I’ve ever had in my life!!!

Review159.Review: Incredible omakase lunch experience. Really. Food, service, ambiance, all top notch.

Review160.Review: Phenomenal omakase lunch experience in a beautiful and chic setting.  Can’t wait to return

Review161.Review: We did the dinner experience to celebrate our anniversary and it was fantastic. Each course was beautifully presented and delicious. Staff was extremely kind and professional. The place itself was beautiful and all-around an incredible experience.

Review162.Review: The service was great, and I enjoyed the food. The experience was great as well it just wasn't outstanding. It could be my misunderstanding of the restaurant intentions, but I would have enjoyed it more if there were more interactions between the chef and the customers. Other omakase experiences I've been to (cheaper even) had more interactions. Maybe it's because this place is more expensive, so the chefs interact less and focus more on the craftsmanship and taste?

Review163.Review: My wife, Lois and I have been to the top sushi restaurants in many places in the world including Japan.  Last night was absolutely incredible.  Although this restaurant is brand new it won't be long before it earns a Michelin Star or 2.  The presentation and the dishware was fabulous.  The sushi was the best we have had in over a decade.  Great Sake selection.  We can't wait to go again soon.  Warm regards, Steve Chess

Review164.Review: Bad food. I had a guest from Seattle. The fish was old. The cuts were thick. Bad omakase menu.

Review165.Review: One of the top few omakase experiences of my life.  Absolutely beautiful progression of small dishes and fish.  Service was perfect - warm and not stuffy.  Looking forward to doing it again.

Review166.Review: Great tasting experience-the best we have ever had!

Review167.Review: Excellent. What an experience! We will definitely be back and bring friends.

Review168.Review: Amazing food. Great experience. Reconvene for a very special occasion.

Review169.Review: We had a wonderful experience at Akikos. The service and chef was amazing and attentive. The food was so good and love the menu. We celebrated my husband’s birthday and we had a great time. Loved the toast with toro and caviar! The sesame ice cream was delicious. The new location is nice open and modern. Will definitely be coming back. :)

Review170.Review: Do Akikos' omakase first, then graduate to FriendsOnly.

Review171.Review: amazing experience! wonderful food and exceptional service.

Review172.Review: Great service. Awesome sexy decor. Sushi rice was bit soggy.

Review173.Review: There was a lot of thought and care out I to the food here.

Review174.Review: Food and sushi was excellent! Their service was amazing thank you Allen Lee! Beautiful decor and love everything about the restaurant.

Review175.Review: Excellent experience - one of the best omakase's I've ever had.

Review176.Review: Fantastic meal.  Friendly and attentive service from the entire staff.  Beautiful, delicious food.

Review177.Review: Outstanding all around - one of the best fine dining experiences I've ever had, if not THE best - and my very difficult to please husband felt the same way!  Thanks for a fantastic meal and experience!

Review178.Review: Had the lunch omakase set menu with my spouse and it was wonderful. Loved the toro on toast with caviar and the squid cucumber salad. Andrew doing the nigiri preparation was amazing and the fish and urchin was A+. Will be back again.

Review179.Review: Took myself alone to AKIKOS as a treat after a long work period and at the end of a long work trip. It was everything I had hoped and more, the food was amazing especially the Uni WOW....... Staff, especially the sushi chef were amazing and I'd absolutely pay the $$$$ and go again when in SF,

Review180.Review: Best sushi by far in San Francisco. I felt like we were in Tokyo!

Review181.Review: The previous location was SO much better in every way.There was an almost total lack of interaction from the staff when we arrived at the Chefs stage. Basically ignored by the sushi chefs for a good 10 minutes and almost throughout the meal. This is So different from the highly personal service at the old location. What happened?Add to that, the meal was lackluster. Our last experience at the old location was one of the best sushi meals I’ve ever had. This just felt like going through the motions.One stand out example was the dramatic difference in the signature toro caviar toast. The version last night just felt pre made and stale. A huge difference to the stellar and outstanding version at the old location.For a $1,000 total check for two people I was disappointed in every way.

Review182.Review: The experience was amazing. The food was perfect and the drink pairing was exceptional. Would go back anytime.

Review183.Review: We thought every course was great and was worth the price of admission. Recommend omakase here!

Review184.Review: Very expensive and  they serve small portions  but the place is very quiet and the staff are very friendly.

Review185.Review: We reserved 2 seats at the sushi bar for lunch, having enjoyed Aikido's in its previous location .  It really was perfection! Calm cool atmosphere, in which you can see each chef preparing different fish dishes...each in a measured and careful way. In front of us the chef was taking mackerel from a traditional basket, and laying them out and covering them with salt...fascinating to watch. Then he became the nigiri chef...relaxed perfection!The food was flat out superb, with variety, imagination, and expertise, from a small egg shaped cup with dashi and a tiny poached quail egg, to tiny fried sweet fish, to snow crab in the most delicate custard with shaved winter truffles, to grilled milk toast with ground toro and a big band of caviar on top.And the nigiri! So fresh, perfect and gorgeous, with tiny amounts of bright pickled things on top! I had one glass of sake, which paired with every dish.Expensive, but worth every penny...you will never regret trying this experience!

Review186.Review: The best hands down in the city. !5 stars ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ my second time going and I’m looking forward for my next visit ! 🥳

Review187.Review: Beautiful space, friendly staff, and delicious lunch omakase.

Review188.Review: 空间很大 环境很好 很漂亮 适合约会 服务也很贴心 食物也不错 总体下来是会再去的餐厅！ 推荐推荐推荐

Review189.Review: Want a night out with some amazing sushi, this is not the place to go. Delicacies does not mean delicious, and definitely does not mean worth it. $500 to taste things you wouldn’t want to taste is not a good sushi experience. We were looking forward to this night out together, and were willing to pay their steep price tag for a night to remember. Regrets all around, and a night to forget. Don’t waste your time, or your money.

Review190.Review: What an excellent omakase lunch. Cocktails were sublime as was the sake. And the food was beautifully prepared and delivered. Very excited about this new incarnation of AKIKOS.

Review191.Review: Overrated. Sake selection was pretty average. Did not try the cocktail. Not sure why it’s sought after. There are better options in the city

Review192.Review: so good! the decor is admirable and our chef was lovely!

Review193.Review: Pricey but worth every cent. Delicious, exquisite and luxurious. A real treat

Review194.Review: Espectacular comida y servicio Un poco caro, pero absolutamente recomendable

Review195.Review: GREAT FOOD AND SERVICE... WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

Review196.Review: nice place but over priced at $250/persongood to try once. but i don't plan to go again

Review197.Review: Just amazing !! We just visited their new location on Folsom. The Omakase is to die for, and the sake pairing is very well done with a nice variety of flavors-textures.

Review198.Review: From start to finish, everything was so well prepared and presented. No portion of our omakase experience was left to chance or seemed unintentional. I can’t wait to return many times over!

Review199.Review: Superb and inspired food, elegant surroundings, soundtrack that accentuated the mood.

Review200.Review: Had an amazing meal, everything was presented in such a creative way and made of the freshest ingredients. 10/10 recommended (and make sure to sit at the counter)

Review201.Review: I've been a few times to their old location on Bush and this was the first time at their new location. It was always beyond excellent and this was beyond that. It's omakase only and it's not cheap ($250pp). This was a very special date - I was taking a special lady from Denver out for dinner. And the first date in SF with her or anyone in 27 years (I'm a widower). The experience delivered across the board. Very serene. Lots of polished wood making a 4 sided counter area with the sushi making mostly happening inside the quad. We were not rushed at all. I'd describe the food but I would fail. It's a mix of starters chefs creations followed by more familiar nigiri. Although I'd hesitate to say familiar.  The fish is very unique. Aged to perfection and pristine. I will go again but this is not an everyday experience. A Glass of champagne, a cocktail, some sake and the food + tip was $800+. Worth every penny. And for the bonus, my date absolutely loved the experience and is now my lady friend.

Review202.Review: Absolutely amazing!Every detail is well thought out; from the interior design, music, high standard of service from the wait staff, not to mention the exquisite food, both delicious and aesthetically stunning.  Truly inspiring.

Review203.Review: The food was just okay, especially for the price. Each piece of sushi did not have a distinct flavor, rather they all tasted like generic fish on rice. I also accidentally ingested a paint chip, due to some breakage of the bowl in was served on. The dessert was a basic and small scoop of black sesame ice cream. It seemed like they thought putting gold flakes on everything made it fancy, but where was the flavor?!   Not going back.

Review204.Review: The Omakase at AKIKOS was amazing. I’ve already told so many people about it. I can’t wait to come back and try it again.

Review205.Review: Superb Japanese cuisine. The one whole bottle of white wine on the menu was not available. For a high-end establishment collecting $800 for 2 at the end of the evening this was tantamount to negligence with NO compensation offered - such as two half bottles for the same price. Very ungracious and left a bad impression.

Review206.Review: Impeccable meal. Every bite was meticulously prepared and delicious.

Review207.Review: Amazing quality of food and service. Best lunch menu in SF!

Review208.Review: My second time here for lunch. Another wonderful experience and meal. The staff is amazing, and attentive, and the food was top notch as usual. I'll be back again.

Review209.Review: This is a fixed price omekase tasting menu. There were 4 warm starter and 7 pieces of sushi and a dessert offering. Sushi was also offered alacarte after the tasting. The service was attentive. And every dish amazing. Our table was at the sushi bar so great view of the sushi prep

Review211.Review: Stunning. The food, the service, the restaurant itself. Flawless service staff complimented the master class in sushi creativity.

Review212.Review: I was an hour late to my reservation because parking was very hard to find. Despite the 15 minute grace period, I was very lucky that the restaurant was so accommodating and sat me and my guest once we arrived. The service was great and the food was delicious! We had the dinner menu which was very fulfilling.

Review213.Review: Awesome new location with food as good as or better than in old location.  More upscale modern feel with more space- good call to move.  Had omakase lunch and ordered few extra nigiri pieces at end.  It was excellent and service is always great!!! Lunch was $150 omakase per person (dinner is $250) with about $50 more for adding 4-5 more pieces of sushi, but well worth it if you don't mind the price.  One of the best sushi places we have eaten in the US. Will keep coming back regularly.  Parked on street so hit or miss and not sure how safe area is at night as not familiar with east SF district; consider Uber as they also have a great sake menu.

Review214.Review: My favorite restaurant in SF! Seriously impressive customer experience. compares to 2 michelin star restaurants and the best sushi I've ever had.

Review215.Review: Everything was good , a few courses exceptional, but the new location lacks the verve and thrill of the original.

Review216.Review: Beautiful space, great food, attentive service! An overall excellent dining experience.

Review217.Review: Have eaten twice at the new location now. Once at a table and once at the chefs counter. Both times the food was excellent. While staff are earnest and trying hard,in the context of price and value for money it doesn’t quite hit the mark. The ambience is compromised by the lighting being too bright and the 80s music sound track seems so discordant with the overall ambience as to be distracting. They are still in their “soft open” phase and I suspect things will get better with time. So while it’s a welcome and excellent addition to the neighborhood ( and I will surely dine again) there remains room for improvement if they want to truly be successful at this price point.

Review218.Review: The best sushi I have had to date. Elegant selection, very good service, knowledgeable friendly staff. I will be coming back...

Review219.Review: Lovely location and excellent service. Sammy was very nice and made great recommendations.

Review220.Review: Might have been the most food I've ever got with omakase,  and 90% of is was super good and everything was very fresh. The music that they were playing, rock and alternative, was a bit off for the ambiance of the rest of the restaurant. The service was good and attentive, but felt that there was some sort of "umph," lacking compared to other places in this price point I've eaten at.

Review221.Review: Food and experience is stellar.   currently only an Omakase menu, but worth the experience is you are wanting to spoil yourself or have a special occasion.

Review222.Review: Very good experience, food is top quality

Review223.Review: It was their 4th day open and we couldn't tell at all.  We live in the neighborhood and are so happy Akikos is now here in the area.   Allen was our server and he was fantastic!

Review225.Review: Amazing restaurant with attention to every little detail. All the food is great with some of the seafood flown in from Japan. I will definitely be coming back. Shocked it’s not a michellin star restaurant! 5/5

Review226.Review: Good and service were both exceptional! Everything came out on time and presented beautifully.

Review227.Review: Best Japanese food I’ve had in sf.  Very refined. Outstanding

Review229.Review: The whole experience was outstanding! Had the opportunity to sit at the bar, and see everything that was going on! Each dish of the omakase was presented beautifully, and tasted just as they said it was! I recommend 10/10, will definitely make another trip here!

Review230.Review: We didn’t love the tasting menu.  Very expensive and there were a number of dishes we didn’t like.

Review231.Review: Akiko is my favorite restaurant in the entire world, always getting an outstanding experience there!

Review232.Review: Excellent sushi and sushi chef Yoshida made it an exceptional experience!

Review233.Review: Outstanding food and service. Make sure to have some of the suchi coming straight from Japan.

Review234.Review: Best sushi restaurant I've been to. My favorite restaurant in SF.

Review235.Review: fish was not fresh. The sweet shrimp came out cooked and the scallop was dehydrated. Some of the pieces were half frozen. Interesting choice of using brown rice as the base for the pieces. The texture of the rice made it very noticeable and did not pair well with any of the fish. The tuna piece’s shokupan was powdery and also did not pair with the tuna. The toro piece was the worst toro I’ve ever had. Sticky and somewhat fishy. A sukiyaki place I used to frequent in nyc had better and fresher toro than this omakase place. If this is someone’s first omakase experience just know that this is way below par.

Review236.Review: Just plain excellent, as usual. Very much worth the visit.

Review237.Review: This was the most outstanding meal we’ve ever experienced. And it was an experience. Very, very special (and utterly delicious).

Review238.Review: Best Omakase experience, impeccable service, and perfectly executed. Worth every penny. Thank you for an extremely memorable birthday dinner!

Review239.Review: High quality omakase with ingredients flown in from Japan. Chefs are Japanese as well. Pricey but worth it. Seasonal menus available.

Review240.Review: Absolutely a wonderful dining experience!!! Everything was fabulous!!!

Review241.Review: Every dish of the omakase menu was exquisite. Superlative white eel. Only minor negative is that we were told we had to vacate the table after 90 minutes. Seemed a bit tacky when we were paying over $300 for 2 people Nonetheless I love this place

Review242.Review: Food was very special and fresh. Really enjoyed our evening. Service was stellar

Review243.Review: Great omakase menu, high quality fish and sake. Great for a date night.

Review244.Review: Attentive service and the food was superb!

Review245.Review: Amazing Omakase! Service was great and the food was out of this world.

Review246.Review: Best sushi restaurant in San Francisco if not the entire state!

Review247.Review: The staff were accommodating of a last minute time change. Service was attentive without being obtrusive. The creativity of the pairings and presentation of each was on target. Pricey but I would return.

Review248.Review: Excellent sushi - exceptionally fresh.  Attentive and friendly service.  Great beverage selection.  Highly recommend, though the omakase-only price probably makes it more appropriate for a date night, business dinner, or special occasion.

Review249.Review: Not an everyday meal and quite a treat. Will be back for the next occasion that calls for something unique and special. Excellent food and refined service.

Review250.Review: We enjoyed a wedding anniversary lunch here.  Enjoyed omakase style dining and it was delicious.  Excellent service and food was brought out at a good pace.

Review253.Review: Equally amazing food and service. A special place. Thank you.

Review254.Review: Perhaps the best sushi restaurant i have ever been to….:)

Review255.Review: It was wonderful. Everything was fresh and tasty. Love love love.

Review256.Review: The omakase and service was great.

Review257.Review: Wow, one of the best flavour experiences in my life! Took the full lunch menu 🤤👍🏻

Review259.Review: Best sushi I’ve ever had. People should travel to San Francisco just to go to Akikos. Staff is incredible as well.

Review260.Review: Everything was spectacular - from service to food! We walked away happy and full!

Review261.Review: Wow. Once in a lifetime experience. The production was incredible. The synchrony of the staff and elegance was breathtaking. The cost was high… very high… but something that you absolutely should do at least once.

Review262.Review: Set menu, everything was absolutely delicious. Service was amazing, quality of fish was great. I 100% will be back.

Review263.Review: Unbelievable experience. We loved it. Will be hard to eat sushi again after this.

Review264.Review: Wow.  Experience exceeded my expectations.  The food was of exceptionally high standard and it is at the top of most great sushi restaurants in New York.   We can't wait to come back.

Review265.Review: Akiko was everything we hoped for. Every dish was expertly crafted. The flavors all worked. The experience was spendy but sublime.

Review266.Review: Akiko’s is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in SF. Great and friendly service. The sushi quality is outstanding. Go with the Omakase for the best experience.

Review267.Review: My favorite omakase experience - from food, drinks, service, to decor

Review268.Review: Muy mal producto por el precio pagado. $250 dólares por comensal por lo que sirven es muy caro.

Review269.Review: Best sushi in USA so far.  Excellent sake. Service was amazing.

Review271.Review: Food this good should be illegal.

Review272.Review: Amazing sushi and Omakase experience. Lots of attention to detail and presentation. Quality ingredients.

Review273.Review: One of the finest meals of my life.

Review274.Review: Fantastic Omakase lunch. Each course was in itself a work of art. The nigiri was fantastic and the rice was spot on. You have the ability to add a few extra pieces at the end and the uni was truly remarkable.

Review276.Review: Another amazing experience at Akiko's .  Highly recommended...can't wait to go in again soon.

Review277.Review: My husband and I had one of our most memorable (and expensive) meals ever at Akiko. After having trouble finding the restaurant (there’s no sign on the street), we stepped into a quiet and upscale dining experience that was as equally beautiful as it was delicious. We were blown away by the omakase tasting menu and even got chills several times while enjoying the amazing dishes. The drinks added up quickly so I would recommend skipping to keep costs down.

Review280.Review: Always amazing food here. Very attentive staff too

Review281.Review: Look forward to visiting Lee’s new location

Review282.Review: My lunch at Akiko’s was nothing short of spectacular!  Every dish packed full of harmonious flavor, and every bite of sushi fresh and unique.  The sushi Chef’s were charming and attentive, and the entire service was on point.  I’ll be back!

Review283.Review: Allen is the best and the food was magnificent.  Skip Jack tuna!

Review285.Review: Delish! My go to for fresh and inventive sushi

Review286.Review: Amazing food and service! Love coming here any chance I get!

Review288.Review: It’s just wow place. Amazing food. Just can’t imagine better sushi experience.

Review289.Review: seafood’s not fresh. I’ve had better toro at a sukiyaki place. Costco probably has better scallop. The texture of the shokupan is powdery and dense. Nigiris are served with the fish still cold, and for the ones lightly roasted, the temperature contrast in mouth is quite unpleasant. Sweet shrimp serve cooked, why??

Review290.Review: Incredible omakase! Service, sake pairings, everything was delicious and unique.

Review291.Review: Clean and nice space. Elevated service level. A very elegant experience and food was beautiful to look at and delicious flavor. Omakase only for now. I will be back again soon and looking forward to when they expand the menu to a la carte.

Review292.Review: Excellent restaurant. I went for an omakase lunch at the sushi counter which I recommend as each piece of sushi is made fresh. High quality lunch and reasonably priced for the food you're getting. I went alone and it was still a fun experience for me at the counter, speaking to Shin and learning about when the fish came from, his background etc. He is friendly and easy to talk to.  He is a chef from Kyoto and definitely knows how to prepare a delicious meal!

Review293.Review: Amazing food and excellent service. Very expensive.

Review294.Review: Staff was excellent and the food/sushi was next-level.

Review296.Review: We had the omakase dinner at the counter. Perfectly seasoned and prepared fresh fish.

Review297.Review: Every dish was amazing. Would definitely recommend!

Review298.Review: Wow, that was amazing experience. Everything was so delicious.

Review299.Review: Great service. Friendly staff. An artfully crafted dinner. It was delicious.

Review300.Review: Visiting Akiko’s again after 2.5 years of pandemic.  Last visit was in Dec 2019.  Still an amazing experience, maybe even better this time than previous trip.  Enjoyed their omakase offering on both occasions.  Each piece is unique and the fish quality is best-of-the-best.  Seven prepared dishes, followed by 10 or 11 nigiri. The toro speaks for itself, but the cherry blossom snapper and cherry smoked trout were also among many of the highlights.  The uni was top notch, got to try both long and short spined, incredible to compare the different profiles.  Allen was our server and he did a great job walking us through each dish, suggesting an amazing new sake to try.  They only offer the omakase right now, but have a few a la carte options to try at the end if you want to go back to anything from the omakase nigiri list or sample something new.  I love the atmosphere of this place.  Small, quiet, and comfortable.  We will be back again hopefully much sooner!

Review301.Review: Their ingredients were great and matched with the price tag. However, the skill of their chef was subpar. Almost feel like they were wasting their ingredient. The appetizers had too much seasoning and it was hard to taste the original flavors of the ingredient. The sushi rice was very sticky and destroyed the whole nigiri experience. They definitely need to work on the rice if they really want to be a top-tier Japanese restaurant in the area.

Review302.Review: Way too overpriced. Much better options for much less in the city

Review303.Review: An excellent omakase meal and great suggestions on sake pairings. The service was outstanding. We would definitely return.

Review304.Review: Amazing.  Just go.  The toro on toast with caviar was the BEST piece of sushi I have had in my entire life.  If I could I would come here every month.

Review305.Review: Amazing omakase meal! Tried some different types of seafood nigiri for the first time, and it all was great. The experience was so good. I only wish I had known that dinner was not a la carte; not that the food wasn't excellent, however, but the price was a bit of a shocker, as I was paying for three. Nevertheless, very friendly servers who explained each dish in detail and made the meal even more interesting.

Review306.Review: Took a new hire to dinner at Akiko’s. The food and the service were top-notch. The new omakase dinner menu has a lot of variety. Individual dishes were perfectly timed works of art. Highly recommend.

Review307.Review: It was one of the best meals of my life.  Amazing.

Review308.Review: This restaurant was a little hard to find but it’s super small and intimate. I took my sister here for her birthday while visiting out of town. The omakase experience was incredible. You can tell the chef’s put a lot of thought into the courses they’ve created here. It was an amazing experience and would love to return next time we’re in town.

Review309.Review: Food was sublime and service was warm and welcoming.

Review310.Review: The Omakase was simply exceptional. Inventive and beautifully elevated takes on Japanese dishes, and the sushi was on par with Tokyo - which I never thought I'd find.

Review311.Review: Every course was outstanding,and zeroing in on one I liked the best was difficult, but I picked one, and you will have your own best of the best. Lovely gourmet chef and restaurant professionals.

Review312.Review: The food was delicious, fresh, and creative. Impeccable, friendly service and relaxed atmosphere. Highly recommend! Will return.

Review313.Review: The food is exceptional both in inventiveness and freshness. It’s a pricy lunch, but worth it.

Review315.Review: Akikos Omakase menu was wonderful - every dish was excellent and the presentation was first class. Would recommend for any special occasion.

Review316.Review: Phenomenal experience every time we're here. Will definitely visit again

Review318.Review: Sushi and service were superb!  I’d come back again.

Review319.Review: Amazing. Delicious. A great experience and we look forward to going back again.

Review320.Review: El mejor restaurante japones fuera de JaponUn lugar al que ir, si te gusta la comida japonesa

Review322.Review: Amazing experience, amazing food , will definitely come back

Review323.Review: Delicious food, the shokupan was unreal.

Review324.Review: Staff was awesome A few of the best bites of seafood I’ve ever had

Review325.Review: Special experience. Allen served with great hospitality. Course was very original but sushi is absolutely full of Japanese taste. We will come back.

Review326.Review: Akiko's never disappoints, even in a pandemic! They are so kind with sushi/sashimi challenged folks like myself which provides a comfort when ordering. The host was so engaging and patiently walked my GF and I through each menu items. In the end, he just brought out dishes he thought we'd enjoy and paired them perfectly with our sake preferences. An absolutely amazing experience all around.

Review327.Review: Akiko’s nigiri and sashimi were the freshest we have had in a very long time. We will definitely be back again when we travel to San Francisco.

Review328.Review: Food was amazing. Intimate and nice alcove for dining.

Review329.Review: The atmosphere of Akiko's sushi restaurant was absolutely the best when it comes to different types of seafood straight from the Tsukiji market.  Might definitely come back if I'm in a mood to try something new.

Review330.Review: Always a fantastic experience and meal

Review331.Review: Phenomenal sushi for true sushi lovers. Would highly recommend!

Review332.Review: excellent sushi!  An excellent find for us as we eat sushi weekly at our local establishment.  Very fresh fish.  We do not eat rolls and didn't try anything else but their fresh fish of the day.

Review333.Review: This was hands down THE BEST meal I have ever had! Splurge on the omakase, it will not disappoint.

Review334.Review: Best sushi experience ever! Must try when in San Francisco

Review335.Review: Excellent dishes, loved the new omakase menu!

Review336.Review: The food was delicious. The establishment is on the smaller side but I don’t mind as I found it to be more intimate, especially if you’re bringing a date. I highly recommend going to this place!

Review337.Review: this place made the one and done list. the omakase was overpriced for the sushi rices was poor quality. they had a uni dish and seaweed on the side that they want you to make your own taco. I didn't pay $250 to make my meal. I expected it to be made ready to eat.overall not one of the best omakase places to dine at

Review338.Review: This is hands down one of the best sushi restaurants around. I can't write a long dissertation at this point; however, if you want to truly experience amazing food, service, ambionse then this is a must. We love this place in every aspect. Highly highly recommend it, especially the Omakase menu...

Review339.Review: Excellent service and food was fresh. Will go back.

Review340.Review: Unbelievable. The level of service was so personal and food was delicious.

Review341.Review: Simply amazing. One of the best omakase sushi experiences.

Review342.Review: Fantastic first anniversary dinner. The waiter was extremely knowledgeable- and suggested fantastic items. Had an amazing time. Quiet place with phenomenal atmosphere.

Review343.Review: One of the best omakase experiences I've had! Akiko's omakase starts with a number of appetizers that were each well thought out and executed wonderfully, with an essence of Kaiseki. The nigiri comes after, each fish prepared to highlight and enhance the flavor. Even the 'gari' (pickled ginger) was house made and wonderfully unique, since ever other sushi restaurant in the world serves it the same way. This really captured the essence and philosophy of omakase, which literally means 'To leave into one's hands' in Japanese but is more deeply about entrusting the chef to create a wonderful meal. It's truly about showing respect to the chef and likewise the chef honoring the diner with the best dining experience. This was a true omakase experience.

Review344.Review: wonderful service and food & drink recommendations by staff

Review345.Review: Most amazing sushi experience! The quality and freshness was off the hook. Most impressive was the innovative dishes

Review347.Review: Best Japanese food and sushi this side of Japan.   Never had a bad meal and love how Alan and his team always exceed all expectations.  A truly remarkable experience.  Reservations are a must!

Review348.Review: An amazing and sublime experience every time.

Review349.Review: Spectacular dining experience.The food was the best sushi I have experienced (and I know my sushi).Fresh, friendly, serene atmosphere. Fantastic fun on date night. Thank you Akiko's!

Review350.Review: one of the most delicious sushi meals we've had, and we've had many.

Review351.Review: One of my top food experiences. The food was delicious and the service impeccable.

Review353.Review: Great food and conversation with the staff. Staff was very attentive and friendly.

Review354.Review: I cant really comment at this time because my knees are buckled and Im  still in shock. Literally teared up. And Alan was pure genius.  You really need to experience it for yourself. End of line.

Review355.Review: Amazing quality of fish! So delicate, subtle and tasty!Great service, made excellent recommendations.The only downside: you will never want to go to your local sushi place after such an experience!It is a must!

Review356.Review: Excellent from beginning to the end both the food and service

Review357.Review: Omakase - 10 stars! We celebrated two big milestones and decided to splurge and treat ourselves. We chose Akiko’s to remember this day. Incredible service. Incredible food. A feast for the eyes, and all senses. We were getting more and more sad as we approached the bottom of the menu as we knew it was ending. It is pricey, but for a celebration, truly,  truly a treat.  Sake was amazing -  tip: ask the price first if you are being mindful of budget. An incredible meal. Chef Ray is outstanding.

Review358.Review: Thank you for a very nice dinner.  We enjoyed ourselves

Review359.Review: We had one of the most amazing dining experiences for my husband's birthday. The Omakase was outstanding!!! The food and service was exceptional. One of our favorite spots in all of SF!

Review360.Review: well sequenced omakase with excellent ingredients and preparation

Review361.Review: Not just Sushi.  True Japanese experience.  Excellent!

Review362.Review: I googled “Best sushi in San Francisco”, and Akiko came up. Yes this is the best sushi in San Francisco

Review363.Review: Delicious and beautifully presented food.  Super service.  Food came out at a nice pace. Nice wine selection.

Review364.Review: Always beyond exceptional!!! Hands down the best sushi / Omakase restaurant in SF! Number one place I refer people and bring guests/clients from out of town. Thank you Akiko’s

Review365.Review: An outstanding experience! Sat at the sushi counter and ordered the tasting menu. Extravagant, beautiful and delicious! The staff are all charming - from the front door to behind the counter.   Such a fun dining experience ... and one of our first indoors post-COVID. A treat all the way around.

Review367.Review: My fiancé (now wife!) and I went here during our honeymoon and had the omakase and oh my god (eh)! It was a truly fantastic meal and the sushi chefs and wait staff were very friendly and made the whole thing a very fun experience. The omakase is not cheap, I will warn you, but the quality and overall experience was worth it we felt like. We would both place it among the best meals we have every had in our lives. So, if you are a fan of sushi and want to do something really special, splurge on the omakase here and you will have a memory and story to tell for quite some time!

Review368.Review: Fantastic meal with amazing service. Sushi and food was top notch and high quality with service to back it up. Went for my father's 65th birthday and had my pregnant wife with me. Obviously there was not a lot she could eat, but the server made an extra effort to recommend and helped course the meal out for her as the rest of the party did the omakase. Definitely will come back for other special and even just a casual occasion.

Review369.Review: This place is high end sushi and expensive, i go there once a week after work and i end up paying between $350 and $450 per person with tax and tip. if i return it is because of the fish quality and the staff skills. It is a true journey about sensation, i am not even sure it is about food... so if you want to eat, go somewhere else, if you want to be taken into a olfactory journey, a craft and art experience, than, this might be one of your spot.if you enjoy refined sake, you may also find some that would match your taste, ask the sommelier, the staff is very competent and that is not the usual in San Francisco.If you sit at the bar and are lucky to have a clever chef, you may even have a very nice culinary teaching at the same time!

Review370.Review: The restaurant is clean, chic and understated.  The Omakase menu was a curated selection from the sea.  Pairings were thoughtful, unique and perfectly prepared.  The presentation of each dish was beautiful and reverent.  Some of the best flavor combinations I have ever had.  Chris is a sake sommelier as I had never experienced with a friendly affability that elevated a restaurant dinner to a meal with friends.

Review371.Review: Had the omakase - pricy, but excellent and well worth the money.  Service was outstanding.  Highly recommend.

Review372.Review: Just absolutely perfect. From the moment you walk in to the moment of walking out- everything is top level. The best experience always.

Review373.Review: a fine high end sushi place in downtown SF, one of my favorite in the city.service impeccable, friendly and classy staff, nice set up.the omakaze was really amazing, starting with several delicate dishes, non sushi then several one piece nigiri with usual fishes but artfully crafted.with a couple glass of sake and tip i ended up paying about $400 so this is a pricey place.

Review374.Review: The food was outstanding. Period. We chose the tasting menu and it noticeably did not have a price mentioned. My fault for not inquiring. I'll just say that is was a bit more expensive that I could have possibly imagined...

Review375.Review: Definitely an experience! Each dish in the Omakase menu was like a delicious work of art. Excellent service and ambiance as well.

Review376.Review: Amazing food. Great service. Cool ambiance. Well selected sake. Gotta do the Omakase. It’s pricey, but it’s worth it. Great experience, would save up and do it again.

Review379.Review: The staff was wonderful. The food was amazing. We can’t wait to go back!

Review381.Review: Very cozy and intimate setting. Food was incredible! Pricy but makes sense why

Review382.Review: Great convo and amazing omakase amongst friends. Needed this!

Review383.Review: Very nice place for Japanese food. Omasake is amazing and the service is top notch.

Review384.Review: So glad Akiko's reopened. They have the best sushi in San Francisco and the service is impeccable!

Review385.Review: We had the Omakase tasting menu and it was fabulous. Amazing presentation and just the right amount of food to feel satisfied. Ambiance was great, restaurant was quiet, you really got to appreciate your surroundings. Great sake recommendation by the waiter. All and all I would recommend this restaurant to all my family and friends.

Review386.Review: The quality is unparalleled, the service is immaculate. The omakase took us on a journey and we loved every minute of it!

Review387.Review: Amazing food and service! Ambiance was perfect.

Review388.Review: This is the best sushi restaurant. The taste of the food, presentation, staff, ambiance, etc. literally everything is wonderful here. Highly recommend.

Review389.Review: Outstanding! One of the best sushi restaurants in SF.

Review391.Review: We enjoyed a fabulous dinner this past week at Akikos. I had been to Akikos a year ago but we ordered off the menu at that time. I wasn’t prepared for the Omakase meal as an only option (nor the high price) but it was the most delicious and memorable meal I’ve had in a very long time. I’m a fussy sushi fan so many things (too fishy) are out for me. Every single presentation was beyond superb and delicious and  plated on varied artistic china and stoneware. This is a very special restaurant with an unbelievable chef and most accommodating staff that make your feel welcome and like royalty. One hundred percent worth the value! Bravo!

Review392.Review: One of my go-to sushi spots for high quality service and food. Tonight did not disappoint!

Review393.Review: Beautiful and delicious meal!  The Omakase menu was perfect for a friend’s birthday meal.  Not too much to food as we had worried it might have been when we ordered. It was just perfection in every bite even to the very last bite for dessert.

Review395.Review: Muy buenos los rollos y los nigiris. El servicio excelente

Review396.Review: Exceptional food, service and ambiance. Our server was helpful at making suggestions for sake and sushi choices.

Review397.Review: This is the bests sushi I had ever!Endo was amazing! He is so caring and nice to usThe fish was so fresh, excellent quality.You have to try it!!

Review398.Review: Akiko's is pricey, but the food and presentation is absolutely fabulous. The chef's take on sushi is original and delicious.

Review399.Review: Server was super perceptive.  Naturally friendly.

Review400.Review: The food and service were outstanding!!!  This place is a gem!

Review401.Review: Little hidden gem! Fantastic omakase with loads of buttery, zesty delights to your palate.Can tailor to your low/ no carb diet easily. And prompt service. It can get pricey 😊, yes. Absolutely delightful!

Review402.Review: Akiko's on Bush St. is a wonderful place for lunch or dinner. The sushi is top quality and includes varieties I've not found in other Sushi Bars around the country. It is definitely High-end.Service is great: attentive without interrupting; always helpful & courteous. The owner, or the person I believe to be the owner, usually visits the tables and makes sure the guests are well cared for. He patiently answers questions about the menu and gives recommendations when asked.Hint: bring your wallet. The unique fare and amazing plating does come with a cost. But definitely worth it for the taste and experience.

Review403.Review: Easily one of the best sushi you can get in SF!

Review404.Review: Best sushi ever; we tríed allí ítems in  Nama selection menú : excelent !!!

Review405.Review: Special place. Always new and unique sushi menu items and the sushi is always the freshest. Sushi chefs are always so knowledgeable. Sitting at the bar is highly recommended.

Review406.Review: Wonderful experience - the sushi is so fresh and masterfully prepared. Ask your server for recommendations and follow their lead. Small space but big tastes. Truly the best sushi I’ve eaten anywhere in the world.

Review407.Review: I had the $150 Omakase which consisted of very little sushi/sashimi and most dishes were either cooked or seared. I was very disappointed in the quality of the fish, especially given the very high price of the meal. The uni aa nothing special and a fried Parmesan nigiri was very unappealing. Also I was totally disgusted watching the sushi chefs throw order tickets on top of pieces of nigiri before they left the sushi bar. I don’t know where that paper has been, and certainly don’t want it on top of my $26 nigiri.

Review408.Review: Exceptional food, service and ambiance! My fave sushi place in the city!

Review409.Review: Stunning sushi, immaculate presentation, faultless service. This is the best of the best.

Review410.Review: Took much longer to get out

Review411.Review: 1st time we dined here  was about  18 months ago and the entire experience - ambiance, food, service and comfort were off the charts wonderful. We spent about $500 for the experience. Our waiter was very inquisitive about  our expectations - at first this was not appreciated but it really worked out. He ordered for us  and the food was spectacular. Easily  my best sushi/Japanese experience in SF. Unfortunately we went for a return recently for my wife's  birthday and other than the same $500 expense the experience was meh. There were some hits  - the mature yellowtail and dungenous crab whip with shaved white truffles. But there some real duds (baby eels with ponzu - yuck) and the rest mostly meh.The real downer  was the ambiance. We sat in the back  and could smell the bathroom cleaners/oDorizers. Yuck. And our waitress was nothing like the guy we had previously - curt and not at all helpful. We will  likely try one more time but with a keep it simple(r).

Review412.Review: Quite pricey for what it offers.  The chef has a tendency to season most of the nigiri sushi thus unable to taste the original fresh taste of the fish, don't like that.

Review415.Review: Our dinner at Akiko's was the best dining experience during our recent trip to San Francisco. I am not even sushi lover. I booked it based off strong recommendations for my husband, but I loved the dinner myself. Linda, our server, felt like a great friend guiding up through the meal and she didn't steer us wrong at any turn. I love the intimate nature of the restaurant with only a handful of table and the bar. Plus, there is enough on the menu for non-sushi goers. The Black Cod was to-die for. I will be certain to go back on our next adventure in San Francisco.

Review418.Review: I had a wonderful experience at Akiko’s. The service was great, and the food and preparation couldn’t have been better. We were seated at a nice table by the window.
