The fish that was served was very fresh and delicious, delivered from Japan. It was a great spot for a date. Would absolutely go again.

Review419.Review: Outstanding food and service as always; recommend sushi bar!

Review421.Review: Akikos was excellent.  The specials and expert wait staff made our evening wonderful.

Review422.Review: It was such a phenomenal tasting experience. You can have a business meeting, a date or a get together of friends for a spectacular meal!Service was superb. You will not be disappointed!

Review424.Review: The food was phenomenal and the staff exceptional. This was a great culinary experience and I would be thrilled to dine here again. Definitely an experience!

Review425.Review: We enjoyed the food and service! Excellent sashimi and tasting menu options!

Review426.Review: Excellent nigiri and very friendly/helpful service. We would definitely go back!

Review427.Review: Ordered omakase and requested to sit at the bar. They brought all our sushi out on one plate rather than piece by piece like most restaurants. They chef didn’t pay any attention to us the entire time and instead served only the couple next to us.This is the second time I’ve been here and this was a uniquely bad experience.

Review428.Review: My favorite place for fresh sushi and rolls where the ingredients and service are always first rate.

Review429.Review: Never disappoints. It’s always such a different experience from other omakase

Review430.Review: By far some of the best sushi I've had in 5+ years in SF.

Review431.Review: Our server was knowledgeable and offered guidance with our choices.  The food exceeded our expectations.  When we found out there was a special sushi roll (chef's choice) we ordered it as well as a small bite that was also not on the menu and everything was exceptional.  Pricy but what you'd expect with the quality and innovation.

Review432.Review: Tip top as usual. Fantastic menu with many uncommon offerings of the highest quality- barracuda, gizzard chad, Russian uni, trigger fish- with superb presentation and excellent service. Prepare to pay for it, but you’ll have a fantastic meal and experience.

Review433.Review: Far and away the best sushi in the United States! I have dreams about eating here again!!!

Review434.Review: excellent sushi but way to pricey...expect $250+ per couple

Review435.Review: Food was incredible. Expensive, but incredible. Our waitress was warm and helped us with the menu. Great experience

Review436.Review: Incredible food and service. Do expect to pay for ot though.

Review437.Review: My partner and I really enjoyed the food tonight. The quality of the fish is always exceptional here. And our server was great. However, we were very disappointed when we saw the receipt because one of the dishes was charged $1 more per piece of nigiri. We had four of this piece. Akiko is my favorite restaurant of all time in SF. Whenever I'm in town, I've been religiously visiting Akiko alone or with friends. All of my friends have become huge Akiko's fans. I can't believe this type of error was going on and I was the only one to catch it. I have a pretty good memory and if I hadn't closely read the receipt, we would have been charged extra. This isn't about the expensiveness of the dish but about the principle of trust and paying attention to detail, which is fundamental to why I chose to eat at Akiko's. Unfortunately, neither one was there tonight and I am disappointed and feel defeated.

Review438.Review: The omakase set didn’t worth the price. Nigiri was great.

Review440.Review: Wonderful, every bite is a piece of heaven! Really excellent chefs, top notch fish, and very friendly staff. Fantastic place. Our favourite in SF.

Review441.Review: Very good but not great enough to justify the price!

Review442.Review: Very overpriced sushi. Monkfish was good but besides that  not worth the price

Review443.Review: Incredibly fresh and well-prepared fish. Lovely setting and attentive staff.  Perfect.

Review444.Review: Today I had lunch at Akiko with my colleague. We sat at the sushi bar and asked one of the chefs to pick out the sashimi and sushi. Just fantastic melt in your mouth!!The best sushi in SF!

Review445.Review: Sushi tasting menu the best in the Bay Area. Innovative and unique!

Review447.Review: The best sushi place I’ve been to.   It’s a must!!

Review448.Review: Great quality of fish. We sat at the sushi bar and ordered directly to our chef. The waygu beef with truffle is just a must. It was a little more pricey than expected due to their sushi being priced by piece vs the usual 2 piece but very worth it. Exceeded my expectations by far.

Review449.Review: Great steak entree and the freshest fish. Many selections and waitress was helpful. Thoroughly enjoyed our dinner.

Review450.Review: Top quality sushi and sashimi in an intimate space. Definitely need to make a reservation, this is popular with locals and visitors alike and there are no empty tables.

Review451.Review: Exceptional.  Almost a favorite and I will definitely be back!

Review452.Review: Maybe the best sushi I’ve ever had. Will go back for sure! Great place for a special occasion, date, or business lunch

Review453.Review: We had a reservation and were sat within minutes of arrival.  Very friendly service and very knowledgeable.  We had the Omakase (chefs choice) every dish was presented and explained.  The sushi quality and presentation blew my mind.   I’m from Michigan and I so wish we can have this quality too.   Over all on the expensive but it’s in S.F.   I would have to say so well worth it!   I’m still dreaming about the yellow tail , Tuna toro and Uni (sea urchin).  Yum!!!

Review454.Review: This is the best sushi bar in Dan Francisco. The prices do reflect that so we only go on special occasions but find it fabulous.

Review455.Review: One is the best sushi experiences ever.  Can’t wait to come back.

Review456.Review: The sushi was surprising but very delicious! Many of the sushi is already seasoned so soy sauce is not necessary. Unique!

Review457.Review: This restaurant was an absolute pleasant surprise. We had no idea what to expect and it turned out to be one of the best Japanese restaurants we ever experienced. The meal and the service was superb

Review458.Review: Akiko's has wonderful food and service.   I had two friends frrom out of town as guests & they agreed it was the best Japanese sushi/sashimi they had ever had.  Five stars!!!

Review459.Review: Spending almost $500.00 for two people is way to much to spent for the food we experienced. We left hungry. Sad to say this.

Review460.Review: We made a reservation at this restaurant while visiting San Francisco. We ordered the Omakase menu, and while the food was good @ $150 p/p we have had better quality and more creative dishes. The Chef was friendly and that helped.Also, the fact that the restaurant told us that because we made reservations on line (through Open Table) vs. calling the restaurant directly we were told we could not have a table and could only be seated at the bar by the front door, which was a bit uncomfortable with people in/out all the time - did I mention it was a chilly night

Review461.Review: Absolutely best sushi in Bay Area!! Great little space well thought out, service I’m incredible.Most importantly sushi is top tier and I eat sushi quite often. Normally go to Sushi Ran Sausalito this is just as good if not better!

Review463.Review: I like it. I will go again

Review464.Review: It was an amazing experience! I would definitely recommend

Review465.Review: Fresh fresh fresh! Clean presentation. Good service. Will return!

Review466.Review: Absolutely amazing meal. A must go if your sushi lover.

Review467.Review: Fantastic nigiri / sashimi menu with tons of options.  Hot items were excellent as well.

Review468.Review: Best sushi in SF - a treat!

Review469.Review: The best sushi in San Francisco.

Review470.Review: Very fresh and wonderful sushi. Service and sake were superb. It is on a pricey side, but it is SF after all, some might get a sticker shock, so bring your 401K or work-money, and go nuts.Definitely do a bar for omakase, and you will not regret it (be sure to make reservations)Finding parking around this place is a treat in itself :) Just take uber/lyft/cab/bus/scooter the food, sake and service absolutely worth it (it is not your every day indulgence)

Review471.Review: We were late, We walked all the way to Akiko Sushi Bar instead. I called them 7 minutes after my reservation to let them know. By the time we found the correct place, we were 30 minutes late!  The host was understanding and was able to accommodate us less than 10 minutes after our arrival. Well worth all the walking around in SF!  The sushi, esp the nigiri was excellent. High quality sushi. Excellent service. It is pricey, so you may want to consider for special occasion or date. However, if you are looking for high quality sushi, this is the place!  We will be back!

Review473.Review: Very overpriced for what you get. And unless you know sushi like a pro, you won't know why it's so much more money than other places. Needless to say, I had to get a burrito after to be full.

Review474.Review: Amazing!  The service was splendid. The servers were not only super friendly but well versed on the menu.  The quality of the fish was too-rated. RECOMMEND TO ANYONE WHO APPRECIATES GREAT SUSHI.

Review475.Review: The service and food were impeccable! Will definitely be returning again.

Review476.Review: Really excellent! Would be back again next time in San Fran. They have drag in season Japanese fish.

Review477.Review: Great food, wonderful chef who made every single guest feel at home. When I told him about one of my favorite fishes, Katsuo he told me just wait because it’s being prepared in the kitchen right now. Outstanding sanma, kawahagi, akamutsu and buri. Highly recommend for a quality lunch or dinner.

Review478.Review: Our overall impression was that we were being rushed.  The food was  good but the artistic presentation usually associated with high end sushi was lacking.

Review479.Review: Fantastic selection of fish, great presentation and superb customer service. This was a sushi meal to remember.

Review480.Review: Great staff, amazing food. We did the chefs selection. It was expensive but worth it!

Review481.Review: Everything was amazing. The food was great. Service was excellent. I would recommend this place to everyone.

Review482.Review: The food was amazing.  The service and ambiance was fair.  After waiting 15 minutes past our reservation time, without being offered anything, we were seated at the front of the restaurant.  Due to the continuous opening and closing of the door, it was freezing cold.  It would be OK if the rest of the restaurant was like that but the back main seating area was wonderful.  So there were completely separate feelings depending on where you sat.  Also, for the price of the food, our server was not as knowledgeable about the sushi and I don't feel like we received the level of service deserved.  Because of the large number of sushi restaurants in the area, I likely would not go back to this one.

Review483.Review: FANTASTIC food ... best sushi we've had. Sit where Allen Lee can guide you and eat whatever he recommends. Phenomenal food and experience.

Review484.Review: It is a nice experience, but there are better sushi restaurants in SF like Kusakabe whose sushi is excellent.

Review485.Review: Adorable little restaurant with the best sushi we have found in the Bay Area.

Review486.Review: Absolut recommendation.  My wife an I found it thru Internet reviews close to our hotel. We told the waiter we were not so hungry, we wanted sushi only and that he shoud suprise us. AND HE DID! Great sushi, fantastic quality and good sake.

Review487.Review: My go to sushi place in the city. Love the fish and quality. It’s expensive but it’s because it’s super high quality.

Review488.Review: The food was pretty good. Fresh fish and good flavors (nothing overwhelming). Wasn't melt in your mouth amazing but everything tasted delicious.

Review489.Review: Setting was  intimate while energetic. The service was elegant. Was fun for first date to try new  experiences.

Review490.Review: Everything tasted fresh, with a good selection of sashimi and nigiri. Excellent friendly service. Warm saki was smooth with pleasant notes. Highly recommend Akiko’s!

Review492.Review: The omakase was very overpriced for what it was - wouldn't do the omakase again here. Also, meal was very rushed (paid the bill after 70 minutes for a 16 course meal). Told staff that we felt rushed and they apologized but said that the chef likes to have the coursing that way, which seems odd.

Review493.Review: Great restaurant, had the omakase for my wife’s birthday and we loved it.

Review494.Review: So goood sushis !Fresh fish, good service. A very good restaurant I recommend.

Review495.Review: Wonderful everything, including the incredibly attentive staff. It is hands down our new favorite place for sushi in...the U.S!

Review496.Review: Food and service was excellent.  We both had the Omakase.  Agree with other reviewers that a few of the dishes contained unique fish that you cannot get at other sushi restaurants.   However, we both thought the Omakase was a little over priced, hence 4 out of 5 stars.

Review497.Review: Akiko's is outstanding.  The best sushi i have had in San Francisco and the bar is set very high.

Review498.Review: There simply is no better place for sushi in the city.

Review499.Review: Amazing omakase. Loved the United. Added Wagyu beef with black truffle. Can’t wait to come back. Service was impeccable.

Review500.Review: Awesome I highly recommend this restaurant and look forward to returning again!

Review501.Review: Wonderful experience! The manager/greeter was fantastic, she was so attentive and welcoming, and it really helped make the experience more enjoyable. The sushi chefs were great to chat to, and the food was sublime. My favourite place to eat in SF. Thanks!

Review502.Review: Went here with my wife and we both ordered the Chef Choice Omakase. We both felt that all the dishes were very beautifully plated but overall lacked flavor. The 18 courses is very rushed, they bring 3 different plates at any given time and the flavors of each course given aren’t complimentary. You get the sense that they are just trying to get you to finish the omakase as fast as possible. I enjoy wasabi on nigiri but the chef was very heavy handed on all the nigiris, their were times where I was watching my wife struggle with her burning nose because of the amount of wasabi. I overall liked the variety of the fish and was pleased with the plating but I would go elsewhere next time for an omakase experience.

Review503.Review: Our dining experience at Akiko’s was superb. Our server was very passionate about the fish being served and her customer service skills were exceptional 👌🏻.  My fiancé and I ordered omakase ($150 each), and we were extremely satisfied with the dishes the chef put together. The food was decadent, creative and tasty. We will definitely be coming back because of these reasons.

Review504.Review: Phenomenal. We came once over a year ago and wanted to come back. Was not disappointed.

Review505.Review: Amazing omakase and the most friendly and professional staff.

Review506.Review: Great time at the sushi counter

Review507.Review: Omokase was excellent. I loved how they gave you some courses from the kitchen as part of the Omokase before getting into pure sushi. Loved everything about it. Had an excellent Napa Chardonnay as well.

Review508.Review: The best and most creative sushi in town. Lunch at the bar was an hour of bliss. Leave your soy sauce and wasabi for someone else and feast on the freshest there is, inventively prepared. Greens also were exceptional.

Review509.Review: Top notch sushi with friendly and attentive service.It’s not cheap but it’s worth it.

Review510.Review: The place was excellent but there was a fly or two constantly hovering our table.

Review511.Review: Great and fresh fish, everything is very tasty.  Friendly server, will definitely return again and again.

Review512.Review: Possibly the top sushi restaurant in the country.  Impeccable service.  Omikase out of this world.

Review513.Review: The best sushi we have ever had including in Tokyo, NYC and LA. Extensive choice of rarely seen fish, presented with unique touches and ingredients. Service was impeccable and Akiko’s has a great sake list. Recommend the Uni ( both kinds), freshwater eel,  sea bream and Ikura. You will enjoy the food so much you are likely to keep ordering and have a pretty good bill to show for it. Well worth every $ and more. Book well in advance as it is a small restaurant.

Review514.Review: This place is incredible and worth every penny! Linda made our experience a memorable one. She knew the menu and specialties very well!! Definitely will be thinking about this meal for a while and highly recommend everyone to stop there and enjoy.

Review515.Review: Very good food, good service. Restaurant was loud but otherwise good experience

Review516.Review: Average sushi. Rolls were well below average. For the price they charge, the food should be better

Review518.Review: Sushi at a whole now level. Sublime

Review519.Review: Everything was great, worth a visit. They had sushi that were not on menus at other restaurants.

Review520.Review: Sit at the sushi bar and give the omakase a go.  It’s absolutely worth it - even for lunch!

Review521.Review: Always a treat to visit this fine restaurant.  The food and presentation are superb and the service is excellent.

Review522.Review: Lovely experience. We had the omakase and it was absolutely worth the cost

Review524.Review: Food was excellent. Each dish presented nicely. Service was polite and very good. Always predictably very good place to lunch.

Review525.Review: Food and service were both good.  No acknowledgement of our anniversary was a bit of a disappointment, but still a functional meal.

Review527.Review: I have gone to this restaurant over several years.  It started out more traditional Japanese menu but now is focused more on Sushi and Sashimi.  Delicious and fresh.  It feels much more like special  and memorable dining experience.

Review528.Review: I’ve been coming here for decades, and it never disappoints. Some of the best sushi in San Francisco.

Review529.Review: The food here is outstanding and I highly recommend going. Only a few issues, our service was not great for the price, I expect better service for what we paid. Second, the place is small. Come for the food and and sit at the sushi bar if you can. Get the raw wagyu.

Review530.Review: Really ninice food, unfortunately we had to wait 30 mins for our table even though we arrived on time for our booking. A complimentary drink would have been appreciated.

Review531.Review: Good food but service was honestly too much. Cleared the plates before we were done. The tables were so close to each other that we had a hard time having a conversation above the people next to us. Food was good but overpriced. Everything felt like such a big fuss. Why is it so difficult to get good Japanese food without all the pretentiousness in SF?

Review532.Review: Linda was awesome and really knowledgeable about the food! Everything was delicious, highly recommend!

Review533.Review: Nice ambiance. Food was good, except one plate we took. Weird smell in the whole place. Waiters were polite and respectful.

Review534.Review: I'm lucky that Akiko's is close by my office, it is consistently exceptional

Review535.Review: If you get stuck by the door you’ll be cold and if you ask them to close the door, they will tell you they can’t because back is warm.

Review536.Review: Outstanding experience, service was great and food superb!

Review537.Review: Absolutely I would recommend this restaurant.  Fabulous food.  So fresh.  So innovative.  And a lovely ambiance.  Great sake.  I wish I lived closer I would definitely do there again when I can.  The house roll was excellent and one of the specials of the day was salmon with truffles.  Excellent!

Review538.Review: The best rolls and sashimi I've ever had -- and I've had very good sushi before! Akiko's takes you to an entirely different level and it's all exceptional. The staff is helpful, warm and always smiling. You feel welcomed the very moment you walk into Akiko's. And when it comes time to leave, you will only want to come right back. Request a table up front or at the bar for the best experience. And definitely make a reservation! The restaurant was packed on Monday night at 7 PM and many folks without reservations had to be turned away. If you are in San Francisco and you want to enjoy a superb sushi experience, Akiko's is the best place to go.

Review539.Review: I have been coming to Akiko’s since 1998.  I always order sashimi and it is the best I have ever had, in the US.  This time I introduced my children to sushi.  But they eat nigiri and I was unaware that the sushi chef put a dash of Wasabi under the fish.  My kids were surprised by this and it made for a difficult evening trying to get them to trust me when ordering.  I was unaware that this was the practice because the fish is the best.They liked the sushi.  I still love the place.

Review540.Review: Best sushi I’ve ever had. Everything was so fresh!

Review541.Review: Could be one of the best meals I've ever had.  Omakase is a splurge but worth it!

Review542.Review: It was such a pleasant experience sitting at the bar, talking with our sushi chef and the plater, preparing the dishes coming out of the kitchen. The fish is so super fresh and top-quality - it simply melts in your mouth. I've eaten a lot of sushi and this is easily one of the best...

Review543.Review: Amazing fish, very cool dishes, service extremely attentive, overall a great experience.  The only thing I would say is that it is expensive, but then again they're getting the fish directly from Japan.  Definitely worth a try.

Review544.Review: Excellent food, great service, unusual selection of sashimi -- very fresh.  My favorite sushi restaurant in San Francisco.  Expensive -- but the value is definitely there!

Review545.Review: We ordered Omakase or chef's choice and it was amazing. We asked for no sea urchin and that request was honored. Delicious sushi in  beautiful arrangements. Very pleased with our 2nd time there.

Review546.Review: Very discrete resto that has been shared from a foodie friend. If you are 2 dinning, definitely eat at the sushi bar, as the experice is more fun than at a regular table, you will get your sushi freshly done and ready to eat right in front of you. Also, experience a nice bottle of Sake to embrace the full experience. The staff is very knowledgeable, they will recommend the best related to your taste.

Review547.Review: Amazing, interesting, and fresh fish.  Absolutely wonderful service.  A real gem.

Review548.Review: They always make you feel so welcome THE BEST SZuSHI in San Francisco for sure!

Review549.Review: Still some of the freshest tastiest fish in SF.Excellent service, a great dining experience.We try to eat here as often as possible.Can’t miss!

Review550.Review: Amazing! Our favorite sushi place in tkwn

Review551.Review: Some of the best sushi I’ve had. Omakase or bust.

Review552.Review: For a restaurant trying to position itself as a high end sushi restaurant, this place fails with the most basic aspect.  We sat at the counter and had omakase; unfortunately the food was inconsistent at best.  Many warm dishes coming out lukewarm; the shari (the rice) of sushi temperature was inconsistent from cold to properly warm.  At a restaurant like this at this price point, expecting consistency shouldn’t be an unreasonable request

Review553.Review: Best in the city. Well worth the investment. Sit at the bar and get the best the chefs have.

Review554.Review: We ordered chawan mushi and its v v small maybe  only 3 cm of chawan mushi in a small bowl and its a ripped off 12 usd dollar .. we ordered without the seafood and still charge for full.price for chawanmushi

Review555.Review: Great experience. Attentive and friendly service, great food and environment!

Review556.Review: Service was very good as the waitress made detailed explanations of the menu, which changed daily for the daily specials. The sashimi was fantastic - a real delicacy of halibut, king salmon, two types of tuna and sea bream.

Review558.Review: big fan.one of the better sushi spots in the area. Tucked in a hidden spot, good quality ingredients and available for lunch. Will be going again

Review559.Review: Wonderful quality and unbelievable taste cushion, excellent service plus servers made on point suggestions.   Truly a memorable experience which well exceeded our expectations

Review560.Review: Miso soup, Otoro, Magura, yellowtail, salmon, snow crab, wagyu/truffle... try it all. 5* visit and experience every time.

Review561.Review: Poor execution on the sushi rolls.  Missing ingredients, unbalanced distribution, rolls were not tight. Also, not much variety in rolls on the menu; they all had about the same ingredients them.For all they hype I expected this to be my new go-to.  Nope.

Review562.Review: Expected much higher quality food and ambience for the kind of price they were charging. Had the $150 per pax Omakase for 16 dishes. 8 cooked small bites and 8 nigiri. Small bites were pretty disappointing while the nigiri was nothing to shout about (vinegar in the rice was overpowering). Service felt extremely rushed and everything was served non-stop (nigiris were 3 at one go rather than piece by piece) - unsure if this was because we weren't seated at the counter. Felt like we were being ushered out too quickly without proper time to enjoy the dining expetience.

Review563.Review: Impeccable service and delicious food. Can’t believe it’s taken so long to find this gem!

Review564.Review: The service is unparalleled. The food, plating, timing...all top notch and high quality!

Review565.Review: I have been to the restaurant before but this time was so disappointing, the cod been over cooked and marinated.  I ordered Salmon roll and 2 pieces only has avocado no salmon inside at all.  Nigiri over salted couldn’t taste the fish at all.

Review566.Review: Quality and level of the food and service were both top notch!!!!! I highly recommend this restaurant!

Review567.Review: This is my favorite sushi place. I have been going for years. The owner and staff are wonderful.

Review570.Review: The chef was not serious about his sushi. He was drinking Jamba Juice while making sushi??? And he got some altitude I think. I will never come back.

Review571.Review: The quality of the food was simply outstanding. Best sushi restaurant I have been in years.

Review573.Review: Really a top top top tier restaurant,  everything is amazing: food,  staff,  service,  intimate environment. Our 2nd   meal and just relied on recommendations from our wait person. Already thinking about next visit.

Review574.Review: The food was so amazing and delicious! Had the best nigiri sushi ever! As a constant traveller to Japan, this place totally equaled, if not succeeded, the nigiris there. I think the reason why they haven’t score a star is because their poor service. The waitress for our table were very cold and rude for no reason. Our waitress look like she was so mad for the 2 hours that we were there for. Thankfully, the servers were very nice and attentive. At the end, our bill was $480 for 2 people (we did order the omakase and some extra nigiris). Overall, I think this restaurant had great potential.

Review575.Review: Excelente la comida y el servicio. El espacio es algo reducido pero el ambiente es agradable.

Review576.Review: There’s nothing like their omakase menu. It’s pricey, but you won’t be disappointed.

Review577.Review: Pole position at Akiko's for a late leisurely business lunch is always a treasured experience for me and my guests. One-on-one conversation punctuated by moments of culinary wonder always resets my humanity and punctuates the calendar. Simply no better way to express an emotional connection or commitment to another person. Love and appreciate your partner? Enjoy the sakuramasu together! Want to close that deal with your favorite client? Challenge them to the flight of three types of Uni! Want to broaden the horizons of your finicky teenager? Present them with a piece of Akimi!  Free form Omakase only.  Bring your trust fund.

Review578.Review: Returned after several years hoping the service would have improved - 10 minutes between the arrival of my friends’ lunch and mine - they seemed not to notice or find this odd in any way

Review579.Review: The food was amazing. The staff friendly and helpful. The location great. A real treasure. It’s expensive but worth it.

Review580.Review: Akiko's  is a a true gem. The menu features the best and freshest ingredients and everything is presented artistically. Delicious and delightful! A rare treat.

Review581.Review: Akiko's has the best sushi I've ever had. Hands down.

Review582.Review: We had the Omakase which was great and an Uni Tasting, espectacular.

Review583.Review: Great place for lunch - very high quality sushi and sashimi - a little on the expensive side but worth it - highly recommend it!

Review584.Review: This was my second time at Akikos and I cannot wait to go back! I’ve never been an uni fan and my opinion is forever changed thanks to our waitress’ recommendation. The miso black cod was to die for! Best I’ve ever had from an upscale sushi restaurant. Overall phenomenal experience to start off a fun Friday night!

Review585.Review: Amazing food.  Server could have been a little more knowledgeable on menu and recommendations.

Review587.Review: Best sushi in SF!  So glad to have a restaurant that does not require omakase and allows me to choose the fish I'd like to eat.

Review588.Review: Outstanding in all respects, from food quality to presentation, the experience was memorable!

Review589.Review: Never fails. Absolutely the best sushi in the city! Wagyu beef was also melt in your mouth amazing.

Review591.Review: Came here for my birthday, ordered Omakase with a couple extra nigiri. We overheard a table next to us scoff at the price of the Omakase, but I would absolutely go back! The combination of flavors and textures is so spot on and we loved everything that was given to us. We even lucked out and got a dish twice! Not sure if it was on purpose but it was very much appreciated. If you order omakase, wait till after to decide if you want anything else on the menu. My partner and I were happy-full after our meal.

Review592.Review: Amazing quality of fish, especially enjoy nama menu

Review593.Review: This is some of the best nigiri I've ever had.  We didn't do omakaze so we could choose the fish, we liked the fatty tuna so much we ordered it twice.Great place, most of the rolls come with a nice sticky brown rice instead of white which is an interesting change, its surprisingly not that different but gives a slightly different texture.We had some old toxic jerk older businessmen next to us talking about making out with chicks in Marin and generally being annoying but there's not much the restaurant can do about that.The decor is super nice and its a really small and quiet restaurant in general.

Review594.Review: Not the best sushi for the price. Glad I tried it but won't be back.

Review595.Review: One of the best sushi restaurants I have tried for a long time🍣👍🏻😊

Review596.Review: Excellent food and our server was extremely attentive.  Sushi just melts in your mouth.  Expensive for the amount of food that you get, so somewhere you would go for a special occasion.

Review597.Review: My wife and I last visited Akiko about 3 years ago for our anniversary and are back for another dinner because of the pleasant experience we had.  However, our experience this time around was simply disappointing. Price has gone up, which we generally don't mind if the quality stays on par; that is unfortunately not the case. For the Omakase experience, there's no need to rush through the courses and served all the small bites at almost the same time. Given the pricing, one would expect a calmer experience that is a bit more slow-paced so one could take his/her time to enjoy each course. Hokkaido uni is no longer included as part of the Omakase (despite price increase), Russian uni was not available, and Wagyu beef was not included. What you get is a rush of 5-6 small bites and 8 pieces of nigiri that, based on my own perspective, were better than your average nigiri elsewhere but weren't anything unique. Outside of the subpar food experience, the host clearly did not read any of the notes we included for the reservation and brought us to a small table when there was another bigger table available. We asked our waiter if that was reserved for a bigger party and he kindly checked and moved us over.  The service by our waiter was great, but unfortunately it was not enough to save the day. Given this experience, we will likely not return and will look to explore elsewhere. Thanks.

Review598.Review: The fish is so fresh the sushi pieces are delicious. They have so many special pieces they offer. By far one of the best sushi spots in the country.

Review599.Review: Fish was very good quality.  Portions not very filling but that's ok.

Review600.Review: Superb sushi, simple and elegant place, great location.

Review601.Review: Amazing Restaurant.  Entire staff was awesome. Our server was outstanding, he made great recommendations and he put on a symphony of sushi.

Review602.Review: This is a fabulous is restaurant. IF you can:1. Ignore staff that is inattentive. 2. Overlook a wait staff  and host who show little knowledge of the menu. 3. Accept a fast food vibe. In short, the back of the house is been sabotaged by the front of the house.

Review603.Review: Best sashimi and sushi in fidi / downtwon

Review604.Review: I keep coming back for the super fresh food and amazing service.

Review606.Review: Great setting, can be a bit loud right at lunch time but the food is simply amazing with great service!

Review607.Review: Best nigiri in town! Uni is awesome

Review609.Review: This is a quaint little spot that serves really fresh food and offers an Omakase option as well. For the quality, the price is well worth it. Very unique flavors. Seating is limited and it can get crowded. Reservations recommended. Great for business meetings for a date night.

Review610.Review: What an absolute overrated restaurant. From the rushed service to the acceptable-to-fair food — I won’t be back. For a $500 tab, I would expect my expectations to have been exceeded in at least one category but nothing less can be said about the current chef or management of Akikos. Absolute mediocre experience with an inflated price tag coasting off previous management. Our waitress could barely pronounce the fish we were eating as she rushed to get the introduction over with. Our sommelier couldn’t even be hassled to show us the bottle we were drinking. The only thing more t than the sushi we were eating was the incessant drum and bass background music filling the dining room.Next.

Review611.Review: We all have our favorites and claim these are the best in the city. San Francisco has many great sushi restaurants, but Akiko's stands above most. The quality and freshness of their fish is the number one reason why I love coming to Akiko's, and their style of dish completes the experience. This may not be the easiest place to get into, but well worth the wait when you do.

Review613.Review: A little pricey but delicious and inventive.

Review614.Review: outstanding, as close to tokyo as you can get. really delicious, nouveau style nigiri but not straying too far from traditional fish

Review615.Review: Quality is mediocre for the price you pay. One of the fishes was way too "fishy", although I usually handle the taste pretty well on other fishes. The service was a bit too slow for a Wednesday night. Our server wasn't very attentive to what we needed and interrupted our conversations when we didn't ask for him.  He kept coming back only to touch our chopsticks to rearrange it.  Now that I think about it, it may not have been very sanitary for him to do that. Took away our soy sauce/ginger plates because we didn't "need" them for the round of fishes we ordered. He didn't even ask if we would be ordering more after that.  Overall, I'd say his service downgraded our experience at this restaurant and we will probably not be coming back.

Review616.Review: Sushi lovers must have the omikase tasting menu!

Review617.Review: Don't get me wrong, the sushi is good, but I think there are better/cheaper place to get. Not worth the price tag.

Review618.Review: I love love love love love this place! The food is exquisite the staff is friendly and professional, and did I mention the food being amazing? My mom used to work around the corner so we would always come here for lunch if I could manage a day off to visit her. Now that she no longer works in the area, this is my "treat yourself" restaurant because I am not made of money. But well worth every penny.

Review619.Review: I’ve been coming here every time I’m in San Francisco for the last several years.  It’s the best!

Review621.Review: Good food, small dishes at extremely high price without great service

Review624.Review: Up scale sushi bar close to Union plaza, small bar seating and more on the back. Sushi and sashimi are very good quality for the fish a bit less for the rice, but i am picky and it is nicely executed. Sake menu is great and sommelier knowledgeable.The service is a bit cold and quiet slow. I would recommend if you want to spend a lot of cash. There are fine one star Michelin restaurants in the neighborhood with better quality/enjoyment/cost. I had 12 sushi, 3 sashimi, 2 glass of nice sake and a bottle of sparkling water for $200 without tip... probably the most expensive sushi place I ever visited... I think the chain SUGARFISH does better in term of taste and I pay $60 for omekaze and a few dollars for sake, a real bargain.

Review625.Review: High points: good selection of fish for sushi and nigiri. Appreciated being able to try the variety of different uni from Hokkaido. And an excellent hamachi kama. But overall, the space is not very comfortable — we were seated in the front near the window, with hungry, waiting guests just milling around us.

Review626.Review: great choice of food and various ingredientso much choice on the card that an helpfull team is always welcome to make the right choice

Review627.Review: Delicious fresh fish with delicious drinks. Great spot!

Review628.Review: Excellent omakase. Very inventive and luxurious offerings. Exceeded expectations.

Review629.Review: Really creative & unusual sushi at the height of freshness. Attentive service. Tiny space but totally outstanding.

Review630.Review: Wonderful and very fresh Nagiri and Raw sushi bar selection. However, you get very little for the price and we left somewhat hungry after quite a substantial bill. That being said all of the food we had was amazing and so fresh

Review631.Review: Top notch! Freshest fish in the Bay Area. Fantastic service, excellent food! The waitress really knows what to recommend.Can’t go wrong here. Was our 4th time dining here and will continue.

Review632.Review: The attentiveness and knowledge of the servers was wonderful. The food even more so. Not particular budget-friendly but also worth the splurge if you can afford it. Will definitely be returning the next time I have something to celebrate!

Review633.Review: Excellent food, service and environment. Highly recommended

Review634.Review: Always a joy to eat here. Fresh ingredients expertly prepared and served.

Review635.Review: Amazing food! Just let the chef choose for you! Service was friendly and effective. Had a great time.

Review637.Review: Over the Top best Sushi experience ever. Recommend the Chef’s Choice, it was Amazing.

Review638.Review: Akiko’s is an amazing restaurant if you’re looking for omakase style dining. While the prices are pretty high, the quality of the fish is incomparable. Skip everything and focus on the nigiri - the selection and craftsmanship is to die for!Also - the sake collection is top notch.

Review639.Review: Great sushi. But don’t expect the great service from servers.

Review641.Review: Brought a coworker from out of town here for sushi. We were able to converse and eat comfortably in this space.

Review642.Review: I wish I knew the name of our sushi chef as he was extremely pleasant. This place is great for the price! We had the nigiri omakase and the fish tasted fresh with every single bite. Will definitely be coming back!

Review643.Review: The place is small and cozy but the food is loud with how well the sushi tastes and is put together. I'd skip the traditional appetizers of miso soup or edamame and go for one of their fresh salads and assortment of sushi specials.

Review644.Review: La comida estuvo deliciosa y fresca!! Nuestro mesero fue súper amigable y nos enseño trucos para comer sushi, todo increíble!

Review645.Review: Everything was awesome. Impressive quality and service. Expensive, though; but worth it.

Review646.Review: Amazing. Phenomenal. Sammy was the best.

Review647.Review: The waitress could be more attentive for a restaurant at this level... little more omotenashi would be nice

Review648.Review: We got the chef’s choice omakase and we absolutely enjoyed the experience of trying each piece of sushi. Without a doubt, each piece of sushi served was high quality. The customer service was excellent as well. A glass of water was never empty during the meal, and each time a plate came to the table, they would explain what each sushi was. Overall great experience.

Review649.Review: Amazing High Quality Fish and Meat.  A bit pricey, but worth the experience.

Review650.Review: We read the excellent reviews on this quaint restaurant and had to check it out.  We were not disappointed.  The black cod was fantastic!  Melt in your mouth, nice texture with the broiled flakes, squid dressing and ikura.  My nigiri moriawase was the highlight..had to take a photo with the perfect accompaniment of Orion.  Enjoyed lunch so much went back the next day.  This place is worth the price.  Service was excellent!

Review652.Review: ランチで訪問。カウンターとテーブル席がありカウンター席で頂いた。かなり混んでいて予約無しで入れない方もいた。カウンターで握りを頂いた。シャリが赤くて驚いた。海外で赤酢というのも珍しい。香りよく日本のクオリティと近い。ネタは注文後に切り、切り置きしない模様。左利き用に左向きに鮨を置いて頂ける。ネタも日本のもののようで日本のようなクオリティ。ウニがサンタバーバラ産で、出張の者としては、現地の食材が出るとありがたい。

Review653.Review: Need an air solution ...too hot inside. No comfortable

Review655.Review: Fun and delicious girls night out! The fish was fresh and prepared to perfection! If your considering sushi for date night or just for fun you should eat here!

Review656.Review: I would say that Akiko's sushi was very fresh and we enjoyed the food very much.  The service was good.  Not superb. I'm Japanese and I'm very picky about where I eat my Sushi.  It's a very small restaurant so do make reservations in advance.  I would definitely recommend this Sushi joint if you are in San Francisco Bay Area.

Review657.Review: It's rare to find a sushi place in the city that pushes the envelope on edomae sushi. Akiko's uses a special seasoned rice and brings the gastropub feel to traditional sushi-making. Don't let that mislead you, their sushi is delicious. The fish is fresh and the chefs know their stuff. If you sit at the counter, you will be enticed by the chefs' blade work. Came for lunch, but I would love to try their dinner

Review658.Review: Good food, bad service from waiter on a bad mood

Review659.Review: Screw all the overpriced “high end” sushi restaurants. They are trying to be like “Jiro dreams of sushi” and they are so off. I’mJapanese from Japan.  Americans are so fooled by ambiance. The food you guys!!! Are you full after leaving? Satisfied. We left Akiko’s and went straight to another Japanese spot to actually get  nourishment. Save your money. Don’t go

Review660.Review: Food and sake always on point.

Review661.Review: This is the only place to eat fresh sushi in SF. It's our "go to" place. Allen is very personable, friendly, and professional. We will be back there soon.

Review664.Review: Unbelievable. Probably the best sushi I have ever had...including in Japan.

Review665.Review: Colleague recommended and we are sure glad he did. We are in town from Chicago and wanted a nice sushi restaurant. Your restaurant was perfect, food portions just right and service outstanding from the time we walked in until we left. Open Table made it easy for visitors to research, select and travel to our destination. I have already recommended to others. Thank you.

Review667.Review: Elegant, restful space with delicious, clean, fresh fish.

Review668.Review: Possibly the best sushi I've ever had. Took Wife here for an anniversary dinner and it didn't disappoint.

Review669.Review: Had the omakase, and was treated to one of the best meals of my life. Not sure if I can go back to eating sushi at other places after this. The servers were very attentive and the meal was great. Would recommend everyone to experience their omakase.

Review670.Review: Akiko's is a hidden gem.  Once you are seated the superb quality of the sushi shines.    Your pallette gets to take an adventure as the sushi chefs create new rolls and outstanding traditional favorites.

Review671.Review: Had a reservation for 7:30pm, was not seated until 8:10pm. Waited for 10-15 minutes before our order was taken. Food was great and our server had great recommendations so that was the highlight of the evening. We also ordered sake and it was never brought to us so we decided to not have it. It could have been that one off day.

Review672.Review: The food was great. The staff could be slightly more friendly, but it really didn't bother me. The sushi chief was great. It was on the pricier side but I feel like the price was borderline "good"/"high" for the taste and quality.

Review673.Review: Need some help at the host stand, perhaps new practice or communication style with customers. 9pm reservation was met with, “we have a 15 min cancellation policy, let me see if we still have a table for you.” We arrive 9:16pm. Not kidding. Made a joke about that and she repeated the policy and line about maybe having a table for us. Ok. How about glad you guys made it, we’d thought you canceled?  Nothing. So we are late and this person’s approach and whole demeanor was completely negative...we were fine cause we just walked over from having seen a comedy show at the Masonic. Policy is fine, and as mentioned above, we were late. But I had called you back specifically that afternoon and confirmed our reservation. Your food is great and I have no problem paying $400+ for two people...you do sushi extremely well. Just lose the attitude at the door. You should be happy people are showing up at your place and not another’s. Your food is too good to ruin it on something that takes no talent to produce...attitude, gratefulness. Just some friendly advice.

Review674.Review: There isn't a rating high enough to grade this place. Absolute gem in SF!!! Thank you so much for having us!!

Review675.Review: Akiko's is consistently the best place to meet for a quiet meal with a close friend.  The food is remarkable and subtly creative, and almost every meal surprises me in some cool way.  The front of the restaurant is a totally different vibe from the rear dining room, with San Francisco in front and Tokyo in back.It's a privilege to have dinner at Akiko's.  Thanks.

Review676.Review: There really is only one Japanese restaurant in SF

Review677.Review: Sit at the counter and ask for Tim. A very memorable lunch!!!

Review678.Review: Everything here is amazing! Every piece of sushi is crafted with care and intention. Please do not ask for soy sauce as every piece is perfectly season on their own. Quick hint to ask your server *what order you should eat your delicious selection.*

Review679.Review: The quality of the food here was excellent.  Just be warned, the portions are on the small size.  Had the Hamachi Kama and the black skin cod.  Both were delicious.  I was here with my Mom from out of town and we stumbled on this great little place after looking up Japanese food on opentable

Review680.Review: Excellent sushi - the quality of the sushi is great - with so many sushi places around it is getting harder to find great quality raw fish.   This is a place I highly recommend and being Japanese I’m very picky about my sushi 🍣!

Review681.Review: Amazing sushi if you’re in San Fran!  High quality fish and great ambience

Review682.Review: Unless you only want word of mouth Customers Put Your NAME on the Outside!!!Very Frustrating trying to find your restaurant when we are walking from our hotel & it’s cold outside. We went right by it!!! No Name did not help!!!

Review683.Review: Shady pricing. They don't price the Omakase and won't give you a price for starting out at 10-12 pieces.

Review684.Review: I haven't been to Akiko's in many years since leaving the Bay Area, but it's still outstanding. The sushi was amazing, and the attention while sitting at the sushi bar was spot-on. A great spot for sushi in SF.

Review686.Review: The quality of sushi is good and fresh, some pieces are quite small, so you have to order several times to get full. The location is moderate to high price. We sat opposite the bathroom, so we had some bad smells sometimes.

Review687.Review: Excellent service and some of the best sushi i’ve had in a long time. I love that there was an entire menu with items from Japan, very hard to come by.  I will be back the next time I’m in town.

Review688.Review: Nice place, very high quality in food and price very accepted. I absolutely recommend and return to this place

Review690.Review: Outstanding Japanese food! The sushi was perfect, just loved everything. The small plates were outstanding as well.

Review691.Review: Outstanding. Omakase is among the best in SF. Make sure you grab a set at the sushi counter.

Review692.Review: Probably the best sushi experience in San Fran.

Review693.Review: Nice traditional sushi and surprisingly fast. The place is very small.

Review694.Review: Definitely overrated. Not nearly as good as advertised and critqued

Review695.Review: Restaurant is small beautiful and calm inside.  Wood tables and exposed brick are warm and inviting.  Miso cod and all the sushi were delicious and exquisite at the table.  Rolls could have been smaller /tighter more maki style for my liking but I understand sometimes they’re larger for American audience.

Review696.Review: Hands down the best food I’ve had in a very long time. The service was outstanding.Can’t miss. The selection of fish was great and everything was delicious.

Review697.Review: Great place to eat. It was a little warm inside the day we went and if the front door would have been open that would have helped airflow.

Review698.Review: Had lots of fish I have never had & others that I seldom see - giant clam & cuttlefish. Unprocessed scallops were delicious

Review699.Review: Best Sushi bar in San Francisco.  We actually had a starter for dessert, it was so good.

Review700.Review: The service is excellent here. Try the omakase - the fish is exceptionally fresh. Highly recommend!

Review701.Review: My very favorite sushi place in SF. Unique fresh savory nigiri - not cheap but worth it on special occasions

Review702.Review: DELICIOUS as always and accommodating staff.  Spectacular freshness of all items served every time.

Review704.Review: The person who attended the table was not kind to us, instead the table helper was incredibly helpful

Review705.Review: Das Essen war sehr gut, die Weinauswahl sehr überschaubar, die Location ist in Ordnung, aber die Toiletten leider nicht sauber

Review706.Review: The sushi rolls were just average-prepared with a brown rice and soy.  The center of the rolls were a bit mushy and had indistinct flavors that were dominated by the flavoring of the rice.  However, some of the nigiri (in particular the Uni and the Golden Eyed Snapper) were absolutely fantastic.  The restaurant is quite noisy and hot.  All in all, it was good, but there are far better sushi options for the price.

Review707.Review: Akiko's was overall good.  The service was very good.  The food was just good.  We were expecting more based on the reviews we read.

Review709.Review: 5 Stars. Everytime. All the time. Our favorite sushi in the country. Allen is an amazing host. The food is out of this world.

Review710.Review: Akiko’s service and food was outstanding. We were visiting from out of town and the experience at Akiko’s far exceeded our expectations.

Review711.Review: Felt rushed, mid-tier fish at a premium price, unclear menu and pricing, waitress went over dishes very quickly, wasn’t sure what i was eating most of the time. Overall, would not come again.

Review713.Review: My favorite sushi restaurant in the country!

Review714.Review: One of the best sushi I have ever had in the US.  A+++!!

Review715.Review: Food was great. Service was incredibly slow and disorganized. Some of our dishes were dropped at the wrong table and thus we were waiting 10+ minutes between pieces at some points. Then, the hostess guilt tripped us to push us out without acknowledging the slow cadence. Ruined an otherwise enjoyable dinner.

Review718.Review: Great service, great food, beautiful place and really great environment

Review719.Review: Best sushi in sf.  They have a very healthy selection of fish and everything is very fresh and delicious.

Review720.Review: Great sushi. Due to the small, narrow space it can be very loud and difficult to converse

Review721.Review: Food was great!!  Will return on my next visit to SF

Review722.Review: In town from Chicago, had a great experience. Amazing food and fabulous service.

Review723.Review: What a wonderful meal! There is great attention to detail and freshness. I highly recommend sitting at the sushi bar.

Review724.Review: summary: good sushi, but we left hungry, received mediocre service and paid too much.longer story:we arrived at 9p (on time) and sat at the sushi bar.  we ordered sake and water.  the waitress forgot our water for ~10 minutes.  we asked her about it, and she said "oh sorry i was just back there wandering around haha!"   we ordered the omakase, and the first course took quite a long time to come out - nearly 20 min.  the sake we ordered came out promptly...but having no food in our bellies and no water, we just let it sit there.  my glass was placed near the end of the sushi bar, where the sushi bar cooling mechanism is housed and exudes a fair amount of heat.  so my sake was very warm by the time i got to drink it -- yuck.   basically, we started the meal hungry, thirsty and not exactly happy.the food was quite tasty and creative, but the omakase offered very little actual nigiri (5 or 6 pcs total, if i recall, and a wagyu piece at the end), and generally it was not enough food for us.  the nigiri that we did have was good, but only 3 of the pieces were really "traditional" nigiri.  i would have loved more of that.  our check came to about 260/person (with tip), with one glass of sake each (~20/glass) and a couple of bottles of sparkling water.  this felt like a hefty price tag for the amount of food that we got.  @ the end of the omakase, the sushi counter was closed and we were told there was no more food (very sheepishly).  we were still hungry and definitely would have ordered at least 4 pcs + a role each;  if we had known in advance, we would have made an earlier reservation or put in an additional order of food in advance of the food course commencing.ultimately, we left hungry and felt like we had paid too much for peculiar / slow service and not enough food (though what we had was quite nice).  for me, leaving a restaurant hungry is a total fail, hence this low rating for what i believe could have been a really great dining experience.

Review725.Review: Akiko's is a controversial Japanese eatery. The choice of brown rice for all sushi is a welcomed initiative. While it works well with nigiri, the taste of rolls suffer. The chef's choice nigiri were not bad, although I would appreciate more creativity in the choice of fish for the price. The tuna roll left a lot to be desired due to dull taste and rather unpleasant texture. The black cod was grilled to perfection and seasoned extremely well.With the hits and misses it's hard to recommend Akiko's, especially given the premium prices and less-than-desired creativity with nigiri.

Review726.Review: I did not enjoy my experience at Akiko's.  We did the Chef's choice Omakase, which was expensive, and the sushi was honestly sub-par.  The service was also extremely slow.  I had to ask for the bill numerous times, and sometimes 15 minutes between courses.  Take your money elsewhere.

Review727.Review: Loved this. Sushi and sashimi was amazing. Couldn’t recommend more. Definitely worth the price but not going to be a cheap sushi meal since the quality is high.

Review728.Review: As a sushi lover and self-proclaimed connoisseur of great seafood... I will say Akiko did not disappoint.

Review729.Review: Front house needs to remember how to treat guests. We were running late to our 6pm reservation so we called the restaurant to let them know. We ended up arriving 20 mins late -- which we totally own and apologized for. The hostess made a big fuss at the door about how we were almost 30 mins late and she didn't know if she could accommodate us, asking us -- "are you having omakase or not?"  It was all very off-putting, rude, and bizarre. I looked at my fiancee and asked if they're asking us to leave.  There were plenty of open tables. We eventually got seated but it was such an off-putting experience that I almost wanted to walk out. Being late was certainly our fault but being yelled at for it and being made to feel unwelcome and a burden was a terrible customer experience for someone you are asking to pay you.  Overall, food was good. We ordered sushi, it arrived quickly, we ate it and were out in 45 mins flat.

Review730.Review: Best sushi in a humble place with affordable pricing and sourced from the best seafood comparable to the other high end places.

Review731.Review: My personal experience with Akiko’s was fairly disappointing.  From the start it felt that it was clear the service was going to be poor. There was a lot of condescending remarks from the hostess and it just felt the waiter didn’t want to explain or care to explain some of the menu options.  I expect that the food should match the service and it quite frankly failed to do so.  Nothing was warm/inviting about this place. The sushi itself was quite good but the fact that the service was so poor made me question the entire experience.  I personally wouldn’t recommend this restaurant.

Review732.Review: Loved the soft shell crab appetizer! This is a very busy spot so make reservations or arrive early. If you aren't an experienced sushi eater let the wait staff know-they will guide you!

Review733.Review: Lovely dinner, very good sushi. Would definitely return, quick and professional service.

Review734.Review: The service was extremely strange. Our waiter came over and kept adjusting our plates as we were eating. Would hover to wait for us to finish a dish. Would not pour sake from bottles that we had ordered. The food was very lacking in terms of enthusiasm and ingenuity. For the amount they charge for importing fish from Japan, it tasted gummy and some of the pairings of sauces on the nigiri were totally off from what was expected from the fish. Its sad that the best thing here was a sushi roll. In addition to all this, the restaurant temperature was boiling hot -- I'm sure that's affecting the fish somehow. The lack of attention to the important details -- ie preparation of food -- and the emphasis on the unimportant ones -- literally moving plates mid bite several times throughout the meal -- makes this place an absolute joke.

Review735.Review: This was the best meal i've had in SF since living here the past two years. Tim, our Sushi Chef, was fantastic and the fish is some of the highest quality out there.

Review736.Review: Must try Butterfish Nigiri w/Jidori Shaved Eggs!! YUM!

Review737.Review: Great food and ambiance. Loved it.

Review738.Review: Sushi was pretty good quality. Didn’t like that they brushed it all in shout. Salmon was amazing . Pretty pricey.

Review739.Review: I had the most incredible sushi here and will never forget this meal. i Will return next time I am in San Francisco for certain.  Thank you for the wonderful experience.

Review740.Review: Love all of the sushi and rolls. Freshest and most beautiful cuts of fish that are dressed by Chef perfectly. The fatty turo is the best in town!

Review741.Review: Every time we are in San Francisco we eat here and I recommend this to everyone. Will sit at the bar next time. This place is a must go to! Delicious 😋💕

Review742.Review: After failing to find the restaurant on a previous occasion (a small name plate would help!) my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our meal.  Having lived in Tokyo, we find the majority of Japanese restaurants in San Francisco to be sadly mediocre at best. Akiko lived up to its reputation of being authentically Japanese, with high quality ingredients properly prepared. We look forward to going again.

Review743.Review: This is such a hidden gem of a place with a wonderful staff and very fresh, creative food. I would definitely make a reservation early and let them know you want to sit at the bar. The Sushi chefs  (artists) are great guys and very knowledgeable. I have never had such fresh tasting sushi in my life! Everything was fantastic! Jessica was also very helpful with our selection of Sake, which I don't really know how to pick when you have so many great options. She nailed exactly what we liked. They do have tables in a side room, but it's very narrow and feels a bit claustrophobic to me, I much prefer the bar seating with a view of the street. I can't wait to go back to San Francisco, Akiko's will be first on my list and I'll try the Omakase next time.

Review744.Review: We could only get a reservation at 9pm. They told us at 9.45pm that the kitchen was closing after they only took our drinks order at 9.25pm. That’s unreasonable for an expensive dining establishment.

Review745.Review: Akiko is my to-go sushi restaurant whenever I’m in San Francisco. Their food is heavenly and authentic with a creative touch. I usually go with the chef’s choice (omakase) but everything off the menu is just as amazing. Love, love the place!

Review747.Review: Misleadingly exciting selection of nigiri and sashimi coupled with a pricing that would hopefully guarantee an above-average experience but does not. Lack-luster flavor profile throughout the entire meal.Don't get me wrong, it's not the worst sushi I've ever had. However, I was much more satisfied with the french dip I got as follow-up when we decided to cut out early after underwhelming appetizers, nigiri moriawase, and self-selected sushi choices. Seems strange to say, but this place made me miss the sushi I could get at Bob Wasabi in Kansas City.

Review748.Review: Ray took care of us the chefs were amazing and very accommodating.

Review749.Review: I would dare say the best sushi in SF just delicious the fish is so fresh. The service is always terrific I have eaten here at least 20 times and I have never been disappointed.

Review750.Review: Excellent menu, very high quality fish. The price is a bit steep, but it is top notch.

Review751.Review: We had such a great time! We were so impressed by the service and knowledge that each server had

Review752.Review: Their king salmon belly was among the freshest and best I have had in sf. Yellowtail was very good. The Uni was sweet and incredibly flavorful. Very expensive though as they charge for one piece what most other places charge for 2.

Review753.Review: Super fresh sushi. Black cod was amazing.

Review754.Review: Tbe grilled fish (mackerel, hamachi Kama) was excellent. The sushi was very fresh and tasty, though the unagi was a bit over cooked. Loved our server - she was attentive and super friendly!

Review756.Review: Best sushi ever!!!!!  I love this place!!!!!

Review757.Review: Nice ambiance but this place was too expensive for what you got. The fish was fresh but nothing special. The servers and staff seemed to be bothered you were there. Won’t go back

Review759.Review: We had the omakase and it was such a pleasant experience. Every thing we ate was so special and picked out for us. It was a very thoughtful dining experience

Review760.Review: We had a reservation for 6:30 pm.  When we arrived, the hostess told us that we had 2 hours before we had to leave because the next party would be arriving at that time for the table use.  when we got seated, she said "Remember, you have to leave by 8:30 pm") The waiter later told us that the hostess was wrong.  The hostess' "greeting/warning" was total baloney and not the way to treat customers.  The food was the worst sushi I have ever eaten and way overpriced.  One dish was a $28 piece (maybe two ounces) of  very ordinary fish.  I did not feel that the ambience fit with sushi.  The restaurant did not seem clean either.

Review761.Review: Very high quality fish with prices to match. Been there 2x both times hostess forced me to sit at specific chair at the sushi bar saying other seats at bar were reserved. Later nobody sat at the "reserved " seats. Portion size of food quite small even for Japanese person. However fish quality is excellent.  Wine list is meager yet  pricey as well.

Review762.Review: Awesome! Sake Salmon roll was unreal!

Review763.Review: Outstanding quality. Fish was incredible. Best I have ever had!

Review764.Review: Food was great. Issues were with cleanliness. There was a pile of food from the previous guest on the floor when we sat down, they cleaned it up after suggesting we move over. Bathroom was not checked often enough with paper products on the floor and in the sink. Waiter moved my chopsticks for food placement at the food end. Tea was refilled by picking up rim of cup. The pacing was off as well. We waited about 15 min for server to take our order. First items came out relatively quickly, then waited 20 minutes for next course. The omakase was served quickly 6 pieces at a time after the wait.Food was the saving grace for the restaurant.

Review765.Review: Best meal I’ve had in San Francisco! Best quality sushi.

Review767.Review: The meal was delicious!! The absolute freshes fish ever!!

Review768.Review: Chefs always send us on a beautiful journey from appetiser to dessert. Hands down the best nigiri in the bay.

Review771.Review: Food was decent but over priced. Tuna needs to be better.

Review772.Review: Food was amazing. Loved how they brought out each dish individually. Really allows you to enjoy each thing you order and paces the meal nicely. Wait staff was attentive but not friendly by any means. The bill was EXPENSIVE, and I left hungry.  Might have been the most I’ve shelled out on a single meal in my life. Overall, really amazing food but probably not worth the price tag

Review773.Review: Simply excellent. I had the omakase lunch and the fish was so fresh and expertly prepared that it blew me away!

Review775.Review: its overpriced, staff is not very careful and it lacks of quality and care. worst sushi experience in that price segment.

Review776.Review: Awesome sushi! Fantastic service! A true gem in SFO.

Review778.Review: Best sushi around. Hard place to find as there is no sign on the door but once you find it you won’t forget where it’s at. For sure will come back every time I am in San Francisco.

Review779.Review: Overall solid, but the kitchen and sushi chef forgot about items that we had ordered.  In addition, enough with the glass lid smoker - I understand that it might be a fun party trick for novices, but it seemed that every other order was being placed under a small glass lid and then infused with smoke.  Surely the quality of the ingredients should speak for themselves and not have to be masked with a haze of gas.

Review780.Review: Fresh, fresh, fresh! Everything we had was exceptional. Kind and helpful staff. Extensive Sake options.

Review781.Review: One of the best sushi’s i have ever had. Only had as good as that in Japan. Great quality. Definitely recommend!

Review783.Review: Our server was incredibly rude. She also forgot to put in our side order of rice and then when we asked about it, she said the restaurant was "out" of rice. A sushi restaurant out of rice!!! And she didn't offer any  accommodation or anything in return.  The sushi itself was "okay"-  but way overpriced, definitely not worth it.  We will definitely NOT be going back to Akiko's.

Review784.Review: One of the best sushi restaurants; anywhere. Great tastes and excellent quality.

Review785.Review: Really delicious fresh fish! Some items I wanted to try were sold out , so I will be back to try them !

Review787.Review: The food was delicious, which is all that matters.

Review788.Review: Every year when I come to SFO, Akiko‘s is a MUST. For those who say „I only eat sushi in Japan!“: this is a lesson for you guys that you are missing something! Creative but original sushi dining, top fish quality, excellent seasoning (to make sure you enjoy the right flavor the waiter removed our soy sauce pot —— and he was right!!!) perfect service, perfect ambiance. It’s a rather small place so book your lunch early!

Review789.Review: Best sushi I’ve had outside of Japan, and on par with excellent authentic sushi in Japan.

Review790.Review: Terribly slow service. We complained but that didn't change the situation. We left after the first course (and 45 minutes later) to another restaurant that had better service.

Review791.Review: I had high expectations dining here, the food was good and fresh but nothing was really special that impressed me. Dishes came with small portion but delicate. Maybe I’ll try to go Omakase experience next time here.

Review792.Review: Lucky to stumble upon an open reservation for weekday lunch. The waiter was knowledgeable and able to provide good recommendations on sushi and sake. He was also great for providing some insight into where the food actually comes from and what makes it unique, sharing personal stories that relate to the food. The food was everything you can expect and we felt like we got great value for money here with our one of a kind dining experience. Try the black cod - you won’t regret it.

Review793.Review: The omakase was such a treat. Every bite was delicious and delicate. I felt like each piece of fish could melt in my mouth.  The service was awesome. Our server, Allan, was knowledgeable about every dish he presented which I really appreciated.  Can't wait to go back.

Review794.Review: Best sushi in town. Creative chef with impeccable fish, attentive service. A special evening every time.

Review795.Review: Excellent sushi. Good service. We ordered from the menu. The special sushi menu of the day was a bit pricey.

Review796.Review: My favorite sushi in the city, hands down! These guys do such an amazing job. Whenever I’m asked, “which type of uni do you want...” I know I’m at the right place. Arguably the best sushi in SF.

Review797.Review: Overpriced. Good fish and service but far too expensive

Review798.Review: My absolute favorite sushi in San Francisco!  Excellent!

Review799.Review: Twice a year I take my granddaughter to Akiko for a sushi expreirence. It’s become quite a tradition for us in the last three years.This week’s visit lived up to the high standards of Akiko’s. Roger treated us to his artistry with a sashimi selection followed by a special roll and two choices of nigiri. the quality and presentation of the sushi at Akiko’s is the best! Can’t wait for your next time there.

Review800.Review: If you want to experience some quality sashimi or beef, this is the place. They got variety of drinks as well.

Review801.Review: food is ok to good. Price should not at $$ but $$$$

Review802.Review: Akiko’s was renovating their kitchen and we were informed the day of that they had moved around the corner to a pop up spot. The ambiance was poor and food was ok. We had the omakase and a bottle of jinmai sake. Around a third of the fish was tough, a third as expected and a third amazing. The Ume was melt in your mouth and the best I’d ever had. $450 for 2 was not worth the experience but it may be due to the temp location. I wish I had gone to the normal location as it was very highly recommended.

Review803.Review: Simply the best quality sushi available. The staff is always friendly and provides excellent recommendations and descriptions of menu items!!!! Simply amazing!

Review804.Review: Taste? Nothing specialPrice? Too expensive I highly recommend you guys to go Michelin star sushi restaurants.

Review805.Review: Over-rated for the price to quality ratio. The sashimi was fine but average compared to the competition in the area. One advantage is they take reservations. Poor ambiance at this temporary location. Felt like a cheap cafe. Staff was ok. Not very friendly though. How about a smile next time?

Review806.Review: After trying to walk in without a reservation, I made a reservation a month in advance for my boyfriend's birthday dinner. The sushi chef was very friendly and knowledgeable. We sat at the bar and had the best experience being able to watch the chefs create these amazing sushi and sashimi pieces. The fish is flown in from Japan and you can really taste the freshness! Great food worth the price. I would recommend having a few drinks before as the wine is expensive.

Review807.Review: Amazing sushi!!!!  Best I ever had!!!!!  I can’t wait to go back!!!

Review808.Review: Everything was so good! Definitely need a reservation. Our server was amazing(better than E&O service that we went to yesterday) Food was wonderful. Nice & intimate.

Review809.Review: Amazing service and conversations. Food was superb and we had a great time.

Review810.Review: Had a wonderful experience at Akiko's as a surprise for my partners birthday. I was worried because our reservation was 15 minutes before it closed to prep for dinner and was happily surprised to find they didn't rush us at all. Food was exceptional and service was great!

Review811.Review: The Nigiri tasting (moriwase) for lunch was superb - fresh fish and exceptional flavors. Staff were fantastic - friendly and attentive even in such a busy setting. Highly recommended.

Review812.Review: We read the recommendation on trip advisor. The restaurant was located 200 meters from our hotel so that was very convenient. We have been in many good sushi restaurants in. Any cities and this was good but not the best. Seems expensive (400+ such per 2 persons). We ordered the omakase and there was some very good items but was not consistent overall), the service was below average so at the end there was a not good relation price/quality

Review813.Review: Great sushi, high quality, great staff, a tad pricey.

Review814.Review: Scallop was fantastic, best I ever had. Really amazing sushi.

Review816.Review: Nice restaurant with good fresh fish. Miseo soup could have been better. Staff is very nice.

Review817.Review: I had a wonderful experience eating sashimi here.

Review818.Review: Love it!  Just a wonderful experience and great food.  Really top notch sushi

Review819.Review: One of - if not our favorite, sushi spots in the city! Wonderful sushi and such a kind, accommodating staff.

Review820.Review: Avoid at all costs.  Menu on their website is not updated to reflect new prices/selection, slow seating, poor service, sold out of many items.  Pick almost any other sushi restaurant in SF because this one is a complete dud.

Review821.Review: Weak sushi.  Poor experience. Really small and lackluster portions that were truly average. A bust.

Review822.Review: Awesome. My favorite sushi restaurant in the City, hands down.

Review823.Review: I had the waygu  seared before which was really good, tonight’s wasn’t as good so I’m a bit disappointed.

Review824.Review: I love the atmosphere and service at Akiko's. They have amazing sushi - over 5 types of uni!

Review825.Review: Always popping up on best sushi lists, Akiko was on my personal must try list. It didn’t disappoint. The cool raw space, attentive service and just incredible sashimi. Also enjoyed the greens salad, miso soup and chef’s recommendation for seares butterfish and cold sake selection.  The neiman ranch gyu came with housemate kimchi, padron peppers and fried Brussels sprouts.

Review826.Review: Akiko's serves exceptionally good sushi. The service is pretty good, but could not be described as friendly. The main dining area appears to have been an alley between two buildings at one time or another. It's dim, tunnel-like, and extremely noisy when busy. It doesn't help that the restaurant also plays moderately loud music over the sound system. There are a few seats at the sushi bar and a three tables near the entrance that have windows to the street. These tables are in high demand. Despite the high quality food, I may have to give up on Akiko's because of the substandard dining room.

Review827.Review: Chef Steve was a delight. One of the best omakase experiences I've ever had.

Review828.Review: Amazing!  Flavors were just amazing.  It was our first time at Akiko’s and we opted for the omakase tasting menu.  Most of the dishes were good.  Some were absolutely amazing.  Very unique and thoughtful.  It was refreshing to be the recipient of a well thought out menu.

Review829.Review: The sushi was interesting and fresh but the pieces were tiny and very expensive.  That, however, is not my main problem with this restaurant.  They billed me an extra, unapproved $33 on my credit card and just kept promising to call me back when I called to have it corrected.  I'm still waiting!  Mistakes happen but they are apparently not interested in correcting them. I was also a little put off by the fact that I went with a friend on my birthday AND hers (we have the same birthday) and the restaurant did ZERO to acknowledge the birthdays...no dessert, no candle, not even a Happy Birthday greeting, even though I put a note on my reservation saying it was our birthdays.My advice - for a special occasion, pick a restaurant that cares.  And make sure to monitor your credit card and keep all receipts if you do go!

Review830.Review: Place was delicious all that needs to be said...oh and the wait staff was knowledgeable and attentive

Review831.Review: Our server was really friendly and great at recommendations.  All of the food was excellent

Review832.Review: Delicious, authentic, fantastically fresh sushi! Waiter was very informative about the different kinds of fish. The saki, beer and wine lists were excellent.
