Review833.Review: This as an excellent restaurant.  I allowed the chef to select my food and he did not disappoint.  The quality of the food and service were fantastic. He explained everything being served and answered all of my questions.  It was as excellent experience.

Review834.Review: This place was hyped up. The sushi wasn’t anything write home about. There was no eel (what kind of sushi place doesn’t have eel?). The taste of the salmon, yellowtail, or tuna was not memorable.

Review835.Review: Recommend making a reservation for earlier in the night if possible. I could only get a 9pm reservation and had to wait an additional 30 minutes for a table. I also recommend asking to sit at the sushi bar. While waiting I saw the sushi chefs serving a different menu to the patrons of the bar. When I requested information about some of the sushi choices from the bar, the waiter was completely confused and dismissive. We were sat at a table in the main dining room with zero privacy and constant traffic to and from the bathroom. The sushi was fresh and delicious and I will return but will make sure to only sit at the bar.

Review836.Review: The service at Akiko's was impeccable.  The chef choice omakase is a must try!  So fresh and so delicious!

Review837.Review: Chef Hiro was amazing.  We did the omakase for my girlfriends birthday. Everything he made was delicious.  Great meal, great night

Review838.Review: OMG!  The best sushi ever. Roger was an amazing artist of fish. Will definitely be there on our next visit. The taste, the flavors and texture were all top notch.

Review840.Review: The deep fried soft-shell crab was amazing.  Can't stop thinking about it! Will go back to San Francisco just to eat that!  You do want to get there early because we had a late reservation and they were already out of most of the nigiri.

Review841.Review: Best. Sushi experience. Ever. My husband and I did Omakase seated at sushi bar. Chef Roger is a Mastermind and provided an indescribable experience. Definitely worth the $$.

Review842.Review: Akiko's never disappoints. Hands down, still the best sushi in San Francisco, even with the recent glut of new high-end Japanese restaurants.

Review843.Review: Akiko's is a whole other level of sushi. In the past I've been to places which I felt were good, but they're in a different category. I always thought it people were exaggerating when they would talk about melt in your mouth, tender sushi. Now I know they are not. I got the nigiri sampler plus a couple of other items and everything was so fresh and full of flavor.When I first wrote this review I gave only 4 stars for value. I came back and changed that to 5 stars as I realized that while the food was pricey it was so worth it.I will definitely visit again.

Review844.Review: Go here for the amazing omakase menu, featuring rare ocean treats flown in from Hokkaido and other parts of Japan. Every plate is elegantly plated by the chef and curated by the server to elevate the experience of each bite. Standard menu items are a delight as well, but the point of this place is letting the sushi masters give you their best.

Review845.Review: Place was small and service was poor. Sushi was good quality but very expensive for the overall value.

Review846.Review: The food wasn't bad, the place looks good and intimate but the manu is not variated enough. We decided to take the "chef's choice Onomaku" option (without an average number of plates and price indicated) and the bill was completely out of range. As a general review, the place and food didn´t worth the price payed.

Review847.Review: Accommodated me after missing original reservation due to 3hour late plane. Beautiful quality and variety of fish with imaginative sauces (or not depending on fish).

Review849.Review: Based on the many good reviews, we decided to try Akiko, and skip our favorite and usual Sushi restaurant in San Francisco, Kusakabe (which is always amazing).  AKIKO was a BIG DISAPPOINTMENT:1- Our server, Linh (a seemingly moody girl with no grace or enough manners) was the beginning of a mediocre experience.  2- Our Otoro was ridiculously tiny, which we would never have minded if the quality had been high.  The quality was poor.  I remember once eating at a dreadful sushi boat place & the Otoro there was better! 3-The rest of the dishes were OK or just good.  4- The pacing of the dishes was disorganized and choppy. One good thing.....Our Gindara (miso marinated black cod) was excellent but not "wow" enough to redeem the rest of the mediocrity.

Review850.Review: The sushi was delicious and there was an incredible selection of fresh fish shipped in from Japan. Prices reflect the quality of the fish and preparation. Unfortunately, our meal was less than pleasant due to a particular server whose timing and manners were off - she was often unavailable/too busy for questions/orders and interrupted conversation at inopportune times. The rest of the serving staff was courteous and on point otherwise.

Review851.Review: Excellent sushi - well worth the trip - very fresh fish almost all straight from Japan.

Review852.Review: If you want value, it would not be here. If you want finest quality , this would be the place. Prepare to spend about $150 per person

Review853.Review: si vas a comer o cenar solo es una opcion estupenda, sentarte en la barra charlar con los sushiman y con otras personas de la barra. el sushi es espectacular ! recomiendo dejarte llevar por las sugerencias de los chefs!muy buen japones!

Review854.Review: One of the best Sushi places in San Francisco, amazing quality, creativity and overall service. If possible I would add this to every trip to San Francisco.

Review855.Review: Over-hyped, over-priced. Tries to hard to be cutting edge and authentic. Fails at both. People who like this place don't know what good sushi is. No air conditioning.

Review856.Review: Great  food but expensive.  If you want the  car counter, you will need to specify in advance.

Review857.Review: The food is sumptuous.  A Sushi Bar with new and exciting combinations.  Nary a California roll to be found.  I loved it and got to try four new fish and an new roll.  Book ahead,  it is packed, even for lunch.

Review858.Review: We came all the way from Germany for a 3 weeks trip through California. The dinner at this restaurant was planned as the highlight during our three day stay in SF. We made a reservation for 3 people, however the openTable system showed us only 2. So, I added a note in the system plus called the restaurant (only mailbox available) to add one more person. We arrived dressed up on time, but the waiter told us, there is only space for two and sent us back home! No flexibility or willingness to offer any alternative (eg. one place at the bar, later time etc.). No prior notice from the restaurant on our note in the openTable system (which has my email address!), no call back on my phone call. Waiter told us it is all our fault!! Left on the street we had a hard time to find an appropriate alternative restaurant without a reservation. Thank you very much for a great night in San Fransisco! Food must be fantastic and the restaurant always fully booked, since they have no interest in good service or good reviews of guests as it seems.

Review859.Review: Good food. Terrible service- from the hostess to the server. They were all less than helpful despite trying to engage with them.

Review860.Review: Took a reservation for 230pm but was informed the kitchen was closing when we arrived

Review861.Review: amazing sushi in the city - despite its financial district location, the sushi is top notch, service is amazing. the location is small, so be sure to book in advance.

Review862.Review: We had the omakase menu.I expected the fish to be remarkable.But it was not. Most pieces were rather indistinguishable from each other, and relied on the sauces or "toppings" for flavor.  That's not the way Sushi should be.The front of house staff was good, but service was very slow, yet now and then things came out on top of each other, so poor timing and pacing.Sadly, I would not recommend Akiko's.

Review864.Review: Always the perfect place for lunch. The service, presentation and flavors are flawless.

Review865.Review: Everything I tasted was excellent.  Good quality and freshest of ingredients.

Review866.Review: Service started slow and curt. Sushi chefs were amazing and service picked up once you started ordering a lot of food.

Review867.Review: Amazing sushi!  Some of the freshest fish we have ever had. Highly recommend it.

Review868.Review: always amazing. the freshness and quality of fish is outstanding. by far my most favorite sushi place in the bay area.

Review869.Review: The fish selection is extensive and all very fresh. The chefs put their own special twist on each piece so that sauce isn't required for most sushi plates. Have come here for both dinner and lunch and had an amazing experience both times. The staff is engaging and friendly. Highly recommended.

Review870.Review: Roger was excellent sushi chef.   We went two days in a row and he was very helpful, friendly and fun.

Review871.Review: We had the omakase and everything was delicious. The fish was fresh and seasoned well. Service was excellent. Great for a smaller group or couple. Good for personal or business lunch.

Review872.Review: Pretty meh and wouldn't go back. 1) Best dish was the grilled mackerel, otherwise unimpressed with the sushi and didn't like that all the sushi rice in the nigiri was marinated - changed the texture and taste of the nigiri, not in a good way. 2) Service was mediocre - mumbling, disengaged, and weirdly wouldn't explain the tasting menu pricing. 3) BIGGEST FACTOR: We were seated at a terrible table that really shouldn't have been a table -- trying to cram every square inch out of the place. It was about 3 feet from the door and there was an icy blast every time someone came in or out. When I went to the bathroom near the rest of the tables, it seemed like a 20 degree difference.

Review873.Review: We were told Omakaze would be $100 per person but got charged full price on everything they brought us. Some of it we wouldn't have ordered. If we had ordered directly from the menu we would have paid less and eaten better. I don't recommend this place. There are much better alternatives like Sushi Ran.

Review874.Review: Freshest and best sushi I've had.  Everytime I'm in SF from out of town this is my go to place.  Alway have the tasting or let the waiter chef bring whatever he wants.  Amazing. Sake pairing as well.

Review876.Review: Service slow, kitchen out of stock on several items

Review877.Review: Never fail Japanese crusine. Best seafood direct from  Tokyo.

Review878.Review: Very disappointed with the service we received. We did the omasake for 2 people. We were rushed by our waitress...more than two times throughout the courses she would want to take the plate before we even finished the sushi and encouraged us to remove it from the serving plate to our side plates so she could take the plate. For the amount we spent over $350.00 I would not go here again.  We had been here 3 times before, it was a special place but I think with it now being a popular place the service and the quality has gone down hill. Will not go back.

Review879.Review: Easily the best sushi I've had in the Bay. What else can I say about it beyond that? Akiko's is the real deal.

Review880.Review: Akiko's is a great place to get raw fish for a pretty decent price. We got the 12 piece sashimi tasting and the fish was good, I only wish it had been brought out in stages rather than all at once. The service was very good. I recommend getting a reservation as the place is quite small.

Review881.Review: We had omikase, and the timing, presentation, and tastes of each course were wonderful.  The selection of sakes kept pace with the developing flavors of the meal.  The staff explained each course and what we should expect, and also helped keep track of how much we had eaten to prevent overindulging!  A wonderful night out with a good friend.

Review882.Review: They offered good quality fishes from Japan and the overall experience was nice.The place is small so the server is always attentive as well as very knowledgeable about the menu and dishes.I felt the price was a bit steep but overall good quality food. If you are having these quality in SF it will cost around this, just have to make sure you have the budget to walk in and have a good time.

Review883.Review: Omakase is definitely the way to go! I'm not the most adventurous sushi eater, but each plate will delight and surprise. Reasonable and (somewhat) flexible pricing. Fish is fresh, varied, and delicious!

Review884.Review: Excellent food and service.  Authentic, fresh, creative Omakase experience.  Highly recommended.

Review885.Review: We were disappointed by the service and the pace of the omakase. It did not feel special or unique. Food was brought out in bunches and either slowly paced or rushed. Another table who sat after us was served and starting omakase before we even saw a waiter. Definitely not as great as I thought it would be...will not return.

Review886.Review: Way too expensive for the actual food quality, back room is noisy and not proper for conversation

Review887.Review: Very underwhelming sushi experience.I was expecting a lot out of this but was greatly disappointed.  I eat sushi often and would say this was in my bottom 5 experiences.You will get better food at a sushi chain.

Review888.Review: I'v e been to Akiko for lunch several times over the years and find it one of the better casual sushi places in the Downtown area.  The fish is extremely fresh and the service and ambiance casual.  It is not cheap, but you get an excellent quality of fish and it is served in a very uncomplicated way.  Some of the other places I have been get a little too caught up in the presentation aspect of an omakase menu.    Plus, the fact the place is small means the service is very attentive.  One of my go to places for sushi in the city.

Review889.Review: Fabulous sushi, period! Ordered the Omakase for the table and was richly rewarded! The waiter was very helpful pivking the right Sake! The deep sea grouper was fabulous. Chef seasoned everything perfectly so no need for any soy or wasabi - all the ginger yo could eat to clear your palate! Timing was great and we had ~ 13 pieces which was actually perfect in term so volume -  you will NOT be hubgry but just the right amount of satiated! $100.- a head while not cheap was well worth it for the quality of sushi nigiri!

Review890.Review: Fantastic quality sushi though a bit pricy.  I've been three times now and have never been disappointed by the great food.  But at $120 - 150 per person for the Omakase lunch it definitely comes with some sticker shock.

Review891.Review: This was the best Japanese food Ive eaten.  Great ingedients and super service

Review892.Review: How can you make fresh sushi better? I don't know.....but Akiko's nigiri was the best sushi I have ever had. I chose the Chef's choice and the flavors were subtle and lovely. My husband had two rolls and loved them. The tables are close so be ready to hear your neighbors conversation but that is what it is. We had a wonderful date and would definitely go back.

Review893.Review: We were very excited to go to this sushi restaurant and it is a nice place.  We had lunch reservations for 2:30.  We ordered a few things and everything came out really fast.  However, it all of the sudden was 'last call' because they closed the kitchen at 3.  The food was just okay and we felt extremely rushed because I guess they were closing the kitchen at 3.  Very frustrating since we just wanted to enjoy the food and atmosphere.  I would not recommend this place cause really they don't treat customers all that well.

Review894.Review: Overall some of the best tasting sushi in SF but at exorbitant price. Borderline angry at the cost vs experience, as service was spotty (we have three different servers during our dinner and only one was accomplished enough for this setting).  Expressing a little more pleasure in their job wouldn't hurt for the tip they are expecting. Also portion sizes should be larger. We left hungry after spending $400+.

Review895.Review: My only complaint... I want more.

Review897.Review: Beautiful fresh fish that's buttery and delicious

Review898.Review: Great sushi restaurant.Innovative style of slightly salting the sushi instead of the more traditional soy sauce.Would have liked to see more sashimi options.

Review899.Review: Love this place. Their restaurant is pretty unmarked and subtle, which I love. The Omakase was absolutely spectacular and pretty reasonably priced. Their special rolls were simple and delicious. The service was surprisingly very formal and great - loved it.

Review900.Review: Went in to grab a bite after work-- the black tuna nigiri was the best I'd had since Wako. Already booked it for my husband's birthday.

Review901.Review: One of the best sushi experiences that I have ever had in the Bay Area.  I used to live in Japan and am very particular and love a traditional approach when it comes to sushi.  Akiko's nails it!  Don't confuse with the Akiko's on Mason St. nearby...  Not even close in terms of experience and quality.

Review902.Review: Came here with a friend before going off to see Hamilton. The sushi was extremely fresh and the service was very nice. The waiter had great recommendations off the sushi list but had a tendency to push the "Straight from Japan" stuff which was nice, but pretty pricey. The regular menu items were pretty good and overall my friend and I had a good time and enjoyable meal but it is pretty pricey for what you're getting. Not my favorite sushi restaurant, but it's certainly warrants a second visit if there's ever a special occasion.

Review903.Review: We had a wonderful Japanese dinner of sushi, sashimi and cooked food.  One pays for the freshness but it was well worth the price. We look forward to returning when we are in San Francisco the next time.

Review904.Review: Wow!  I loved the experience at Akiko's.  I sat at the bar and had the Omakase served by Wayne.  He selected great nigiri options for me.  No need for soy sauce.  The fish is super fresh.

Review905.Review: I loved everything that I ordered here (6 pc mixed nigiri, 2 pc king salmon nigiri, 2 pc black sea bream nigiri, agedashi tofu, sapporo beer). The service and quality of the food was amazing and I liked that this meal didn't break the bank. Will definitely be coming back!

Review906.Review: The food was worth sitting at a very small table way too close to other people.

Review907.Review: Definitely underwhelming for the price. I've had pretty much better everything-on-the-menu at other sushi places for half the cost. Wont be coming back.

Review908.Review: Very accommodating. I was seated quickly and the food was delicious.

Review909.Review: We purchased the Omakase based on other reviews. However, it was nothing special and was only slightly better than average sushi. On a side note, they told us it would be $100/person but ended up charging us $110/person. Wouldn't bother going again.

Review911.Review: Always great food and exceptional service. Every time I'm in San Francisco I make it a point to eat here.

Review912.Review: Took my wife to Akikos specifically for the Russian Uni. My friend can't stop raving about the fact that it's the best Uni she's ever had to so, of course, I needed to try it. We got there about 45min late for our reservation but they were nice enough to still sit us within 10 min. We did the Omakase and it was ok. They didn't have enough variation and for the price, I don't necessarily think it's worth it BUT the saving grace was definitely the Uni. It was as good as my friend said and I'll never look at uni the same way.

Review913.Review: Superb omakase. Wonderful progression of flavors that was well thought out.

Review914.Review: The first time I went, the sushi was outstanding; however, the other night the sushi was cold and the cut was not great - was a bit stringy and chewy (not buttery) like the first time. (This was a Friday night at around 8pm). The ambiance is really nice and romantic - small like a traditional Japanese restaurant. However, I did feel rushed to get out and our waitress would constantly come over and ask questions... I'm sure she lives off tip, so she was probably trying to get us to buy more food, but we wanted some privacy. For the price I paid, I would have gone to Tokyo Fish Market in Sushi and bought 6 trays of fresh Uni rather than pay that price for 4 rolls of average sushi.

Review915.Review: It was ok, the food was fresh, but lacked flavor. Prices weren't too bad, atmosphere was great but when you're a party of two you can be lined up against the back wall and close to neighbors.The one thing that didn't sit well was that they actually had a measuring cup for the wine pours. And the wine pours were small. For a nice restaurant it seemed a little stingy and lacked class.

Review916.Review: Very high quality sushi. Thumbs up!

Review917.Review: Delicious, fresh and authentic. Took my brother here for a thank you dinner and everything was perfect.

Review918.Review: Service was exceptional from being greeted for our special occasion, best table reserved, amazing sake list and smart recommendations, delicious sushi and sashimi.  Very high quality fish.  Little light on some portions for the price vs. other sushi restaurants in SF but overall and exceptional lunch.  We look forward to coming back!

Review919.Review: We totally enjoyed the food and service, however a $500 tab for two with no drinks was higher than what we expected.

Review920.Review: Exceptional sushi, excellent service, Akiko's is consistently great.

Review921.Review: One of the best meals I've had in SF. I probably spent too much money but I went in knowing that was going to happen.

Review922.Review: My fiancée is a Japanese cuisine lover, to be exact, a sashimi lover! She said this is the best Japanese restaurant she have ever eaten at. We always go to top quality sushi restaurants to enjoy freshest fish from Japanese fish markets. This one really stands out! All the fish we had are super fresh with a very very clean taste. Price is very high for sure, but absolutely worth it. If you want to have some real sashimi, this is the place! The restaurant however is quite small, and lack of lighting, which I don't really like. And the ventilating system is bad, you can smell fish and vinegar when you sit at the table, which located in the back of the restaurant. (The sushi counter is fine, its in the front of the restaurant, and closer to the door).Overall experience is nice, definitely will come back if I'm SF again!

Review923.Review: I gave the chef carte blanche and he didn't disappoint me. Very nice and original nigiri that you wouldn't easily find somewhere else. I can certainly recommend it to sushi lovers and foodies.

Review924.Review: We were seated near the door that was windy and cold, the pace of the food was a bit slower than expected but not unreasonable. It was a very loud venue.

Review925.Review: The ingredients are top-notch, and everything is treated expertly. Even the standard nigiri sampler was an A, if not an A+. The additional nigiri I ordered, especially the uni, were out of this world.Also ordered the saba shioyaki, as I do every time, and its unctuous pungency did not disappoint.

Review926.Review: I think this is the best Sushi I have ever had.   Their reputation is well deserved as one of the best Sushi places in the US.  Heads up, they don't have their name on the door, so you just have to know.

Review927.Review: Small menu but good sushi.  Though I probably wouldn't go again.

Review928.Review: Exceptional quality and service, looking forward to another visit next time we’re in San Francisco

Review929.Review: From philadelphia so my wife and I were traveling.You need a reservation no doubt about it,small but cozy place. We had a 8:45 reservation and were seated at 8:45, very nice .Menu is small but let me say, was probably one of the best fish i have ever had.I mean thats why we were there.  when we travel again to frisco and we will (son moved out there) we will be visiting AKIKO again.

Review930.Review: The freshest sushi and friendly service.

Review931.Review: Amazing food sooooo fresh and with a twist. Sit at the bar for best recommendations!

Review932.Review: Husband had some dietary restrictions. They did not communicate  the he would simply not receive several courses. Price for service was disproportionate which affected the perception of the dishes. I showed up not particularly hungry and left not particularly full. Several nigiri were quite good. Doubt we will return though.

Review934.Review: Best Omakase;Melt in the mouth sensation.Thank you, Akiko.

Review935.Review: amazing. best sushi in the city by far

Review936.Review: If you're looking for a hearty Japanese meal this is not the restaurant for you.   I waited about two months to actually get a reservation.   It is located downtown San Francisco on a very busy street there is no parking on the street the nearest or closest parking area is a lot that you will have to pay at least $20 to park for an hour parking.   It is sushi only when I attempted to order something from the kitchen the server said we are out of it the second selection she said we're out of that as well so it was very limited in my food selection.  The service was excellent however the food was less desirable for my palate.   It had no flavor it was mediocre fresh and what you pay for is tiny plates I was so disappointed I had to go to another restaurant after eating there to be full.   It is extremely expensive for what you get so take a lot of money or your credit card

Review938.Review: Great food. Reminds me of Tokyo.

Review939.Review: Akiko's continues to deliver excellent quality fish and delicious dishes. However, their service on my past two visits has been sub-par and negatively affects the experience. If you make a reservation here, I'd suggest requesting either the front room or the counter so you're at least in the sight line of the staff.TLDR: great food, terrible service.

Review940.Review: World class sushi with friendly neighborhood vibe. I love the grouping of fish into mild and flavorful and buttery. After 40 years of searching for the best found sashimi I never had before. Small with few tables and the bar. Get reservations.

Review941.Review: Excellent sushi. Great sea urchin, wagyu, sparkling fresh seafood and fish, meticulously prepared.

Review942.Review: Really excellent service and knowledgeable staff.  Recommended for anybody who is looking for a cozy, warm experience in downtown San Francisco.

Review943.Review: The food was excellent.  The service, okay.  The seating by the door was uncomfortable but I'd come back for casual eating at the bar if there was any availability. I wouldn't go for a special occasion.

Review944.Review: Excellent restaurant, awesome japanese food and lots of great sakes. Service was really perfect. If you choosing between other options, you can't go wrong at Akiko's. Highly recommended.

Review945.Review: Excellent food and service. Calamari was especially good. Sake was good as well. I would definitely recommend.

Review946.Review: Excellent service and great Sushi.  Will definitely return

Review947.Review: Love the fact that i sat at the bar. Did the Omakase and it was such an awesome one. I like how the the sushi chef tells me the fish and what he tops it with. Also enjoyed that the chefs are interactive. I had 17 pieces and every piece was so fresh. Especially love the chutoro, otoro, kanpachi and the 3 types of uni that chef made for me. So in love i am with this Omakase. Definitely 2 thumbs up and would recommend it to people who would like a good experience.

Review948.Review: We walked right past it because there was no sign on the door, but I am glad we found it.  It was somewhat of a tight squeeze, but the food was so delicious it made up for it.  A little expensive, but it is probably typically priced for good sushi in San Francisco.

Review949.Review: I've been in the area since 2007 and never stopped in... walked past it s hundred times.  I am a huge sushi fan and it was off my radar.  Went there with a friend that said the same... always knew there was a restaurant there but... never stopped in.  OMG.  this was seriously good.  Extraordinary went from the variety (baby barracuda, cold smoked cod, ceremonial big eyed grouper) to the quality (ikura, please eat now!  And Shino maguro toro and black maguro toro) to the sake (a daigingo to die for).  Best sushi and service I've had in sf.  Wow!

Review950.Review: Second time here because we love their fish selections. The service is great. Place is small though.

Review951.Review: Outstanding meal.  I decided to go all in for the omakase and didn't ever regret it.  The service was excellent and without the pretension or arrogance that you can get at some high end sushi places.

Review952.Review: The fish os very fresh and tasty. Sake Daidinjo perfect! Loved the experience. O peixe é mt fresco e saboroso. Sakê delicioso! Restaurante perfeito.

Review953.Review: Sushi was very good tasting.  Wish the sashimi  sampler had more variety.  Overall was a nice meal.

Review954.Review: Servers were all snobby, aloof, unfriendly, unhelpful.  Ruined our meal.  No one needs that

Review955.Review: Absolutely Delicious! Already looking forward to going back.

Review956.Review: Waited 15mins even with booking, and this is a quiet semi-holiday day, quite a few fish were sold out

Review957.Review: Akiko is a decent sushi spot, but like sushi anywhere, the prices are steep (our meal for two was $385+). We did get a bottle of sake, but didn't over order, and of course was left feeling hungry.

Review958.Review: This is the third time I went there. Always great! Akiko's is a must when I come to SFO! The white tuna sashimi is a dream and the rolls are outstanding, but the other dishes are excellent, too.

Review959.Review: Very poor service with servers who know very little about the menu.  Were one of the last reservations for the evening and the server was just rushing to get us out of there.  The fish was AMAZING but way too over priced.

Review960.Review: Outstanding! Will definitely be back! Service friendly and knowledgeable.  Just great, fresh, unbelievable food. A must!

Review961.Review: Outstanding food of highest quality!  Excellent to sit at the Sushi bar and have a meal and discussion with the Chef.  The Omakase was excellent!

Review962.Review: Very fresh, great fish and sushi, great chef recommendations, but the service was hectic. They forgot our drinks  order and overall we felt very rushed as we came during the last seating for lunch.

Review963.Review: Good selection of sashimi, nigiri and sushi. The waitresses were attentive and friendly.

Review964.Review: Been on an omakase spree lately and came here after many raving reviews from friends and family about their omakase menu. Food was good and all, but in comparison to other places I've tried, I would definitely pick others over Akiko's. There wasn't a huge array of flavors as I'd hoped for. A lot of bites were heavy on the wasabi, one was even so heavy that I teared up while eating it and couldn't taste the fish at all. Service was okay. We ordered drinks and had to remind the waiter at the second course that we ordered some. And courses definitely felt rushed. We were in and out of that place within an hour. We would get served the next course before we even touched the one in front of us. One plate was even served when my boyfriend was using the restroom so the waiter awkwardly waited to the side until he returned to explain what was being served. At that, the explanations were mumbled, some were even half explained as in he threw the plate on the table, gave us the Japanese name as he was already pulling away, without telling us what it is in English. Don't get me wrong, the guy was nice and well mannered, but if I'm going to spend $300 on a few pieces of basic sushi then I'd hope service would be on their P's and Q's and I'd feel free to have a nice, relaxed meal instead of pressured to finish quickly.

Review965.Review: Unbelievable experience with a fabulous wait staff who helped navigate  the menu with some wonderful recommendations.

Review966.Review: Overrated in every possible way.  Best sushi in sf ? If this is all they got, then I'd rather fly to Vancouver or Hawaii because it's overpriced crap.  I've eaten at the best Japanese restaurants in NYC, LA, HNL and YVR and this place doesn't come close.

Review967.Review: BEST, BEST, BEST sushi place in San Fran. Delicious, fresh and authentic.

Review968.Review: The temperatura of the sushi was great and the service also. A little confused at the beginning since there seems to be a dingy  sushi place with a very similar Name close by.

Review969.Review: The food at Akiko was very good, but we went the day after Christmas and they were out of a lot of things, so that was disappointing. The ambiance was nice.  It is a cozy place. The service was a bit perfunctory when we were there.  We waited at least 5 minutes at the door with one hostess on the phone and the other (maybe a hostess?) busy.  No one said a word to us, not even "we'll be with you in a minute," or acknowledged us in any way, so it wasn't a very welcoming first impression.

Review970.Review: I was recommended to tryout the best sushi In town according to a local resident. I made reservation first issue the place is missing buissness name. Second everyone was rude on explaining the menu. It was our first time eating raw sushi. My husband and I were lost I decided to just order what I thought sounded decent. When the food arrived it was delicious. I just thought if someone would have taken the time to explain I would have felt a bit less displaced  when exploring new foods.

Review971.Review: 油の多いものばかりあっさりしたものが出てこない味は濃い店員はまあまあシャリをもっと美味しく炊いてほしい

Review972.Review: great restaurant. food was wonderful, service was great. really a great find! thanks open table!

Review973.Review: Sooooo good. Sashimi was super fresh. The cooked food from the kitchen was a tad too salty for me, but by no means would I knock off a star. The fish was that good. Come here for the raw stuff.

Review974.Review: I always wanted to try this place, and I finally did.  I only had omakase sushi (10 pieces for $80), miso-soup ($3) and a glass of daiginjo ($17) for lunch.  So, my review is limited  to it.  But at least I can say sushi was not good.  Sushi rice was dry and didn't go well with fish/shellfish on it.  Hotate (scallop) was the only thing I liked out of 10 pieces.  Shime-saba (marinated mackerel) was probably the worst, it was just sour and still fishy.If I have a chance to go there again, I would try different things than sushi.

Review975.Review: Fantastic sushi in a cool urban vibe - highly recommend!

Review976.Review: Love the food here. Really excellent fish

Review977.Review: Best sushi I've ever had. Sat at the bar and did Omakase ... can't wait to go back.

Review978.Review: Great food with flexible chefs.  Compared to all the meals I've eaten across SF, I found myself accidentally spending more money here than any other restaurant.   This is a great thing for foodies and a bad thing for your wallet.

Review980.Review: Some of the best sushi in town but if you are thinking about hopping over there for dinner tonight, good luck, because without a reservation ,  you'll be turned away.

Review981.Review: This place had amazing nigiri - the lunch special was incredible. I highly recommend this place for their quality of fish - top notch!

Review982.Review: The nigiri was good but I felt the portion could have been more generous considering the price we paid.....$160 for 2 people for lunch. We received excellent service and we were seated by the window but the view outside is not what I would consider pleasant. The deep fried soft shell crab was the best I ever tasted and we ended up placing a second order.

Review983.Review: The quality, presentation, and preparation of the omakase sushi was wonderful. Although I prefer seating at the sushi bar, a table was more appropriate for our party. Each piece was brought out individually and immediately after preparation so the sushi temperature and flavor was not compromised. I was especially impressed by their waygo beef. The sauce flavor pairings were complimentary and did not overpower the fish. The fish was very fresh.Akiko has a great ambiance for friendly conversation. The 90's background music is the perfect volume for enjoyment but not loud enough to have to raise your voice in conversation. The service is attentive but not overbearing.

Review984.Review: Make a reservation! Good thing we had one because a couple in front of us didn't and the hostess said they were only taking people with reservations. Food and service were great.

Review985.Review: Just the best sushi restaurant this side of the Pacific.

Review986.Review: Service does not match price and reputation of the restaurant. Only one guy taking order, seems to be their captain, while all others are bussers. This guy does not know what guest service is. If foods are spectacular, I would not mind their stern face aloof attitude.

Review987.Review: The fish were flown in from Japan that morning as well as local ones. Quite a variety were available. A very enjoyable evening. It is expensive.

Review988.Review: great food and excellent service, so far one of the best japanese restaurants in the city

Review989.Review: Omakase was incredible.  Just tell them your price and let them do the work, you won't regret it.

Review990.Review: Akiko's is a fantastic placegorgeous sushi & Japanese specialities at its bestbrilliant waiter who guides you through the best bites on the menu

Review992.Review: Our waiter was extremely courteous, responsive and also knowledgable about sakes and sushi.

Review993.Review: Omakase was excellent! I felt pampered and inspired by the meal.

Review994.Review: Nao is exceptional, trust in him..  Fish is always uber Fresh!

Review995.Review: Very good sushi!great service and cool space.sat at the sushi bar,would highly recommend

Review996.Review: Superbly prepared and presented sushi as always. Attentive, knowledgeable wait staff. Clean and inviting decor. A bit pricey but the creativity of the presentation and freshness of the fish make the meals here special

Review997.Review: Fish is flown in 3 times a week from Tokyo.  Fish is fresh.  Omakase is the way to go.

Review998.Review: Delicious omakase selection. Stellar customer service by all staff members. They were attentive and always providing refills and other items before I needed to ask.

Review999.Review: A great find!!!  Small petite sushi place with GREAT food and fun.    Wonderful cuisine

Review1000.Review: Phenomenal,  inventive, flavorful and fresh.  Hands down the best sushi in San Francisco

Review1001.Review: This is my first time at this restaurant. My boyfriend has been here before and he would recommend that we went here for our anniversary. He mentioned that the food melts in your mouth when you eat it. I didn't believe it but after one bite, I wanted more. It was so addicting. We had the 6 course sashimi and nigiri. The hamachi kama is also delicious. The fatty and richness of the fish is really good!

Review1002.Review: Took my Girlfriend out for dinner on her Birthday and we both enjoy the restaurant alot, we will return soon for dinner...out waiter was very friendly and did a great job on service and giving us recommendation.

Review1003.Review: Read and heard great things about Akikos. We were highly disappointed. We took the same amount of time to order from the not so straightforward omakase menu and to eat our food. We were in and out of there in one hour. Omakase is not what you expected as it is not the off menu chef selection. Instead it can vary depending on your budget and food allergies- ranging from $80-150 per person. It is just what the chef selects from the menu so no surprise there. Waitress could not explain the menu well, nor bother to us that the sashimi tasting menu included the same fish that we had ordered from the special menu of the day...what a waste of money.  Also don't be fooled by the price for 5 pieces of sashimi because it is not 5 pieces...only two as there are many exceptions.  This is not as authentic as you would imagine for a restaurant having such high ratings.

Review1004.Review: Allen is exceptional. The food is world class. And the whole staff is as well

Review1005.Review: Delicious food, excellent service (especially at the chef's counter), but a little overpriced.  Still, one of the better sushi experiences I have had, and the quality of the food was top notch.

Review1006.Review: Top Sushi. Speciality is the Beef Sushi. I like this restaurant.

Review1007.Review: Absolutly incredible Omakase  menu! The quality of the fish and preparation are beyond reproach.

Review1008.Review: Very fresh fish,  dishes beautifully presented

Review1009.Review: Sushi bar was amazing, omikase was amazing!

Review1010.Review: Best sushi in in SF hands down. Really fresh fish and the rice ratio is on point. Great selection of wines and sake as well.

Review1011.Review: The fish was fresh and amazing!

Review1012.Review: Great restaurant. Really top tier. If I were a Michelin reviewer I'd give it at least one star. First two courses were 12 nigiri picked by my chef Alex. Then two rolls. Nigiri were remarkable both for the quality of the fish and the preparation. Can't wait to bring my wife. Can't recommend highly enough.

Review1013.Review: You can never go wrong with Akiko's.  I found this spot back in 2003.  I work in the area and decided to check it out.  The fish they use for their sashimi/sushi is "A" grade; always fresh.  So I've been going there for my fix of Japanese food.  It was nice and unknown back then and could always get a seat at either the sushi bar or tables.  Then when the place was renovated, their clientele tripled, and now you need to make reservations.  It's all good though.  With the food that tastes this good and fish is as fresh as can be, it's well worth it.

Review1014.Review: Great meal! Wish we knew how to request the sushi bar, but the seating was fantastic!

Review1015.Review: Amazing service and details to food from start to finish. Sat at the sushi bar and let the chef make me 4 nigiri specials.  The order the nigiri came in was a melodic journey for my palette. I am def coming back!!!

Review1016.Review: Best Sushi I have ever eaten, in any country. I recommend sitting at the. At, Chef's choice, and just let the flavors roll. Compliments to chef Wayne!

Review1017.Review: completely overrated restaurant . Bad Service. While the food is pretty fresh and well prepared, the service was bad.

Review1018.Review: Amazing meal - thanks to chefs Chris and Eric for making two memorable meals for us - look forward to seeing you again!

Review1019.Review: To be perfectly blunt, this is probably the best sushi restaurant in San Francisco. And this is coming from someone that has dined at most of the high-end sushi restaurants in the glorious City (have yet to try Hashiri, but I really doubt it will compare favorably at this point, especially regarding the price point).Extremely rare, high quality, and unique ingredients prepared masterfully by talented culinary artists are but one of the highlights of this dining experience. Point in case, this is the only restaurant that I can recall that offers 4 DIFFERENT and unique kinds of Uni, including the extremely rare Russian Uni. Unbelievably creamy and delectably flavorful. What a treat.To make things as easy as possible, sit at at the sushi bar and opt for the omakase. You will not be disappointed. I knew I was in for a superior dining experience when the very first dish of the omakase that was served had BOTH Japanese Snow Crab and Hokkaido Uni. Absolutely divine. The Otoro with Uni was also another highlight. All of the sushi pieces now that I think about it were excellent.To receive the full experience, sushi bar seating is essential. And if available, requesting Chris is a requirement, he was absolutely a culinary sushi master, very impressive skill set. 20 pieces of nigiri/sushi later, I knew this was perhaps one of the most epic sushi experiences I have ever had. Chris undoubtedly delivered. And yes, I have been to Tokyo various times and have even eaten at Tsujiki market.Domo arigato Akiko's! We WILL be back.

Review1020.Review: Fabulous sushi - absolutely melts in your mouth! I ate here during my last visit to SF and couldn't imagine coming to the city without stopping in again! Very tiny, very quiet, great quality sushi.

Review1021.Review: Too expensive for what you get. Not worth it. I won't be going back.

Review1022.Review: Most dishes have scallions, ok if you like, but not great if you don't.  Menu is a little hard to navigate. Would probably improve service if more info listed on the menu to avoid long explanations about menu items. Address is also a bit confusing to find, walked past it initially.

Review1023.Review: One of the best sushi places I've tried. Excellent and rare options of fish in the menu. Extraordinary quality and freshness. We had the sashimi selection which was superb and then a variety of nigiris most of them recommended by the waiter which were some of the best bites I've ever had.the only thing that can improve is the time, we waited a long time between some of our dishes and when we tried to repeat some of our favorites, they didn't have anymore of most of the special ones. Which I understand, but I felt bad for all the people that were just getting ready to order.

Review1024.Review: Unbelievable fresh top quality fish. We went for lunch and shared nigiris and rolls. Would go there every time that I want sushi if I was leaving in San Francisco! Staff is very nice also.

Review1026.Review: The waiter who served us was not good. He was kind of indifferent the entire time, please ask him to put  a smile on his face. Food was excellent though

Review1027.Review: Very good sushi. Not all the waiters speak English in a way you can understand it. A lot of regular guests it seems

Review1028.Review: Really outstanding sushi. Best I have had outside of Asia.

Review1029.Review: very good! Come with an open mind and let them select items for you. A great place to be a little adventurous because everything is great!

Review1030.Review: fabulous fresh fresh fish ex; mackerel  Delightful efficient and intelligent waiter.

Review1031.Review: The food was amazing. Everything was very fresh and I would recommend ordering a couple of items off their Nama menu for the freshest selection. If you are not sure what you want to try, the chefs there are more than happy to make recommendations which was a plus. The service was great and attentive.

Review1032.Review: Terrific, fresh sushi. Our server was excellent with recommendations.

Review1033.Review: Menu was hard to read in dim light. In fact, it was hard to see the food. Sushi and service were impeccable, but $10 for a beer is out of line.

Review1034.Review: Waiter & busboy were excellent. Points off due to hostess rushing us out due to next reservation. Could have been done more tactfully, she could have asked us if we wanted anything else versus telling us (for the first time) that someone was waiting for table.

Review1035.Review: Wonderful experience!  Top notch sushi, worth every penny! Entertaining and charming staff, well versed in their craft.

Review1037.Review: Fantastic sushi! It was some the best I have ever had.

Review1038.Review: Excellent sushi - the lunch combos are definitely worth it.

Review1039.Review: I went to an early dinner at Akiko's and sat at the sushi bar.  I did not order the chef's choice omakase, but was ordering ala carte.  After being served one item in almost 45 minutes, I left.  The restaurant was not very busy, as I arrived when the opened at 5:30 PM and was one of the first customers seated.  I have been here several times over the past few months, and the food is great.  The service is usually very good as well.  I will go back again, I am sure, but I will make sure that I am served by someone who actually wants to provide service.

Review1040.Review: ray lee's akiko is probably the best sushi in the country right now. no joke.

Review1041.Review: Akiko's is a tiny gem!  We were a group of four in the large window - watched many people walk in surprised they could not be accommodated.  The sushi was amazing.  Fried baby Mackerel was even better than the smelts at Kokkari.  Our waiter helped us pick a bottle of Sake that was also amazing.  For a group of 4 it was $200 after tip.  One of the sushi doubled in price if you added rice (mini bummer) and there is not much space by the bathroom area (understood since it's tiny!  Cannot wait to go back.

Review1042.Review: Great meal as always! Esp. enjoyed the kampachi nigiri with lime zest.

Review1043.Review: Food was good. My guest said one of pieces of sashimi was off. However, I had sashimi, too and it was all fresh and delicious. Service was a bit rushed but adequate. In past, service was excellent.

Review1044.Review: Great food. Probably best scallop I've ever had. Got 10 rounds of 2 nigiris for two of us. High quality fish indeed. The server was a little lacking in patience, but who knows maybe just a bad day. Wouldn't go back but would recommend for fresh high quality sushi lovers in the city.

Review1045.Review: Outstanding lunch service again.  My favorite sushi place in San Francisco, not to be confused with 542 Mason Street's Akikos which is unrelated.  I always  trust the expertise of the very attractive Asian men lol. Pieces range from 5-12 dollars each and come in an appropriate progression from mild flavored fish to fatty pieces at the end.  They do a great job describing the dishes in detail and they are always busy. Prepare to spend 60-100 or more per head if you're really treating yourself not including drinks and tip.

Review1046.Review: Terrible experience, from the start in arranging the table are annoying already, were late 15 minutes but they claimed like it was a pack house. Its empty and lots of table are available. Food are very very basic in fact the beef teriyaki and gyu beef are terrible. Hamachi kama are okay and sashimi are okay.

Review1047.Review: wonderful nigiri, excellent spider roll, great service! will definitely come back next time we're in San Fran!

Review1048.Review: The finest nigiri and sashimi I've had.  Akiko's is entirely focused on those rather than rolls.$250 for sushi, 500ml bottle of sake and tip for a light meal for two people.  I would expect to double that if I wanted to eat with abandon.

Review1049.Review: I've eaten on hundreds of sushi restaurants, ranging from the super cheap to the really fancy ones.Akiko wants to be in the upper level and their prices certainly are, but extraordinary prices wasn't paired with extraordinary sushi/sashimi.

Review1050.Review: The food is excellent. The service is top-notch. Can't recommend it enough.

Review1051.Review: The food is so delicious and fresh!

Review1052.Review: Went on a Thursday night at 7:00pm with a party of 2. We arrived a little early, but were seated immediately. We had the sake, avocado and spider rolls, sake and tako sashimi, edamame, miso soup and the greens. All were very good. The fish was very fresh and tasty. The service was a little slow at first but overall was fine. The place is a little pricey, but the fish is great and well worth it. One word of caution, the chicken and beef teriyaki, tonkatsu, etc. are only available for lunch. Sushi only for dinner. Highly recommend.

Review1053.Review: Tamago, akimo, fois gras, japanese tuna shoulder, tuna otoro,

Review1054.Review: Value was definitely worth the money. charged for sake which I didn't order. Didn't notice on bill until I went home. Dark inside restaurant couldn't see bill too well. Not worth the second visit.

Review1055.Review: Excellent experience from start to finish, the chefs did outstanding work.

Review1056.Review: Excellent Sushi. Super fresh. Superior quality. Best place is at the bar the see the chefs in action. You can say it's expensive, but for this level of quality absolutely worth the money. It's a very small restaurant so it's definitely necessary to make a reservation. Plus very cool selection of Japanese craft beers, which is another big plus (especially for me as a German)

Review1057.Review: I went in with some clients. The waiter pushed HARD for us to do what he called the Chef's Choice" and was pushing it on all the tables near us.  We said, eh, ok....BIG mistake.  There were 3 of us and we had maybe 8 dishes (3 pieces each and zero alcohol) and the guy brought us a $409 bill.  Shame on me for agreeing and shame on them for serving $400+ worth of food and never mentioning that they were bringing only THE most expensive items on the menu.It was clearly a scam...and it worked.  I couldn't complain in front of clients or I would have refused to pay it...but I am going back tomorrow to deal with this.

Review1058.Review: Loved the quality, variety and freshness of the food.  It is nice to have the opportunity to eat something outside the standard American sushi variety of shrimp, salmon, tuna.

Review1059.Review: Fantastic food.  Great service.  Very noisy.  Not energetic but distracting

Review1060.Review: few restaurants are as consistently reliable.the quality is the finest.

Review1061.Review: The best japanese food I´ve ever had, it is a must to go

Review1062.Review: Besides the front host being accommodating they were overall rude....no salmon and when we asked questions about the menu they acted like it was our fault we didn't understand Japanese!!! Not worth it overall

Review1063.Review: This is a great sushi place if you are totally loaded.  Otherwise, save your money.  We not only paid too much for our meal, but we got our car robbed while we were inside - they smashed the window and grabbed my kids backpacks.  Small pieces of sushi were good, but were a not a good value.  $437 for a family meal with tip, and we weren't full.

Review1064.Review: I was really excited to hit Akiko's and the food was solid, but the service was TERRIBLE. Our waiter was completely inattentive and when we ordered certain dishes we were told 20 minutes later that the kitchen was out of the dish.

Review1065.Review: Grande déception de notre séjour à San Francisco.Je ne crois pas que la qualité des produits offerts soit en cause.Mais: 1-le menu est difficile à comprendre 2- le serveur à qui nous avons demandé de l'aide pour choisir, n'a pas su s'adapter et nous a imposé un menu dégustation avec les composantes les plus chers du menu même après avoir mentionné ne pas apprécié certains types de poissons  3- le prix est exorbitant pour le peu que j'ai mangé

Review1066.Review: Way overpriced for what it is

Review1067.Review: The food was great along with the service .  Another great dining experience at Akiko's.

Review1069.Review: My favorite sushi in San Francisco. Fresh, delicious fish. Outstanding, helpful service which ensures that you have an opportunity to enjoy the best the restaurant has to offer that day.

Review1070.Review: The fish is sooo fresh, great menu.  people, very nice! A great atmosphere... one of my favorite restaurants in the city!

Review1071.Review: Loved the freshness of the fish and the special variety from Japan! Great lunch set.

Review1072.Review: The food is delicious and tge service is awesome. Great for lunch or dinner with friends or romantic dinner.

Review1073.Review: Just let Akiko make the decision for you. Go for the omakase. It was outstanding. Everything was fresh, varied and delicious.

Review1074.Review: Quality&variety of "neta" was great, so that everything is quite expensive. Sushi-meshi (rice for nigiri) were a bit too sweet to me.

Review1076.Review: Love the food at Aikiko, a bit pricey, but get to experience very fresh fish and some interesting varieties.

Review1077.Review: Was in town for a visit from Seattle and went looking for great sushi.  Akiko's reviews suggest that it is the place.  It was good, but not remarkable at all.  Seattle has at least a dozen places that are a lot better.  So the morale of the story is save your sushi splurge for Seattle.

Review1078.Review: Fantastic sushi restaurant in downtown SF. Fresh ingredients. Great service.

Review1079.Review: the staff was nice, the food was great - but only after one hour (before we even had emptied our plates we received the bill and the staff started cleaning up our plates and half empty drinks. Not very nice.. I think they were overbooked and needed out table, but we could not know that.  So we spent a lot of money in  a very short time in this place.

Review1080.Review: It was ok.  The salmon belly sashimi was excellent.  Otherwise, the rest of the food was ok.  Huge prices for ok sushi.  Service only ok.  Would not return.

Review1081.Review: What an excellent experience to have the chef prepare and share the nightly favorites with an explanation of each and history.

Review1083.Review: My dining experience at Akiko's was outstanding and the service was great.

Review1084.Review: Absolutely incredible experience. This was an anniversary dinner and we each got the Omakase, two rolls for the table, and a bottle of wine. Our server made the experience one to remember and walked us through every plate. It was timed to perfection. Could not recommend this place more highly. Expect to pay for the experience, but it was well worth it for the experience, freshness, and high quality sushi.

Review1085.Review: We did the omakase and were disappointed. There were certain standouts - the trout and uni spring to mind - but we were underwhelmed by the food.  Even worse we felt very rushed.  We have done omakase many times before and were always served one dish at a time.  At Akiko's, our server brought out 2, 3, even 4 dishes at the same time.  He cautioned us to eat quickly as the nigiri was getting stale and losing its intended flavor.  It's frustrating at a restaurant of any quality or price point to feel rushed through your meal, but we felt genuinely angry when we received the bill. Extremely expensive and far from worth it.

Review1086.Review: Food was decent, service was lacking. We ordered a bottle of hot saki and we didn't get it until our sushi was served.

Review1087.Review: Small but intimate sushi restaurant.  Dish portions are small for price, so value not high.  Many different fish selections, and all extremely fresh and tasty.  Rolls are excellent.  Good service, will return.

Review1088.Review: We are very picky sushi/sashimi eaters -it really has to be high quality for us to enjoy it. After looking at the lengthy menu, we decided to go for the omakase. It was truly divine. I would go back again tonight if they had a table together. At the end, the chef/owner came out to present the dishes and explain his process. Bravo!

Review1089.Review: We had a great nigiri dinner. Every piece of sushi was delicious. The nama selection was impressive. We had the server pick our sake base on our order and it was good. We will be back.

Review1090.Review: We've been wanting to go to Akiko's for some time now, hearing about the quality sushi and food from others and what we've read.  Finally made the other evening, and it didn't disappoint.  In fact it was quite the experience, we were impressed with everything we ate.The menu is expensive, definitely not a newbie sushi kind of place.  We thought we knew our fish until we saw the daily special menu of fish most of which we have never heard of.  So being our first time we leaned on our waiter to put together omokase selection for us based on what we typically like, and what we don't care for.  The 6 sashimi's and 4 nigiri sushi's were increadible, and afterwards said it will be hard to eat sushi anywhere else after this.  Everything was so fresh, clean tasting, we actually never ended up using the wasabi and soy sauce on the side, didn't need it.  Along with the sushi, also got the cod and fried squid, both were amazing in themselves.  Don't forget to get recommendations on sake to pair with your meal.Not cheap, yet not over the top expensive either.  Make reservations in advance to get in, it's a small restaurant.  Worth a visit if strolling around the Union Square areas.  I believe lunch offers more hot food in addition to the sushi.

Review1091.Review: Fish was so fresh and chef Alex was just fantastic.  Thank you

Review1092.Review: Great, personal service. Varied, unusual, and very delicious food offerings. Not your everyday sushi by far. Special place.  Highly recommended.

Review1093.Review: expensive but the best sashimi I've ever had.  pleasent and really fresh.  we left and had to go grab a bite of pizza.  after spending $275.00.  but it was delicious.

Review1094.Review: The food and service was very good. But even as omakase usually goes, they had very small portions for their prices imo. Everything was delicious however.

Review1095.Review: Nicely done presentation and overall experience. Tools and nitro were all done well.

Review1096.Review: The nigiri and sashimi pieces are great, while pricey they have a wonderful selection of fish that isn't offered most places. I would stay away from the rolls. They are very sauce heavy, lacking in creativity, and clearly an afterthought. I really felt it was a waste of money and space in my stomach. The service could be better, at least when you're sitting at the bar. Staff there are responsive, but perhaps not the most friendly.

Review1097.Review: The sushi was so fresh and our server was so well informed and helpful. I will be back!

Review1098.Review: Akiko's was very good as usual and the service was outstanding.

Review1099.Review: went with a japanese friend. she lived it. so did i, but what do i know?

Review1100.Review: This was the best meal we've ever had.

Review1101.Review: Leave your meal in the sushi chefs hands and enjoy an incredibly creative dinner. Very very fresh fish. I can't wait to return!

Review1102.Review: Always a pleasure eating here. Very expensive but if you're after an experience beyond the usual selection of fish varieties, this place is the spot to try. Found myself tasting barracuda, perch, unprocessed Hokkaido uni, and other things I'd never tried despite years of eating sushi. I'd recommend this place to any sushi afficionado.

Review1103.Review: Really excellent fish. Small portions and high prices, but you get what you pay for. The server was very helpful in giving us recommendations

Review1104.Review: This is really an outstanding place for best quality fish and sushi! Being from NY we are spoiled by many good, known sushi restaurants, but Akiko is one of a kind! I strongly recommend everyone in San Francisco to try this place, if haven't yet!

Review1105.Review: Great service. Great food. Definitely with it. Our server had great recommendations on food for our "second round" of sushi (based on what we had liked the most in round 1). Thanks for the great meal! We will be back!

Review1106.Review: It's not only good Sushi, it's also creative. We asked the waiter to pick a variety of sushi from the menu for us. He served us with an authentic enthusiasm explaining all the details about the creations he placed in front of us. They were excellent. Great fish, great spices and wonderfully made.

Review1107.Review: Each plate was like a poem! Really spectacular. And expert guidance from our server about fish we'd never encountered before.

Review1108.Review: For the FiDi area, this is one of the best sushi restaurants around.

Review1109.Review: Great fresh fish - sashimi especially good. Space is also sleek and easy on the eye.

Review1110.Review: We let the waiter choose and it was incredible! But probably the most we've spent in dinner for two.

Review1111.Review: I've been to Akiko's for about a handful of times, either dates or with a small group.  The fish quality and freshness there is great and has never falter. The service people is always enthusiastic and most of the time has the knowledge about the food.  Though the food is great in general, there are some consistency issues.  The consistency level seems to differ between chefs.  My normal pick is the ensui uni, which is hokkaido uni served with a small bite of rice, nigiri style, on a spoon.  The first couple times the uni would be served in whole pieces (about 3-4 per spoon), not scrambled, no cuts, just plain whole piece.  The last time I visited, the same uni was like scrambled!  Even though the taste doesn't change much, it had a different texture.  It's just not as exquisite as it should be.  Another item, which is another of my go to, especially for lunch, is the teriyaki chicken.  The first three times I've had it, it was tender, juicy, and clean.  There would be a thick-ish teriyaki sauce under it with minimal toppings (broccoli or just a piece of greens).  The last two time I had it, it changed to a less thick teriyaki sauce, and topped with asparagus and kim chi.  The chicken wasn't as tender and has the texture of which I can buy from a fast food Chinese restaurant.  Not sure what happened there.

Review1112.Review: My wife and I made a point to reserve a spot at the sushi bar for our first experience with omakase. I can say that this was, without question, the best sushi meal I've ever had, and probably one of the top two or three best restaurant meals I've had overall. The food was simply outstanding, the service was excellent, just great in every detail. The price tag was quite steep, so I wouldn't necessarily recommend it for an everyday dinner, but as a special occasion for us it was well worth it. We've been talking about it to everyone we know for a week now.

Review1113.Review: Always great. Reservation necessary. Be sure to order from the specials menu at dinner.

Review1114.Review: I'm a partner of sushi restaurants in Los Angeles, so I come at this with a reasonable knowledge and understanding about fish, sushi and traditional style sushi. Great sushi in San Francisco is hard to find but Akiko comes darn close as the real deal. Will definitely go back.

Review1115.Review: Excellent nigiri. Great service at the sushi bar. Superb sakes.

Review1116.Review: The sushi was absolutely delicious!  The server was so helpful in guiding us to the right choices of sushi. It was just a wonderful evening.

Review1117.Review: Great dinner experience—flown in from Japan, the sushi and sashimi were incredibly fresh and delectable. The Japanese uni and live scallop are a must.

Review1118.Review: I went here with my husband for dinner during our 5-day stay in San Fran.  They have a great selection of fish flown from Japan.   Hokkaido uni and ocean trout were delicious.   My husband loved his Toro.  Rice to sushi ratio was on point. The place is a little cramp and they didn't have live scallop so minus 1 star for that.   Service was very good and non-intrusive.Overall,  I think this place has great sushi that's reasonably priced especially when comparing it to sushi restaurants in New York.   I would definitely return when I'm back in San Fran.

Review1119.Review: this is as close as it gets to Japan sushi sceneoriginal food sources and very tasty dishes

Review1120.Review: This was our second visit to Akiko's, and we'll be back many times.  Somehow, the chef manages to create dishes that are completely original and yet remain authentically Japanese.  In particular, we hope the black cod is still on the menu next time we visit;  the nigiri sushi and saba shioyaki were excellent as well.

Review1121.Review: There was nothing special about the food at Akiko.  We arrived at 12:00 for a 12:15 and had to wait 15 minutes to be seated in a empty dining room, meantime there isn't a lounge to wait in.  Once we arrived at our table, our waiter pushed us to have the chef select our food, when we politely declined and ordered from the menu we were told that they were out of almost everything on the menu.  Note the restaurant just opened on a Thursday afternoon.  It was very strange and uncomfortable at this point. The waiter also seemed nervous and impatient to take our Ala cart order because as we were ordering he made no eye contact and looked around the room.  He was clearly annoyed he had to take an order.  It encouraged me to look around as I noticed everyone was eating the same thing! As the food arrived it was messy, some fallen over on the plate to the point the fish eggs had spilled out. As it came time for our bill it was to no surprise that it was $150 for lunch that included two mid price cold sake and very little food, where we both left hungry.  I would save you time and money and skip even trying this place.  I had been interested in going since the chronicle wrote an article on Akiko's blue shrimp dish, but of course they we're out of that as well.  Note they were not out because they sold out, they were out of items because the chef didn't order enough fish.  This restaurant is obviously struggling with food costs, ordering and scared so much of waste that it should go to a set menu option to be more honest with guest.  Overall, a very strange dining experience.

Review1122.Review: everything we ordered was good.  was hoping to celebrate my wifes bday with a cake or something. they were quite nice and brought out an ice-cream delicacy thing though since they didn't have dessert offerings beyond that.

Review1123.Review: Good and service were fantastic and worth the price.  The space is way too tight.  I hope they get to expand soon.  We will definitely go back.

Review1124.Review: Such a great meal and a deal considering you're eating fish that is super fresh - often coming out of the waters of Japan less than 20 hours ago. We did the omakase and were pleasantly surprised that we were allowed to add in a hot dish. We got to try many things that were thoughtfully presented, such as California vs Japanese Uni, and Monkfish liver. The pacing of the meal was slow at times, two plus hours in total. Our beer and a handroll came out slow and they were comped without us asking. I'm Japanese and visit Japan yearly and this stands up to the well regarded sushi restaurants of Tsukiji.

Review1125.Review: As a frequent traveler to SF, a city with several great sushi restaurants, this stands out as my favorite.  The menu of fresh fish constantly changes, and whatever is available is always top quality.  Texture, temperature and flavor are perfect, without fail.  The hot dishes are also delicious, but it's the sushi that makes me keep coming back for more.

Review1126.Review: By far, the BEST Japanese restaurant in SF!!!

Review1127.Review: Great sushi and talented chefs made this experience one of our favorites!  The variety and unique preparation of each fish created an unbelievable flavor combination.  What a nice memory form our visit.

Review1128.Review: Best fish I've had that wasn't within driving distance to tsukiji. Amazing.

Review1129.Review: the ingredients are the finest.the creations are artful.

Review1130.Review: Excellent food in a very small setting.  Best to make reservations in advance as it gets very busy for lunch and dinner.

Review1131.Review: My wife and I made a reservation weeks ahead to eat at this hip sushi restaurant. After driving by the location a couple times and not seeing it from our car, we parked and walked to the address. Still we couldn't find it and ended up in an Irish bar. There, the hostess told me Akiko's was next door. It was. It didn't have a sign anywhere to show diners the location. Very odd but I suppose it's hip.Originally, I had asked for the sushi bar but the person taking my reservation told me that was dependent on whether it was open when we arrived. No reservations for sushi bar. Oddly, the sushi bar was half full when we arrived but they were "saving" those seats for more important people, I presume. Isn't that a reservation? Perhaps this too is a hip plan.The first table the hostess tried to seat us at was directly behind the front door in a teency corner. That didn't look good so we waited for a table. The food was fine. The best being the fish flown in from Japan. Astronomically expensive, but again, that made the place even more hip. All in all, I've been to sushi restaurants that were much friendlier and had wonderful food. There were just to many obstacles to want to go back to Akiko's.

Review1132.Review: I was so excited to have lunch here during a business trip in my home town of SF.  I made reservations well in advance.  The waiter convinced me to do a "tasting" menu rather than order from the menu because "we are out of everything and receive everything fresh anyway".  Okay sounds good to me.  He brought one plate of 5 pieces of nigiri - absolutely fabulous.  My business colleague, whom I was meeting for the first time, ordered from the menu and received his multiple plates of sushi.  Nothing ever arrived after the first plate.  I waited and waited and should have spoken up but with a tasting menu you assume you are being taken care of and i was so hungry and embarrassed in front my work colleague I just left hungry.

Review1133.Review: My daughter and I went here on a Friday night.  It was very busy.  We were seated at the front, close to the reception area, so we knew you have to reserve a table in order to get a table. The restaurant is very small.  Service was friendly but we did feel rushed.  This is not a place to go and spend an evening with friends, catching up with news.  You just go there, eat and get out.  So for family it would be OK.Were the food worth it?  We didn't think so.  We ordered 4 different types of rolls: Soft shell crabs, spicy tuna, California (they called it Avocado here), and Foto.  Soft shell crabs roll was good, spicy tuna was too spicy, Foto Maki was the worst I have ever tasted and California was plain.  The miso Black Cod was very fresh but tasteless.  Overall, dinner was pleasant, but we were not impressed.  There was nothing remarkable served in this place except maybe the soft shell crab roll.  Maybe we ordered the wrong food and should have ordered Sashimi instead.

Review1134.Review: Tasty, delicious, fresh, great service, quality ingredients... not exactly cheap but always worth it.

Review1135.Review: This may be an expensive meal, but it's puritanical sushi at it's finest.

Review1136.Review: I invited my waiter to curate my lunch. Sashimi was followed by nigiri & a single cooked dish of black cod & a special Roll. Much of what we tasted was flown in from Japan (sea urchin & toro among others).  It was an exotic & authentic exploration of flavored & textures. Did I mention the homemade soy sauce.  Lunch for two $220. Tokyo prices to match.

Review1137.Review: Waiting staff was just below. Front of house chefs were good, but lost focus on me as there was a couple single girls to my left, which had all the attention.  Plus several items that I wanted were missing on the menu.I won't go back again, as there is fair better in San Francisco.

Review1138.Review: You won't be disappointed with the sushi here.  One of the best sushi experiences in SF with fish you can't find all at one location!  Be prepared to spend but you'll love it!

Review1139.Review: Akiko's was excellent! Our waiter was very friendly, informative, and recommended dishes to match our taste and his favorite fish. I highly recommend getting the omakase, very fresh fish and I like how it is served in waves for a nice dinner flow. I also like that it is an omakase dinner not just omakase sushi/sashimi like at other restaurants. The Hara Sake sashimi (seared salmon belly) was to die for; melts in your mouth! This is the perfect spot for date night or a special occasion. Intimate setting, great service, and delicious food. We will definitely be back again!

Review1140.Review: Another amazing meal at what may be our favorite Japanese restaurant of all! We chose Akiko's to celebrate our engagement. Sushi Chef, Alex took great care of us as did the rest of the staff. Omakase was outstanding. Can't wait to go back. Tough to get a reservation as seating is limited but your efforts will pay off. This is a must go if you are a fan of eating sushi the way it was meant to be eaten as opposed to it being rolled up with cream cheese and deep fried. Try and get a spot at the sushi bar if you're down to park it for a couple hours and be in the hands of some very skilled sushi chefs.

Review1141.Review: I live, breathe and die for sushi. Akiko's lives up to my preference. They are not the Californian rolls or any of those rolls hipsters have commercialized and ruined with their organic, gluten free, no gmo ingredients and sauces. I'm talking about raw, straight from the sea, fresh sashimi, nigiri and the omakase. They also have uni from SB and Hokkaido which is a bonus for me!

Review1142.Review: If you are looking for an all-in experience, the Omakase (selection of chef's menu) at Akiko's is pretty terrific. We started with a salad followed by a sashimi platter and then about a dozen of Nigiri. Everything was outstanding and the service was perfect!

Review1143.Review: There was no restaurant name on the entrance, anywhere. Need to remember the address number if you go there at first time. We had lunch, Nigiri combination and Food was fresh and good taste, but they forgot to serve our miso soups. We notice it and had it. The miso soup taste was not so excellent.

Review1144.Review: A consistent favorite, where the service, presentation and flavorful dishes never disappoint. This is a place to relax, enjoy great food in a small intimate setting, to recharge one's batteries in the middle of the day. I try to come here at least once a month to get my fix of the perfect sushi.

Review1145.Review: Enjoyable somewhat different menu from what we are used to in the east coastA bit overpricedGood service

Review1146.Review: an unexpected excellent meal, all fresh, imaginative and a good cold saki menu

Review1147.Review: Fantastic service.  Outstanding sushi in a nice setting.

Review1148.Review: Highest quality fish I've had in some time.

Review1149.Review: Great trout sushi and copper river salmon!

Review1150.Review: Very good I enjoyed my meal

Review1151.Review: The omakase was underwhelming especially at $120+ per person.  Nothing really stood out, good plating and presentation but few wow moments.  Some dishes were exquisite, buttery and fresh sashimi.  But most were...meh.  They did nothing for our anniversary dinner, not even a "Happy Anniversary".  Food service had no flow, sometimes two dishes arrived at once and sometimes there was a 15-30 minute break in between.  Not impressed and not headed back.

Review1152.Review: Our party of 4 had a lovely omikase meal.  It was all fresh and delicious and well-prepared, and the chef's selections allowed us to sample fish we probably wouldn't have known to order.  Our uni was wonderful and generous.
