The service was great.  Our wine paired well with our meal.  We will return.This restaurant at 431 Bush has no sign and is a little hard to find because of that, but trust the address.  It is not related to another restaurant by the same name that closer to Union Square.

Review1153.Review: Wonderful, reasonably priced omakase at the sushi bar.

Review1154.Review: Some of the best sushi in the country! Also has a great modern decor not found in many sushi bars.

Review1155.Review: A large selection of Japanese delicacies with the freshest of ingredients...beautifully prepared. Very knowledgable and welcoming staff who are experts in selecting a meal for you.Remember the street name and number...there is no sign for the restaurant. Interesting that most of the chefs are Caucasian while most of the clients are Asian! Always reserve.

Review1156.Review: We loved the food there. Sushi were simple but superb, fish is in good quality, and is very well prepared. Sake selection is wonderful and had a complex taste

Review1157.Review: Very good sushi, fish selection was great.  However the service was lacking the food quality.  Service staff was unsure of themselves and it showed.

Review1158.Review: I've had lunch at Akiko's several times, and it has been consistently solid - good food, good service, and a unique atmosphere. I definitely recommend checking it out!

Review1159.Review: Excellent, attentive service contributed to the special feeling of the dinner, though the incredible omakase that sushi chef Nao created for me needed no help to feel remarkable.  Everything he presented was a delicious balance of texture and flavors.  Standouts were the nana hotate (scallops), butterfish stuffed with spicy crab roll and seared, shim-aji (striped jack), albacore with sesame soy sauce (this was a surprise to me - it was unexpectedly tender and lightly charred, a preparation of albacore I'd never had before), salmon (so simple but superb), and uni.  I would return for a special occasion in a heartbeat, the small restaurant is a beautiful and cozy space but sit at the bar if you want to watch the talented Nao at work.

Review1160.Review: In a word, wonderful. One of the best sushi experiences of my life. The daily "nama" menu offers delicacies that are rarely available on this side of the pacific. Each dish is expertly crafted with true respect for the ingredients. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Review1161.Review: Best sushi in the city.  Little known spot - no sign. Enjoy!!

Review1162.Review: I had a 6:30 dinner reservation for a party of 1 on a Saturday. I arrived promptly to the restaurant and checked in with the hostess. She checked me in and led me to the bar. I looked at the bar stool and it did not have a back support. I told the hostess that I have a back problem and the bar stool will not provide me w/ the needed support. She said that tables are reserved for parties of 2, even though I was seated before at a table w/o asking, and that they are fully booked and that she will try to find a table.Scanning around a restaurant, I could see that they had 3 open 2-tops and 2 open 4-tops along w/ 2 open bar stools.She got back to me and said that if I want a table, I have to wait, and that my seating will be limited to an hour. I told her that I was planning to have the omakase and that an hour is not enough. She said that I have to set at the bar if I am to get the omakase. Then she started lecturing me that an omakase was best with a face-to-face interaction w/ the chef.She made me feel that my reservation was less valuable than other reservations. I was about to spend $150+ and I was not about to risk back pain for that. I told the hostess that I was not about to risk getting back pain and left.

Review1163.Review: I love going to Akiko's and sitting at the Chef's Center and having the Chef choose my menu for me. I am never disappointed. The fish is pristine and I love being told the regions in Japan where the fish is obtained. I I love the ambiance at the Chef's counter and the choice of wines and bubblies. Service is the best!

Review1164.Review: Our server was misleading about the price of the Omakase meal. If you go there you must instruct them to stop serving you at a pre-set price point otherwise the restaurant will surprise you with the final bill. We asked about the price before ordering and he replied it 'started at 100 dollars', and we said that we were ok with around 100 dollars. But it felt like a bait and switch when the bill came back 150 per guest (we were treating one of the diners as a going away celebration so each of us paid more than $200). This is just an ingenuine way of doing business. The final bill is simply all the ala carte charges added up.  There is no benefit in price for choosing the omakase. To know the cost ahead of time, you should order on your own, or be hyper vigilant. Unfortunately having to state this sort of defeats the purpose of going out to dine here. The food IS very good; but we left there with the proverbial bad taste in our mouths---disappointed and upset about the dishonesty more than anything else, and thus unable to recommend Akiko to others for fear of that our friends would suffer the same treatment. We also see that others have made the same complaint so assume the restaurant doesn't see any need to alter its practice.

Review1165.Review: All I need to say is that our first bite didn't come until an HOUR after we sat down. Really unacceptable service.

Review1166.Review: First time there and had to try the Omakase.  Well worth it!  I'm looking forward to eating there again.

Review1167.Review: We always get the chef's selection and love it.

Review1168.Review: If you're into rolls with lots of sauces and interesting combinations of ingredients, don't come here.  Don't get me wrong, they do make some rolls here, and the ones that I've tried are very good, but the roll selection is very limited and there are many other restaurants that do rolls far better.  If, however, you appreciate traditional sushi done extremely well, and you want the chance to try different kinds of fish that you might not see on most menus in a small, intimate setting where the service is top-notch, or if you finally got up the courage to ask out that guy in accounting or the girl in the engineering department (and you know they like sushi!), this is the place.I'd suggest ordering from the nama menu, which has all of the specials that are in season and where you're most likely to find something you've never seen before.  Try the horsehair crab or the goldeneye snapper if they have it.

Review1169.Review: This is my favorite sushi place in the city. The quality of the fish is exceptional, service is always good.

Review1170.Review: Food is awesome, fresh. A bit pricey but well worth it. Our server was attentive but not so friendly. Maybe she was having a bad day?They were out of the beni toro and shiro toro...Nothing special- EdamameTasty- Saba sashimi- Hamachi sashimi- Ice cream mochi (strawberry, green tea, mango)Amazing!- Wagyu nigiri- Ika nigiri- Hotate sashimi

Review1171.Review: This is definitely one of the best sushi restaurants in the financial district for selection, quality and presentation.  I would recommend this spot to a friend.

Review1172.Review: The recently remodeled Akiko is even more zen, with subdued hues and wood, a highly visible sushi kitchen and bar, well designed tables, high grade wooden chopsticks, all of which make the dining experience even better. The sushi is artfully prepared and presented, fresh of course, and satisfying. Not an everyday experience as the price is in the upper reaches. But every time I've been here (lunches only so far) I've been impressed and delighted with the sushi offerings and the gracious service. Will definitely be here again.

Review1173.Review: the food is top quality, the presentation of the dishes, the fish is fresh. A unique experience if you like Japanese food. I would recommend it for special ocassions, as it is not cheap

Review1174.Review: Loved every minute of it! Best sushi in town, true omakase style. Can't wait to go back.

Review1175.Review: It wasn't bad. The fish was high quality and the nigiri/sashimi is good but they drown their rolls in sauces to the point they are almost inedible if you don't wipe some off. The hostess seemed to look down on the majority of the people that came in and asked for a table (even if they had a reservation), which I personally find off-putting. I wouldn't go again.

Review1176.Review: No, really. The portion was modest, but the flavor was amazing. Akiko has great presentation and flavor, but is not exactly a bargain. I've had better rolls and fish for much less. However if you're in the FiDi and want to impress your clients with delicious Japanese/sushi lunch, look no further.

Review1177.Review: Fish was fresh but not creative. Very basic rolls & basic nigiri.

Review1178.Review: We sit at bar ordering omakase, most of it is nigiri unless you order something else. There is no set price or set menu, they just charge you per piece. Overall it's a good experience.

Review1179.Review: I'm a sushi nut. I've eaten sushi all over the world and would quickly classify it as my favorite food. I've admittedly become a bit of a sushi snob over the years, and at this point I would prefer to go out once every couple months to a really fantastic sushi restaurant and pay a premium for quality fish than to go out every few weeks to a mediocre sushi restaurant just to get my fix. Akiko's may be one of the most expensive restaurants to eat at in the city, but it's very much worth the premium you pay there. If you know your sushi really well, come give this place a shot and be prepared to walk out with an empty wallet and a big smile on your face.

Review1180.Review: Outstanding service. Outstanding food. Make sure you call for reservations.  Very small place with limited tables, so you won't be able to just walk in for a meal without having to wait a few hours.

Review1181.Review: Bottom line: excellent sushi (e.g. specials menu Aka Matsu, as good as ones in Tokyo), excellent waitstaff (name Ray and he was very patient and informative with my sushi naive wife and daughter,  he remembered 10 different order w/o writing it down (impressed my young dtr), and friendly to boot).  Also excellent presentation and service timing.  Only knock on restaurant is seating very cramped in back (luckily we sat in corner by front door).  Definitely worth repeat returns.

Review1182.Review: You know a place is good when it doesn't have a sign.  In all seriousness, this place is amazing.  Very tiny and hard to find for an out of town we like we were but it was so good we actually went back for lunch the next day.  The Forty Niner rolls were the best rolls we've ever had!  For dinner we also went with the Nigiri tasting (6 pieces for mid-$20s) which was awesome, the fish was fresh and delicious with amazing texture.  Next time we're in town we are going to try the sashimi tasting.I highly recommend this place.

Review1183.Review: I would have given a higher rating if a) we had had counter seating as requested (the previous party was lingering in) and b) prices weren't so high. The nigiri we ordered was very good overall, we mostly picked from the chef's selection. Good sake selection as well. It was just a shame to have to sit at a table but otherwise a very good dining experience.

Review1184.Review: Awesome sushi. Fresh, tasty and well prepared. The wait staff is friendly and very attentive. The sake list is extensive with interesting options. They were fully booked on a Wednesday, so make a reservation. Also, know the address as there is not an obvious sign with the name of the restaurant.

Review1185.Review: We had a truly memorable dinner at Akiko's. The place is really low key, but the food coming out is surprising. We lived the octopus and cucumber salad, and the yellowtail shoulder was probably the best sashimi I've ever had. Our server was very good, suggesting special dishes as we moved on with our dinner, he just kept them coming. Would have returned every night of my visit to San Francisco if I could.

Review1186.Review: went for an exceptional omakase experience and left disappointed.  Akikos is still a great sushi restaurant but it is now pretty basic, unlike when Chef Ricky was there.  the quality of fish wasn't as good either.  I won't be going back.

Review1187.Review: Sushi, service, selection and overall quality of this place was spot on and the highest I've seen in a long time.  No sign outside and it's a little hidden, but that was nice.  Many people turned away at the door wo reservations, so make one if you can!

Review1188.Review: Akiko's was absolutely delicious and an overall great dining experience. The fish was some of the freshest I've ever had. I would say come here for the sashimi and nigiri. The rolls were good too, but to really reap the benefit, it's great to taste the fish on its own. In terms of atmosphere, it is a really small restaurant, so the tables are pretty close to each other. However, that didn't get in the way of my experience at all. I could still easily hear and talk to my dining partner. Our waiter was also great. Overall - YES.

Review1189.Review: Good for a small group that is looking for sushi.  Wait staff is friendly, and the sushi is fresh and flavorful.  Not a big menu, but what they do, they do well.

Review1190.Review: A little pricey (~$125 per person for 2 omakases and 2 additional rolls), but we were celebrating a birthday so it was well worth the money! Restaurant was actually pretty small, about 15 people at tables and about 6 at the bar, so we made reservations a few weeks in advance. The food was of very high quality and extremely fresh--highly recommend for special occasions!

Review1191.Review: This is the best sushi I have had in the U.S. Truly. The freshness and preparation are perfect and the staff is very knowledgeable and friendly. Reservations are a must, preferably a few weeks in advance.

Review1192.Review: Need a reservation, make one two weeks in advance. It was very good. Nigiri was expensive but the rolls were very reasonable.

Review1193.Review: Clearly there has been some kind of change since my last visit, as the menu is smaller.  The 49er Roll is still amazing but what kind of sushi restaurant doesn't have gyoza?  Really?!?  Now, they've made go look for another place that has gyoza.

Review1194.Review: We really enjoyed our dining experience at Akiko's.  Great sushi and temendous quality.  SFFood Fest favorite which brought us to the resturant for dinner.  Would reccomend to others and plan to go again soon!

Review1195.Review: My husband and I came here to celebrate his birthday. It is a very small and quiet sushi bar. Not a place to go if you want a vibrant bar scene. We loved it as it gave us the opportunity to have a conversation. The staff went above and beyond making me vegetarian food which I really appreciated since my husband is the only one who eats fish.

Review1196.Review: Best Japanese food in SF.  Period.  Rivals that of LA.  Experience is best when you sit at the bar and eschew the menu.

Review1197.Review: Hard to find as it is currently within a building under a construction site, so you can't see the name of the restaurant or the building number as it is surrounded by construction panels. Good variety of sashimi and sushi but ridiculously expensive for what you are getting. Definitely not value for price!Not kid friendly and too noisy.

Review1198.Review: Some of the best, if not the best, sushi in the City.

Review1199.Review: My second time coming here for lunch, and I would definitely come again! I've tried nearly all the sushi rolls, and just about all of them will redefine the meaning of sushi for you! With that said, my personal favorite is the unagi-ku. During my next visit, I will try the sashimi/nigiri.

Review1200.Review: I made a reservation for one approximately two hours before lunch time because of reviews on Trip Advisor. I was greeted and seated by two very nice hostesses. I saw many people turned away because there was literally no room and they didn't have reservations. The place is small - I would think it can only seat about 40-50 people. I had a nigiri 6 piece sample and the Maki specialty roll with a Pinot Noir. The presentation was flawless and the food very good. I commented to the sushi chef that one of my pieces seemed "fishy" - I didn't mean it was spoiled or bad, it was just not my favorite. He replaced it with a striped sea bass that was perfect. This was a recommendation from a "local" of where to find good sushi. Highly recommend.

Review1201.Review: The title of this review says it all. There were atleast 6 things on my list of desired items that "they were out of". It was so bad I had to literally ask what they "did" have. Ended up paying $20 for 2 small Uni because their regular $9 SF one was obviously "sold-out"Never going here again.Word of advice guys, if you're gonna run out of everything don't put it on the menu.

Review1202.Review: The mediocre quality Americanized Japanese food did not deserve the prices they charged. The hostess was not friendly at all when we first walked in and then asked us leave as soon as we finished eating and drinking as if there was a designated time slot for each table. I would not recommend this place. If you are desperate, I'd say go to the other Akiko around the corner from there. The food is the same quality, but just cheaper. I'm never going back to this place.

Review1203.Review: I went to Akiko based on several online reviews.  Overall, I was disappointed.  We went for lunch and got seated ahead of our reservation time, which was nice.  It was very cramped feeling and very noisy.  They were already out of three things listed on the menu (some of my very favorites).  What I did order was certainly 'adequate', but when I go out for sushi I expect much better.  I would go out of my way to go to Geta Sushi in Oakland in the future.

Review1204.Review: This place is so awesome I am inclined to keep my mouth shut.

Review1205.Review: Fantastic super fresh sashimi. Yes yes yes. Just go.

Review1206.Review: I refuse to tell anyone how amazing it was, because I want to always be able to get a table.

Review1207.Review: The food at Akiko happens to be quite good.  The service is another matter--poor and not necessarily the fault of the server.  The place should reduce the seating by about 40% to avoid having to listen to a neighbor's conversation.

Review1208.Review: One is the most disappointing dining experience. Starting on the outside as we walked in it smelled of garbage. The restaurant is located next to a dark alley on a very busy street. The seaweed salad was just the kind you can buy at any supermarket. The rolls had much rice and were falling apartThe main problem the restaurant didn't have any special something that makes you want to come back They didn't make any effort to be creative or have special sauces. It's a diner for sushi in the busy financial district (which seems like the only reason anyone would go there). After having a meal at Saru sushi full of love and creativity eating at akiko felt in satisfying and sad. If you love good full stay away

Review1209.Review: This place was turning away people left and right due to its small size. We had a reservation, but got lousy seats and lackluster service. We were seated near the door, not at the bar. The food was good, but the service so spotty, it is hard to give it a higher overall rating.

Review1210.Review: Miso soup ordinary, nothing outstanding. tempura was a great disappointment, batter soggy, greasy, heavy, brown and not flavorful. They need to change the oil as by after 1:30 pm how many times has the oil been cooked in? 4 pieces of sashimi nicely presented but not extraordinary.  Very over rated restaurant. I would recommend they not serve tempura. The sauce was pretty good but for $19, the tempura should've tasted and looked better. Couldn't really differentiate the favors of the various vegetables because the  batter was so bad. Presentation looked nice . It was my first long awaited dining experience there for me but probably my last time. Yet, I am not one to waste food, I finished my meal.

Review1211.Review: Excellent Japanese cuisine. The selection of fresh fish on the nama menu was excellent. Many great choices you cannot always find for a reasonable price. Excellent sushi rolls as well.

Review1212.Review: We did the omakase, it was fantastic.  Just keep in mind you are purchasing an experience as much as purchasing a meal.  Savor each piece and appreciate the differences in each.   You can always savor a burger later.

Review1213.Review: Amazing food & great service. This Japanese french inspired restaurant is one of a kind. The atmosphere is very formal & reminds you of another time.

Review1214.Review: Akiko's has excellent sushi and service is excellent. However it was frustrating that they didn't have a lot of the wine and fish listed on the menu. Granted we had a late reservation but maybe let us know before we order. Ended up going home hungry.

Review1215.Review: This might be the best sushi/sashimi I've had in San Francisco, hand's down.  But, the service left a bit to be desired.  Although everyone who helped us was very nice, it took more than 15 minutes for the waiter to take our order and the courses (we had the omakase) were spaced too far apart.  We will be back, but will sit at the sushi bar next time.

Review1216.Review: As mentioned on their website, Akiko's fish is more than fresh and suhis are just awesome. I have been too many sushi restaurants in the past including in Tokyo. Compared to many other places, this place rocks for sushis. I cannot say anything about the other few dishes that are available since sushis were so enjoyable and were what we only ordered.

Review1217.Review: Since my last omakase sushi experience in Seattle, I thought I was never going to find something as comparable. But I was wrong - every dish was beautifully plated like edible art. This isn't a run of the mill sushi boat restaurant. These guys are professionals and shokunin in their craft. Skip the rolls and order everything off the Nama menu. Trust me, it will be worth your while. I can't wait to come back. I swear, I could eat here everyday if I lived in the city!

Review1218.Review: Food was outstanding.  Because small space, they seemed focused on "in and out".  They wanted to put all food out same time like "family style".   Had to request they serve by course e.g. salad, soup, sushi.  High class food, low class style.

Review1219.Review: The team at Akiko's were, as always outstanding in every way.  The pace and order of the meal are perhaps my favorite parts of the experience, as you order - the suggestions made by the sushi chefs for food order really do make a difference, while increasing the enjoyment of any meal.  Best, freshest Fish in tow - bar none.

Review1220.Review: Best sashimi and sushi ever!was there 2 years ago with local friends, dreamed of this restaurant for 2 years ))) and had a dinner at the first day in SF on our second trip to the city. Perfect again! Highly recommend

Review1221.Review: Akiko's is a small restaurant located on Bush Street downtown.  There is a nice variety to their menu, but they shine on the variety and quality of their sushi/sashimi.   Be sure to ask for "off the menu" availability for the day.  Very casual and relaxed; the emphasis is on the food.

Review1222.Review: I love that the fish is always fresh and the taste is out of this world!

Review1223.Review: This has been one of my favorite sushi spots ever since I found it back in 2011. Since then it has been discovered, so be sure and make a reservation as seating is limited. Excellent, fresh ingredients, well prepared and served by an attentive staff. Being a smaller space, it can get a bit noisy, but nothing overbearing. Spicy tuna roll is a must order as is the seared salmon belly, yum!

Review1224.Review: Overall was a blast from start to finish went with Omakase menu and was extremely happy with it the chef that served me was very much innovative an familiar with his ingredients. He started me off right out of the box with Uni on top of Toro which was flamed. Wow the textures and smokiness of the char was like nothing I had ever had in a sushi bar. There were so many other pieces that just were wonderful a few stood out the prawn 2 ways both fried head and the raw tail was just confusing and flipped your palate in a direction I had never gone before the texture of the raw part was so unique. The Owner for most of the meal was the expediter and stood right at the sushi bar looking over each and every plate that left but  in a cool way.

Review1225.Review: Best sushi place in SF; the service is great, wine selection is favorable and the price is just in the ball park. would be nice to ad poke bowl to the menu :-)

Review1226.Review: Been here twice. First time both food and service was amazing. Second time food was still good but service was poor, almost non existent. Not sure what happened but ruined the dining experience for us. Will not be back.

Review1227.Review: We went here on vacation. The sushi was incredible. We aren't going to be able to enjoy mediocre Boston sushi anymore. Our waiter was very enthusiastic about the sake selection. The experience was intimate and relaxed.

Review1228.Review: The restaurant is not marked and is somewhat hard to find but worth the effort.

Review1229.Review: Don't be surprised if you walk right by the restaurant... we did.  There is no sign, and it is a true hidden gem.  The fish was fresh and pieces were the perfect size.  Very nice wine list, the only drawback is the table we had was in the back against a wall... it was a busy Friday night, and we were lucky to get a reservation ahead of time.

Review1230.Review: We sat at the bar and really enjoyed omakase from Geoff.  Great sushi!  We loved all the nigiri.  We can't wait to go back! The fish is so fresh.

Review1231.Review: Fish was very fresh, but food lacked a certain taste

Review1232.Review: Akiko's served up the freshest, most delectable sushi I have ever had.  I went with a friend who is even more a of sushi lover than I am and he was impressed too.  This is sushi on a level I've never experienced before.  Everything was outstanding and my taste buds will take me back to Akiko again and again.

Review1233.Review: Amazing bouquet of flavors!! Each piece was just incredible.Definitely recommend the Ngiri's as well as some of the makis. The 49er was soooo good! Also, the service was quite welcoming and timely. You definitely won't regret coming here

Review1234.Review: The food is great..."special" fish pieces are fresh and great tasting!  Sake is awesome and staff are wonderful.  This is my go to place every time I visit SF!

Review1235.Review: I've heard that Akiko's star chef is departing soon, if he has not departed already. Nevertheless, the food is outstanding. One of the best sushi\Japanese restaurants in San Francisco. To my knowledge, reservations are absolutely required (although, if you're reading this, you probably already know that)

Review1236.Review: Akiko is very unpretentious. To understand how good Akiko is, one needs to dine where they think is the best raw fish in town and then order the Omakase at Akiko.  If you are like me, you will use words such as "lucious" and "ethereal'" to describe the sashimi and most of the sushi the Chef has sent out to you.  It is the same with the tempura shrimp heads.  My two friends, first timers at Akiko a few days ago, say so as well.

Review1237.Review: The sushi was incredible. My table opted for the chef selection and we all were blown away! Monkfish liver is a new favorite!! Alan was an incredible server and was extremely helpful with recommendations and overall spectacular service! Easy to miss the restaurant though because there is no sign out front. But great dining experience!

Review1238.Review: The fish is so fresh and prepared with expert hands. It will be hard to enjoy sushi elsewhere after Akiko's.

Review1239.Review: We arrived at our reservation time and were told by a passive aggressive hostess that our table would not be ready for "a long time." 30 minutes later, we were seated and strongly upsold by an inattentive waiter. The sushi was pretty good, but the prices were extremely high for the quality of service/experience. The bathroom was dirty and had clearly not been attended to all night. I would not recommend this restaurant to others or return myself.

Review1240.Review: Love this find.  Small, but worth it.  Sushi was fresh and amazing, and the waiter knew a lot about the special imported sake we drank.  Great night.

Review1241.Review: Sat at the bar and had the omakase -- it was terrific.  The chef/owner served us directly and that made the experience all the better.  Price was totally reasonable for that level of service & food (~$105pp).  One thing to note:  We went on a Monday night, which is a bad night to go to a top-rated sushi place in SF, as the main fish market is closed on Mondays.  So food was _terrific_ (but not "epic life changing beyond amazing").  I imagine if you go on Tue - Fri you're going to get the best of the best.

Review1242.Review: This was my second visit to Akiko.  The food is high class sushi, potentially the best in town.  Very expensive if you mix and match your selection so be careful.  This is what pulled down my overall rating.

Review1243.Review: Fishes are really fresh, well crafted sushi. Servers are also well trained and makes great recommendations.

Review1244.Review: High quality produce prepared masterfully.  Superb America wine at reasonable prices.  Will definitely go back.

Review1245.Review: "This is the first time I've ever had real good fish" - my dadTook my dad here for a late Father's day dinner and he was very impressed. He's definitely been to quite a few Sushi restaurants and this, by far, is his favorite.I enjoyed it myself. Almost went for the Omakase but decided that we wanted to pick our own fish as well as additional starters which were the Agedashi Tofu and Kampachi Kama that included half of the head. Both were excellent. There was a little bit of a wait for the Kampachi since our waiter didn't tell us until last minute that they were out of the Hamachi Kama. Nevertheless, the dish was worth the wait.All the nigiri/sashimi that we ordered were exceptional. All in all great place. Would definitely come back.

Review1246.Review: fish is extraordinary.talented kitchen.attentive service.I've booked my next visit

Review1247.Review: Everything about this sushi restaurant was great. We sat at the bar and had an omakase meal where the sushi chef just kept putting out his choice. The fish was exquisite and wonderfully prepared. The young chefs were fantastic-quick, skilled, with great personality. Extremely high quality fish with several luxurious, uncommon types. This is not the place to go if you want great big California rolls. However, if you want high quality sushi, expertly prepared-this is the place. They also have a nice sake menu and were very helpful in choosing sake and fish pairings. For the quality of the meal, the price wasn't bad (under $400 for two, including three small bottles of excellant sake).

Review1248.Review: Service could of been better. We were the first party to have fun and they already were out of some of the food.

Review1249.Review: Akiko's is a must for sushi lovers. The fish is fresh with great variety. The chefs are always inventive. The best advice I can give is to not even look at the menu but let the chef prepare his recommended choices. I have NEVER been disappointed. Simply said, "WOW".

Review1250.Review: I almost don't want to review this because this is a small place and I will definitely be back many times! Incredible sushi, great sake, and absolutely fantastic service.

Review1251.Review: Amazing experience, great service. Every bite is special.

Review1252.Review: Very good sushi specials. Black Tuna and Wild White Salmon were both exceptional.

Review1253.Review: Very nice quaint modern Japanese downtown restaurant. Fresh ingredients, sushi. Good service, modern decor.

Review1254.Review: Perfectly paced over 2 hours. Elegant presentations with thoughtful comment. Super fresh. All I had to do was listen and eat and drink and enjoy. I'll be back!

Review1255.Review: Superb.  Excellent sushi chef.  I left the selection to the waiter.  A great selection but I was surprised by a $140 per person check.  Ouch.  But still awesome Japanese and maybe worth it.  It would be a 5 star experience except for the cost of my experience.

Review1256.Review: Excellent fish, many of which were new to me. Everything was super fresh and vibrant, beautifully handled and presented, and the service could not have been better. Trust your server for recommendations in making your selections!

Review1257.Review: The service was good and the sushi was out of this world amazing. We asked for a recommendation on some nigiri and our server picked out a couple fantastic pieces for us.  Prices are moderate but definitely worth it for the quality of food.

Review1258.Review: We got the omakase and the sushi was exquisite.  Dish after dish of delicately flavored sushi.  Be sure though to let your sushi chef know when you are reaching your max, otherwise the fish will keep coming (and your bill will keep growing).  The chefs were friendly and quite knowledgeable about each type of fish.  Try to sit at the counter or towards the front half of the restaurant - the bathroom noise towards the back is a little distracting.

Review1259.Review: I went with my boyfriend for the OMAKASE menu and loved it. Chef Ricky was great!

Review1260.Review: Akiko's is absolutely delicious. There are 2 menus: one that changes daily and the other that is available all the time. Start from the fresh daily menu and supplement with items from the regular menu if you are still hungry. They do tend to run out of certain items so have some backups in mind. The servers are very helpful in explaining the flavor of each type of fish. For example, if you prefer salmon over tuna let your server know and he/she can recommend something from the fresh menu. It can be a bit pricey for nigiri but the flavors are so worth it. I think it would be best to dine here during typical dinner hours (if you can get a table!) but definitely try to get a larger table along the benches and not the lame one by the bathroom.

Review1261.Review: Been going here for years, always great. New menu now and the food was HORRIBLE. Tempura was hard and greasy. Teriyaki was flabby with an overwhelming flavor of anise. Sushi was standard offerings (gone are the interesting sushi rolls that were fresh and tasty) and were stale and tasteless - the "rainbow roll" was so pale and stale that you couldn't even tell the different fish apart. The edamame was still good though. So, so, so sad cuz I loved this restaurant.

Review1262.Review: Probably the best sushi in the city! We've been to Akiko's many times and the food is always amazing.

Review1263.Review: One of the best sushi restaurants I've been to so far in the Bay Area.  Service was excellent, water and tea always refilled, checked on just enough but not too often, waiter's recommendations were excellent, very friendly.  Food was incredible - had the omakase, tried some new things, tried some standard things, all delicious and fresh.  Ambiance was great - easy to have an intimate conversation, but no so quiet that loud laughter felt out of place.  Would highly recommend this place - just make sure to get reservations in advance!

Review1264.Review: Excellent quality and presentation of sushi. Sit at bar for best experience.

Review1265.Review: I am so fortunate to have this amazing hole in the wall located right next door to my new office. Though there is no sign on the door, you will need a reservation to get a seat at this in-demand stealth sushi bar. I brought a few clients from Tokyo here, and they confirmed my thoughts that the fish is the freshest I've had outside the Tokyo fish markets. They were blown away. The nigiri is amazing, and every roll is incredible. Specifically, I love their 49er Roll, which has lemons on top giving it a truly unique flavor profile. Pairing the 49er with a spicy tuna roll is a perfect combination. This one really deserves an extra two stars.

Review1266.Review: This is the best sushi I've had in San Francisco!  We did the omakase and everything we ate was as delicious as it appeared.  What a treat!   I will be back for dinner!  Fresh and unique fish.

Review1267.Review: The three of us were able to talk pleasantly over a good lunch of miso soup, california and unagi rolls. Service was pleasant and efficient but not intrusive. I hope to come back and try more of the menu!

Review1268.Review: Absolutely the freshest, most wonderful sushi I ever had. Service also was fantastic.

Review1269.Review: I have been going to this restaurant for years and love their sushi!  Certainly one of the best in the City hands down.

Review1270.Review: Service was awful - took 30min for drinks to show up and an hour before any food made an appearance.  The staff seemed more interested in chatting with people sitting at the bar than serving the rest of the customers.

Review1271.Review: It's hard to spot the restaurant from the street and doesn't make the greatest first impression, but the staff are friendly, the tables are well spaced, and the dishes are delicious. The chefs behind the sushi bar are doing a great job!

Review1272.Review: ...especially for the price, and the fact that the tables are crammed together.So now were still looking for "our favorite" sushi restaurant!

Review1273.Review: For dinner, I always get the omakase.  I take sushi lovers here and they are always impressed.

Review1274.Review: Akiko's is an indescribable experience. Every time we just ask them to bring us their picks. The tastes are out of this world and the service impeccable. If you go this route you will have an unbelievable taste experience, but you can't be afraid to spend some money. It's well worth it! The only downside - all other sushi is just ok now that we've had Akiko's.

Review1275.Review: Akikos is high quality sushi prepared with care by their attentive sushi chefs. A bit expensive but reasonable for what is on pat with the finest sushi in SF or NY.

Review1276.Review: Had a wonderful, memorable meal here. Everything was presented beautifully and tasted delicious. One word of warning--there's no sign for this place, so you have to make sure to note the street address.

Review1277.Review: My friend and I did the Omakase menu.Fantastic from start to finish but the absolute highlights whereBeni ToroUniKobe Beef sushi (If beef can be called that)Monk Fish Liver

Review1278.Review: Some of the best sushi in San Francisco - remaining true to Japanese sushi!

Review1279.Review: Although I enjoyed it, I thought this time, they were not as attentive to us and I felt like the whole experience was lacking...

Review1280.Review: Fish was fresh but ran out of saba even though I went at 5:30pm.O/w the fish was very fresh.

Review1281.Review: Finally, a decent Sushi restaurant in the financial district. Do not believe the hype though, this place is good. It is not excellent or anything the write home about. The prices are very high for what you get, arguably too high. The fish is fresh and tastes unique with special seasonings of the rice and fish which are far from traditional. It is worth a try, but may not fit everyone's flavor profiles or budget. Cooked food is below par for the price you pay, Saba was overcooked and the Tempura batter is missing the light crispiness of tempura. I would go back, probably not on my dime.

Review1282.Review: This was the greatest sushi experience I've ever had. The quality of the fish is unsurpassed, and the fact that they take "standard" rolls and make them so unique was a refreshing experience. I'd recommend this place to anyone.

Review1283.Review: Food, atmosphere, and service were great. Still thinking about the Forty-Niner roll, fantastic!

Review1284.Review: If you can do the chefs menu, Go for it! I have sushi all the time, not only did it melt in my mouth, got to try several fish that I had never had. Just a great little place, also to grab a dinner. Don't get confused, this one is on Bush not madon

Review1285.Review: One of the best Sushi experiences we have ever had! Every piece of sushi expertly prepared and presented. Staff extremely helpful and professional. Truly a gem in a city famous for food. We give it the highest recommendation. Not to be missed. Reserve in advance.

Review1286.Review: For outstanding quality and variety, Akiko's stands atop the sushi mountain in San Francisco. Exotic varieties from all over the globe delivered within days of being caught make Akiko's a destination sushi restaurant. Omakase is the way to go...allow the kitchen to delight you with the chef's best selection. One of the best plates of food I have ever experienced was delivered at Akiko's: toro slices from true Hamachi (farmed japanese yellowtail), Albacore and australian sea trout (steelhead by CA standards).....sashimi heaven. And, their marinated salmon eggs are the best I have ever had in addition to the sea urchin from Hokkeido. I cannot do the food justice by description...just know that you will be very pleased.

Review1287.Review: I am just visiting so I was not sure of the timing. I came 10 minutes early. My appointment was 11:30 - when they open. I was tired from the walk and would just like to sit. They will not allow it. A lady was sitting at the bar. I thought she was a cusotmer. Their reason of not letting me sit down is they are not ready and people will see if I sat down and think they are open. The hostess is sitting down like she is a customer. The hostess is snooty. She asked if I have reservation and from her reaction she wished I did not. The wait staff is nicer.The shrimp tempura is ordinary but the sushi and sashimi are top quality.

Review1288.Review: It's a great sushi spot. It's even more amazing because the choices in the area are not great with a few exceptions. It's not formal enough for a real business lunch but if works to impress a lunch date (business or personal) if you want sushi.for dinner it's also very good, especially if you are only two. I have been a few times and lunch today impressed me.we ordered uni and ankimo: perfect.we had three different types of salmon: all were delicious.Fresh shrimp was great and the head fried just right.they recommended some other fish because it was fresh and it was great.they served our food in an order that made sense instead of just bringing out a bunch of sushi together, giving our meal a great pace.highly recommended.

Review1289.Review: The reviews were mixed on Akiko's, but we're die-hard sushi buffs so wanted to check this restaurant out for ourselves. It is tucked away on Bush street, and does not have a sign out front, so you'll need to find it just based on its address. It is clean and has a cozy feel given that it's small and in an old building. The service is fantastic, our water was always topped off, and they were quick when we asked for anything. The food was okay, but not memorable. The noise level, on the other hand, is something you won't forget. I'm always willing to pay more for ambiance. Unfortunately, you'll pay more for this place, but you won't be able to enjoy a conversation with your group.

Review1290.Review: Finding great sushi is hard as many places receive great reviews, but are nothing more than fancy rolls topped with an aioli. Akiko's is nothing like that. Fresh and flavor fish that does not require anything to mask its flavor. The only complaint I have is the rice. Nigiri is one of my favorite ways to enjoy Sushi as great rice compliments great seafood. At Akiko's they opted not to use traditional sushi rice, which affected both the texture and enjoyment of the nigiri. Though my wife and I did not enjoy the rice, the fish was excellent and a meal that we look forward to repeating.

Review1291.Review: Had reservations for two Saturday evening. While I thought the food was delicious, the service is lacking. The female who was assisting our waiter at times was great, but unfortunately he had no sense of urgency. At one point one of the wait staff apologized to us because she needed to split our table to seat another party of two (within 2 inches of us) because "some people are taking longer to eat and our reservations are getting backed up."Please don't blame your diners, it's the waiter that's holding everyone up. In all honesty, we should have been out of there in 45 minutes. Instead it was an hour and a half, most of the time waiting for service.

Review1292.Review: I'm in heaven... I mean, I'm at Akiko's. How is it that we ate everything on the menu, yet we are still light on our feet? Allen was the perfect host introducing us to sashimi fish varieties from around the world that changed our lives. Don't forget to have a glass of Drops of Dew sake.

Review1293.Review: Stellar service; amazing 49er rolls; beautifully presented food.

Review1294.Review: The restaurant was very nice and wait staff friendly, but the entree we got was way too salty. The sushi rolls were good albeit pricier than normal.

Review1295.Review: very pricey but worth it. There are plenty of expensive sushi bars that leave you feeling like you paid too much. At Akiko's you pay a lot, but feel like you got your money's worth.

Review1297.Review: Our server was very very very cold. It was really weird. It's almost like the delicious great quality of sushi was really bad because of his cold quiet vibe. Not friendly at all.

Review1298.Review: The sushi here was some of the best I've had in SF. We ordered agedashi tofu to start, which was light and flavorful, and then each ordered the 6 piece nigiri tasting. The fish was so fresh it melted in my mouth. The seared salmon was absolutely outstanding. We also ordered three rolls, all of which were great, and made for a perfect amount of food. The only thing that was odd was that the servers seemed a bit distracted, but the food more than made up for it. Excellent wine selections, too.

Review1299.Review: Food is great but I do not recommend getting seated in the window corner by the hostess station.

Review1300.Review: overpriced . too much attention given to other "more important" customers

Review1301.Review: Went for lunch on a weekday and sat at the sushi bar. Chef prepared good a la carte new-style sushi and fish quality was high. I really wanted to like it but their service was really lacking and the chef (his co-workers at the bar included) was pretentious and think they are god's gift for sushi-lovers. Having had sushi at Yasuda and a few other joints in New York, I have to say they are not quite there yet.

Review1302.Review: Without a doubt this has been the best opentable find to date. I am grateful to have gotten a table to this popular restaurant. The food was absolutely awesome. I only wished we had paced ourselves to leave more room for sushi. The tempura was perfect but the sushi was simply melt in your mouth sushi. We asked the chef to create a mix for us and every piece was perfect. Service was great. This is a tiny place. I cannot imagine going with more than a table for 4.

Review1303.Review: This review is based on the chef's menu. The fish served at Akiko is really stellar. Besides Kappa in Japan Town, it's probably the best sashimi I've had in SF over 20 years. The focus of the chef's menu really is the fish; so if you're looking for more variation, you may not find it. But the fish is soooo good. They do some interesting things like a slight char on some of the nigiri rice, which added a nice depth. One criticism, though, is the nigiri rice didn't hold together well; maybe it was an off night. The final bite was a Wagyu beef and truffle nigiri. Yum, yum, yum! Awesome way to end the meal!

Review1304.Review: the table we were sat at was the worst in the resturant

Review1305.Review: You definitely need a reservation for weekday lunch. I've been turned away. It is well worth it. Sushi is excellent here.

Review1306.Review: The sushi is delicious. However, they were out of kampachi and I would have liked to have made my own choice of a substitute rather than having them just give me something else. The wine list needs some work but then sake would probably be the better choice.

Review1307.Review: Oh my! What a meal. The fish was so fresh it nearly jumped off the plate. Cool little spot we missed by walking by as they have no sign. I highly recommend to any sushi head out there.

Review1308.Review: The best suschi on the west coast. I just don't want everyone to go so I can't get in!!Love those guys!!!!!

Review1309.Review: By far the best Sushi I've had in San Francisco although it's somewhat pricy. Tempura (appetizer) here was better than any I've had in the US. Uni was melt in mouth. Bluefin tuna belly was expensive but amazing. Liked that they didn't bring all the food together (like many other sushi places do) on a single plate. They seemed to try to sequence the food in the correct order for best experience.

Review1310.Review: This restaurant is the best Sushi offered in SF. And, it just keeps getting better.

Review1311.Review: The cucumber salad and tempura were good, but the sushi was sensational! We asked the server to bring us an assortment and it was perfection! We can't wait to go back to San Francisco so we can eat at Akiko's. You do need a reservation. Everyone who didn't reserve ahead was turned away or told to return at 9:30 or later the night we were there.

Review1312.Review: My son and I were both in town for the weekend and we like to find good sushi spots. Figuring this was definitely possible in San Francisco I did a little research and wound up at Akiko. It was tremendous in every way. Great food, great service, and reasonably priced considering the quality. I would highy reccomend Akiko and plan to return in the future.

Review1313.Review: This is THE place for sushi in SF. Hands down.

Review1314.Review: Some of the most creative and best sushi I've ever had, amazing!

Review1315.Review: If you are looking for sushi that is comparable to the best available in nyc, boston, LA, you will be very disappointed. No attempt at creativity or artistry.

Review1316.Review: Simply one of the best Japanese style restaurants in town. The fish melts in ones mouth and dances on your tongue.

Review1317.Review: Great spot in the Union Square area. One of the best sushi spots I have found.

Review1318.Review: very fresh sashimi. the rolls are fresh albeit small. will come back to try food. attentive service.

Review1319.Review: I have to say we so enjoyed our 2 visits here. We ate at the bar with Geoff, omakase. The second visit, about a month after the first, we were remembered!Great service. I love the look of the space also and all the unique touches that add to its high end appeal. The fish served is of much different prep than what we usually have. No wasabi and soy here. And none needed either! We loved all the different garnishes and sauces as well as the different fish seared with their butane torch which left no odd fuel flavor.Highlights were their Ensuii uni and their seared A5 Miyazaki Wagyu topped with shaved French Black Winter truffles.At well over $500 for 2, we won't be going here every week but sure will return soon! YUM YUM!

Review1320.Review: The best japanese restaurant in Bay Area.Fresh sea food, excelent service and cozy restantaurant.

Review1321.Review: It's hard to find fish any fresher then at Akiko's. My wife and I have been going here for over 5 years. We love going here for special lunches because we are treated so well and the food is amazing. The staff and quality of seafood has remained the same (amazing) over the years, the only thing that has changed is the décor. We have our usual order that the servers know well, however they are great at recommending the freshest, in season fish - which we love. The only recent drawback is that they have become so popular you now need a reservation to get in at lunch time. Enjoy!

Review1322.Review: A totally positive dining experience at this innovative restaurant.Fried foods, grilled foods, noodles, rice bowls and a vast sushi/sashimi selection make up the menu.A strong point is the ability for one person to order an omakase and another to order a la carte at the same table. It's rare for a party to be able to share a strong omakase side by side with an order of tempura and chicken teriyaki. The sub-$100 price to be fairly reasonable and a good way to sample what the restaurant is capable of offering. The $10 corkage was pretty sweet.

Review1323.Review: Had a very nice and tasty lunch there. Staff was friendly, polite and very professional. Close attention to details (for example, dropped my napkin on the floor and without asking, received a new one). Quiet place. Will most definitely return there upon my next trip to SFO.

Review1324.Review: This is the way sushi/sashimi should be. The list was interesting and pristine fresh. Presentation was innovative and thoughtful. The sake and wine lists are both very good. Pair it with excellent service and we now have a new favorite. We did not get a chance to try some of the other menu offerings on this visit, but will next time. This is not a place to rush, but to enjoy each dish as it comes - I can't wait to come back!

Review1325.Review: The food and service was great as usual.

Review1326.Review: After a stunning dinner a little over a month ago, I came here and had an ok dinner. We showed up at 830pm and waited a few minutes before seating. The wait for service once seated almost came to 15 minutes before asking if we wanted to order sake. When I told them we wanted Omakase menu, he corrected me by saying, there's no menu given for Omakase, but I explained I had a hearing impairment and he was annoyed with me which made me feel terrible. The sashimi was ok, one piece was very mealy and I couldn't eat it. But many of the other dishes were good to excellent. The surly service left me saddened, but perhaps this was an off night and maybe our waiter was having a bad night.

Review1327.Review: We first found this place when trying to get into the Irish Pub down the alley. The sushi was great and they had a great variety. I tried the Sake tasting and it was fabulous. Will be returning next time we are in town.

Review1328.Review: We had the Omakase and Alan hooked us up with one of the best meals we've ever had. The quality of fish was incredible. The husband and i can't stop talking our experience.

Review1329.Review: Fish was impeccable, the sauces were delicate and delicious. Prices were reasonable for the quality of the sushi!

Review1330.Review: Great ambiance and food! I had a good time. Michael, I was really rushing to catch the train! You were very sweet!

Review1331.Review: My husband and I went to this sushi restaurant while visiting San Francisco the past week-end and we really enjoyed the great "omakase". Together with a half bottle of cold sake Daiginjo, everything was just perfect!!! The omakase included not only sushi and sashimi but also salads, soups and a delicious piece of meat at the end of the meal!!! I highly recommend this restaurant to any person who likes Japanese food!!NB! Be aware that there is another sushi restaurant also with the name of Akiko not far away from Union Square. It was confusing to know which one was “the famous one”, but finally the concierge in our hotel told us to visit this one at Bush Street.

Review1332.Review: This place has fresh tasting sushi, great variety, fast and excellent service

Review1333.Review: We had a seaweed salad and 3 types of sushi rolls, all of which were very tasty! Our server was super nice and very attentive, refilled drinks in a timely manner and was very knowledgable about the menu, giving us some great recommendations!

Review1334.Review: I ate at the sushi bar, and could not have been happier with the food. I had the most pristine fish and types I've never heard of. The chefs were helpful and made good suggestions. I can't wait to go back.

Review1335.Review: I'll keep it simple - this is the best sushi that I've had in San Francisco. The options are fantastic and varied and the staff was incredibly friendly! If you are someone that loves omakase, this is the place for you!

Review1336.Review: We went for the omekase dinner which was a new delight with eveyr dish. Our server was most helpful in choosing sake to match the dishes and expand our sake repertoire!

Review1337.Review: Great Sushi,King Salmon-amazingSpider roll- awesomeSaki- deliciousGo there!

Review1338.Review: Very nice place for lunch. Everything from the place settings to the service was great. I had the nabeyaki and the forty-niner roll. Really fresh, good seafood.

Review1339.Review: We had the sunomono with octopus, grilled saba, kurodai, and some specials recommended by our server. If you're at a loss, ask the server for recommendations because they know what they're talking about. Everything was fabulous. We stayed away from the rolls because with fish that good, I think the purity of the flavor is wasted when combined with other more mundane ingredients. Definitely one of the better Japanese restaurants in SF.

Review1340.Review: Great place and food. However, the person behind the bar who seems to run the place (scruffy beard) needs a serious lesson in manners and customer service.He knows how to make sushi but not how to work with customers or his employees who seem terrified of him.Get off your horse, mate - you just own a restaurant and make sushi - you're taking yourself too seriously while nobody else does.Smile sometimes, say thank you sometim regularly,be gracious.Change and people will continue to come to your restaurant.Don't change....and you won't have any loyalty from your customers or team...and may end up a very lonely man..Your call, young man.

Review1341.Review: This place is very busy at lunch during the week and will require reservations. it's very small spot, sop that makes sense. The food was - good. Nothing spectacular but priced well. There are many other places in the City that offer better sushi, presented in a more creative way.Service: you'll need to ask for water more than once, and then ask for it to be refilled. Actually, you'll need to ask for most things more than once. And, the hostess really didn't even seem like she cared to be there. It felt uncomfortable to speak to her, to hear her talk to other patrons, and to stand in the entryway while waiting for the table. She should smile, be genuine and more engaging.

Review1342.Review: The omakase menu was delightful--everything was perfectly prepared. Spinach-sesame salad, bitter greens and avocado, oysters and caviar, sashimi, three nigiri courses, and one lightly seared beef wrap followed by mochi ice cream. My only slight criticism is that the menu would have been improved by the addition of a hot course--a traditional pork and winter squash soup, something else brothy, or a fried dish.

Review1343.Review: I had read about this restaurant and was curious to see if it was as good as the article mentioned. It was not only as good, but better. Having worked in the sushi restaurant business many years ago, I have been on the search for as good as it gets and this comes close. The sushi/sashimi melted in our mouths with freshness and flavors that were gentle and yet strong. The broiled yellow tail collar was cooked perfectly with crispness and intense goodness. The staff was knowledgeable and friendly and always aware of our needs, answered our questions readily, but was never obtrusive. Thanks for a wonderful Union Square lunch!

Review1344.Review: The restaurant doesn't have a name on he door, but my foodie friends from out of town had read about it being the best sushi spot in town. We let the waiter order for us and everything was superb and so fresh! $550 with gratuity for four people, we brought the wine so only corkage on top. We ate a lot of food so we can't complain, but be prepared. The last bite was heaven and we'll be dreaming about it until our next visit...hopefully soon.

Review1345.Review: This place is a treasure. The fish is fresh and diverse sourcing, the sushi chef is creative and the sushi is really, really good. I highly recommend the restaurant.

Review1346.Review: I live in both Los Angeles and San Francisco and am amazed at the selection of great sushi/omakase restaurants in Los Angeles, but have been surprised that with the strong Asian community that there isn't much to choose from. This was what I've been waiting for and both my spouse and I were impressed by the prep, the presentation, the taste and and the selection of dishes offered. I'll definitely be back more often. Am thrilled to have something of this calibre in San Francisco.

Review1347.Review: Really enjoyed the ambience and the amazing sushi at this spot. The sushi was high quality and was made with care Quite different than that everyday sushi spot you are used to. Visit here and you won't be disappointed.

Review1348.Review: Enjoyed the sushi and a generally excellent lunch.

Review1349.Review: I went in with extremely high expectations for this restaurant as they were written up in a newspaper article. Unfortunately, I had too high expectations. The evening started when I asked the hostess if they had a bag check. She looked at me like I was crazy. Maybe she thought I meant does the restaurant search my bags like the TSA or security before sporting events. In any case, it was lost in translation. The food was good, but I wasn't blown away. They got my order wrong, but fixed it without complaint. That was nice that it was fixed immediately and without question. Overall a good experience and might come back if there were a special event.

Review1350.Review: The sushi really was amazing. This is a friendly but no no nonsense place. You won't find soy sauce out and each piece comes complete with what you will need to enjoy it. We had the Omakase menu and I cannot recall having had much better anywhere. We sat at the bar and chatted with the chef who was very friendly as time permitted. The toro was great. Maybe the best in the bay area.

Review1351.Review: Truly enjoyed the dining experience. Only drawback - reservation was 9:00 and a number of items were sold out. Since it's a relatively small place and been in business for some time, I would think the chef has a better handle on amounts to order; particularly the more popular selections. Overall experience was very good.

Review1352.Review: The cooked food was pretty meh. Would go back once more to try the sashimi and sushi. It seems overpriced for the quality of food. San Francisco Chronicle food critic Michael Bauer compares it favorably to Sushi Ran in Sausalito. It's no Sushi Ran.

Review1353.Review: the food is amazing; hands down the best sushi I've ever eaten...the service is on par with the food; attentive, knowledgeable, and friendly.

Review1354.Review: I love to eat here. The food is terrific and the service is great. Im on a quest to try everything on the menu. I'm lucky this place is just a block away.

Review1355.Review: We found Akiko after searching online. Very happy with the meal. Carefully prepared fresh sushi and other dishes. The hostess and servers were great., attentive services. Moderate bill was the happy surprise at the end. If we lived here in SFO we would be back for sure.

Review1356.Review: This is probably the best sushi that I have ever eaten. I cannot wait to come back to try their Omakase.

Review1357.Review: The is hands down the best fish I've ever had. This place is great. The only thing I would recommend is that the restaurant get a better wait staff or proper training. They need to be more attentive and out going.

Review1358.Review: The good was excellent and our reservation was honored at the exact time. However, the service lacked and the arrangements I made ahead of time regarding my friend's birthday with the hostess were either forgotten or never noted. I had asked that they offer a tasting menu (which she had suggested) and they never did. I asked that they bring the Mochi ice-cream with a candle for her birthday at the end and they never did. I was so disappointed and especially since I called the day prior and discussed it at length with the hostess. Unfortunately, you don't get a second chance at a birthday surprise.

Review1359.Review: I'm always on the lookout for great sushi but Akiko's is not really obviously a sushi place from the outside. My friend and I were running late so for our reservation so I had called ahead and the staff was understanding and accommodating, which I appreciate because this place was packed for early in the evening. So the service was great in general, but most importantly, the fish was SO GOOD. Fresh, flavorful, and there was a great selection of fish as well as warm dishes. My friend and I ordered a few salads and a sashimi platter and were floored at how delicious everything was. Definitely a must-try if you are serious about sushi and need a great restaurant for after work.

Review1360.Review: The salmon belly is amazing.The chu-toro is amazing.The wagyu is amazing.We had nigiri omakase. Several courses of nigiri sushi, no sashimi. And we had an enjoyable night out. We got there especially early and it was not especially busy. The restaurant fills up quickly, but by then we were halfway through our courses and getting full.I can't wait to go back.

Review1361.Review: Absolutely the BEST sushi I've ever eaten!

Review1362.Review: The Sushi and Sake were good, but nothing jumped out at me as being special.

Review1363.Review: Best Sushi in California hands down.  It's a small restaurant and tight quarters.  They often have at least 3 types of Uni at any given time.  The monk fish liver is incredible.  The soy sauce is unreal.  I believe they make it themselves.  The cuts make every piece of fish taste like it melts in your mouth.  Just an incredible sushi experience.  My advice is to let the chefs decide for you based on what's new.  I've never had rolls here because I am always trusting the chefs on what incredible fresh fish they got in.

Review1364.Review: Visiting San Fran from NYC. Found this restaurant on Yelp. Walked 20 minutes from Hotel and they had no openings. We made a reservation the following night and had to wait 15 minutes for our table, the hostess was very apologetic but being from NYC we were used to waiting even longer with reservations. The owner bought over comp seaweed salad which was fabulous, the best I've had. Even my 14 year old loved it. By far the best food we had in San Fran.

Review1365.Review: Good quality fish but expensive. That is okay. The service is really really slow n understaff.Grill food just average, tempura is below average.

Review1366.Review: Amazing salmon, ikura, tuna, hamachi, hotate! Everything is great here. Just come for the fish. You're missing out if you order anything else.

Review1367.Review: I am very picky with sushi restaurant and I can't say enough good things about the food quality at akiko's. Definitely the best sushi place in town.

Review1368.Review: Organic salmon roll is the best !!!

Review1369.Review: Akikos is a nice quaint little sushi place. They have excellent food, and a great menu. Since they've re opened it's a little harder to find because they took the sign down. the food is little pricey but not too bad for a sushi place. however it's the service is where lacking. The upside is that the hostess sat us promptly, but after that we had to ask to see where our waiter was. it had been 15 minutes and he was nowhere to be found. go for the food but expect mediocre service.

Review1370.Review: The sushi here are real fresh, as if it came straight from the Tokyo fish market. Had the sashimi sampler and that was delicious, but I didn't appreciate getting a triangular piece of salmon (the ends of a fish) it was way too thick and couldn't really enjoy the fish as much as you would normally with a perfectly cut sashimi. We also had the uni (st Barbara). we normally get ours from Maine. Had the tiger shrimp (Raw) sushi, was a bit over marinated but enough for us to be satisfied. Overall I think this place is great for food tasting, I wouldn't really get full from this as I come from NYC and our sushi are much more affordable but lack the quality of this restaurant. Staff were somewhat helpful but (San Francisco) friendly.

Review1371.Review: Fine food and service, nicely furnished, pricey but justifiable, the only problem for us was the noise level, which was extreme and made conversation very difficult and at time impossible. The noise level will restrict any future visits and limit them to off-hours.

Review1372.Review: The restaurant is a bit hard to find (there is no sign outside the door) but the search was worth it! Very fresh sushi with unique spice combinations. Loved the 49er roll especially--the lemon on top gives a lovely burst of freshness that enhances the other flavors in theroll. Highly recommend it, but the place is a bit small so difficult for large groups. Service was excellent and gave great recommendations.

Review1373.Review: Because of the price point they are targetting I would expect a better service and a more knowledgable staff of the products

Review1374.Review: There is no sign on the building at Akiko, but the sushi is excellent, with some special fish that you will no find elsewhere. Their other Japanese cuisine is also excellent, such as tempura and fried calamari.

Review1375.Review: This tiny, hidden, unassuming gem is truly amazing. You WILL walk right by it, there is no signage on the front of the restaurant and it's a very small place. While seated immediately, the service was slow to start. Be patient! Once our waiter finally greeted us, he was amazingly informed, charming, and did a terrific job. We were seated originally at a small table near the front and while it wasn't a bad spot, a few minutes after being seated we were moved by our waiter to the best table in the house (private corner spot that opened after our arrival) with no prompting by us. That made our dining experience all the more memorable. We've eaten a lot of sushi at places like Nobu and this beat it. It was literally the best we've ever had.

Review1376.Review: Best sushi I have had in quite some time.

Review1377.Review: I visited Tokyo last year and had the most incredibly fresh sushi you could possibly imagine. I never thought I would find a sushi house that rivaled that freshness and "melt in your mouth" taste. I was wrong. This place serves incredible sashimi/sushi (Toro!!!!!). Love every bite. Rolls are great. Try the seaweed salad too. I always take my clients here if I want to impress them.

Review1378.Review: Great Food, Great Atmosphere, Great Service, Quality Ingredients.

Review1379.Review: We were in SF for 3 days and ate here twice because the quality of the sushi and service was that outstanding!

Review1380.Review: The sushi was very good, and the staff was very helpful. The restaurant also has a nice lively vibe to it. If I am ever in the area again, I would definitely go back.

Review1381.Review: Chef's choice Omakase was superlative. Just asked them to bring us delicious things, and they obliged.

Review1382.Review: If you like sashimi, this is one of the better spots in the bay area. It's not cheap...but quality never is. Yum!

Review1383.Review: While the seating at Akiko's may be limited, the freshness of the sushi is on point. Definitely try the Hawaiian butter fish - it was so silky and light. There is a large selection of specialty rolls, but there seem to be many redundancies in them. However, if you persevere, you should be able to find a few different ones. And, don't miss the cabbage salad/slaw!

Review1385.Review: This review does not reflect on their sashimi selection.But my girlfriend and I would visit San Francisco once or twice a year and every time we made the trip here, we would always come to Akiko's because of a wonderful experience way back when we came in 2011. But this time when we came, we noticed that many of their signature sushi rolls were gone. Asking the waiter, they said that they have been removed. It was such a shame because i was really looking forward to the signature rolls that i could not find anywhere else. But we settled for the spicy tuna roll, rainbow roll, an order or gyoza, and the ika. The food was aesthetically pleasing to the eye. But the food was still delicious.

Review1386.Review: High quality seafood and a great menu, what more could you want? They get busy around lunch time and the space is small, but the food is worth it.

Review1387.Review: Lots of great options here for sushi. The sushi chefs are very skilled and omakase is the best sushi dining experience if you are willing to pay for it. The sushi is the most fresh I have ever had in the city. Kudos!

Review1388.Review: The food was very good.However, everything else was awful. The welcome was cold, left us & other guests hovering by the door without comment.Then sat us on the worst table that was freezing and felt like you were in a fast food service station.We waited 30 minutes for a drink & that only came after we chased for it & after being told they had run out of the beer we ordered!When ordering the food, they had run out of 3 options.Another of our dishes just didn't arrive & they didn't have a clueThe waiter (Jack) was terrible, didn't explain anything or look after us.The food was great but irrelevant when the overall experience is so bad. A real shame, but i would not recommend this place to anyone, there are many better options.

Review1389.Review: Everything was tasty and perfectly made. The sushi & sashimi melts in your mouth. Reservations required, but it was worth the 3 day wait. Be careful not to miss it when you walk by. The name is not posted.

Review1390.Review: First off, don't confuse this Akiko's (located on Bush Street) with the one on Mason Street. This one is not to be missed. Our waiter could not have been more helpful or truthful about his recommendations of sashimi (what was fresh and what was frozen). We got three different sashimis, all of which were incomparable to any other sushi I have ever had, and the forty-niner roll which was amazing. The mixed salad, cucumber salad and fried crab were also perfect.

Review1391.Review: The fish selected for sushi/sashimi is the best I have had. The chefs are very knowledgable and willing to advise you on selections. Gets crowded early.

Review1392.Review: From all the Japanese I have tried in the Bay Area, this is by far the best. The quality of the sashimi and sushi is fantastic and very close to being Tokyo/Japan-level.

Review1393.Review: We went to Akiko for lunch. The variety of fish available is excellent. Dish presentation was also excellent. Finally the execution of the dishes was first rate. It was a very enjoyable experience at an overall reasonable price, though one could easily spend much more on some varieties of fish.

Review1394.Review: sat at the sushi bar, had some awesome sake (decent selection), great salad (love their carrot-ginger dressing), and yummy sushi rolls. nice atmosphere, liked the sushi chefs.

Review1395.Review: it's a small dining room, which means you can either hear the conversations of the people next to you, or you can hear your dining companion in equal measure. But, it doesn't feel like a competition to be heard, so it's a reasonable/vibrant noise level.I had the nigiri duo with tempura, which takes the guesswork out of what to have and it was fantastic in quality and presentation (love the slate plates).

Review1396.Review: Fabulously fresh with unique flare. Inside is very small - not good for groups over 4. Definitely make a reservation. Pricey if you try the offering which makes this place amazing, so be prepared. Tab for 3 was $250 (w sake). Service was attentive/knowledgable so ask for suggestions. Wagyu Beef nigiri – excellent - opt for the black truffle topping if available (delicately sliced, not over bearing). Walu & Umimasu sashimi are a must. 'Special menue' sashimi were superb – order Otoro and save it for your last bite of the meal. Rolls – the Forty-niner (thin sliced lemon perfectly balanced chunks of sweet organic salmon). I always try a spicy tuna roll - my meter to the fish integrity of a sushi joint - perfection! Red bean mochi to finish.

Review1397.Review: Nothing spectacular...Food was ok....no complaints overall

Review1398.Review: After a really bad seating experience the last time we went (1 1/2 hour wait for our reservation that we were on time for), we gave it another try. We were seated right away which was of course wonderful! The food was great however the wine list was a little lacking. Every wine my friend tried to order they seemed to be out of. Will be going back again because I love their sushi.

Review1399.Review: Our negative experience started when we had trouble finding the restaurant and the hostess could not give us directions. We finally found it in spite of the fact that the restaurant has NO sign. Is this some sort of postmodern statement? Things did not improve once we finally arrived. While the server took his time with us to explain various menu items, at least 3-4 of the food items and 3-4 bottles of wine were sold out. We finally got a bottle of wine ordered, but the waiter forgot about it. One of the food items I ordered was also sold out, but I only found out about this when the food was set in front of me and the waiter explained that the chef made a substitution. The service was so bad that the busser brought the check.

Review1400.Review: Amazing sushi, fantastic service, great sake selection.

Review1401.Review: Service was on point. Waiter was polite & knowledgeable about the menu & ingredients. Sushi was extremely fresh, tender and sauce flavors were tasty. Table was bussed when plates were finished. Prices were reasonable too. Would def go back next time i visit San Francisco.

Review1402.Review: Incredible sushi experience!Best in the city.

Review1403.Review: Best sushi I've had in a long time. No sign outside but place was packed. Interior unremarkable and stuffy but who cares? The sushi SO delicious. Will definitely be back. Soon.

Review1404.Review: Great food! Some of the best sushi I have had in the city. Very knowledgeable server and prompt service.

Review1405.Review: Our office just moved a couple of blocks away from Akiko's, and I hadn't had sushi since my son was born, so I was really craving some fresh sushi. I met a friend here, and it was just the most fresh, and tasty sushi I've had in a long time. The nigiri was wonderful, and the rolls were even better. I feel like this is a hidden gem, because there isn't even a sign outside, so I walked right past it at first! The service was great, and I can't wait to go back.

Review1406.Review: It was OK. It took a little while to get a table even though we had a reservation. Service was OK, we had to remind them of two of the things we ordered, he was ready to give us the check before that.
