Review1407.Review: they have a good selection of sashimi and very fresh.

Review1408.Review: The best Japanese food in town!

Review1409.Review: They just redecorated the place but didn't take that opportunity to address acoustics. The place is a gem, the food is outstanding, but you may not be able to hear anyone for the rest of the afternoon following a lunch there.

Review1410.Review: Akikos is one of SanFrancisco's rare gems! My boyfriend and I had a hard time finding the restaurant at first, since there is no sign outside of it. It ended up being on the corner of an Irish pub in the alley, so its easy to miss. The ambiance was very sensual, dimly lit with candles and the prices were very reasonable for the amazing quality of food we received.Of course if you come there really hungry, you'll have to shell out more. I had a nigiri-sashimi duo, which was very buttery smooth and miso with cucumber salad-the ginger-soy dressing was magnificent- and a delicious delicate red bean gelato for dessert,which topped the night off perfectly. I'm definitely coming back here the next time I get the chance!!!!!

Review1411.Review: Superb, fresh sushi and sashimi...the best ohitashi I've ever had!

Review1412.Review: The food is very good; however, the service is inconsistent. Although our server polite, I had to wonder why he didn't just admit he forgot one of our food items. When I inquired, he said he would check, and came back and said it wasn't on our order, but we all heard him repeat it along with everything else on our order..so he either's lying or it magically erased from his list? It's a little thing, but it bugged. Refills for beverages a bit slow. We were 2 min. early on our reservation and they made us along with another person wait outside. 5 min. later you could tell they were still not ready to open, but reluctantly sat us. As mentioned, inconsistent. I'd recommend but not without an *asterisk.

Review1413.Review: Absolutely fantastic. Best sushi in SFO.

Review1414.Review: The food and service were amazing!!!

Review1415.Review: Must have reservations - no walk ins allowed...seemed a little excessive. Regardless, food was excellent!

Review1416.Review: Had a reservation for 8:45 but weren't seated until 9:15. However, the server was great and allowed our group of 6 to split our checks.

Review1417.Review: If your looking for something not typical on a sushi menu go to Akiko's. Wonderful and delicious!

Review1418.Review: I was hurried through dinner. The sushi was average and portions quite small

Review1419.Review: Akiko's provided me with the best Japanese food I have ever experienced in the US. I lived in Japan for 13 years and travel there frequently on business and feel that the sushi is on par with good quality sushi in Japan. The decor is simple and calming, and the noise level is moderate so it is easy to carry on a conversation. I highly recommend Akiko's.

Review1420.Review: Loved, loved the food, the atmosphere, the service, everything. Can't wait to come back with my husband (who is Japanese) to share the experience.

Review1421.Review: Food was very good and the sushi among the most delicious I've had in the city; while the room is aesthetically adorable, the main dining area is so narrow that the noise level is high and my party felt a bit smothered.

Review1422.Review: Probably the best place downtown to get sushi if you're in the mood. Sadly, the Financial District is lacking in this department - but really does make up for it with a plethora of other great places! As expected, the sushi is by no means "cheap" (if it is, you've got a problem).. But I was pleasantly surprised in that it wasn't AS expensive as I expected and was excellent.Service was outstanding. Be sure to make a reservation as they rarely (if ever) take walk-ins!

Review1423.Review: excellent. had chef's selection. loved everything. but very expensive. lunch for 2 was $250!

Review1424.Review: Good food. The tempura was a bit overlooked, but otherwise our group of five found the place quite acceptable.

Review1425.Review: Best Japanese in the Financial District.

Review1426.Review: A wonderful experience at Akikos. Service was fast and the food came out perfect. The spinach salad, udon noodles, miso soup, forty niner roll were all amazing. The sushi was fresh and delicious. Highly recommend, reservations a must

Review1427.Review: Casual and very friendly. Outstanding sushi!!!

Review1428.Review: This was my second time eating at Akiko's. The first time, we just ordered a few rolls and sashimi, and I thought it was great. This time, my boyfriend and I ordered omakase. For the dollar amount you spend on omakase, I think the sushi had a lot to be desired. There was a bit of overkill on the butterfish. Apparently the chef liked it, but it wasn't that tasty, and it showed up in multiple forms over the course of the dinner. Perhaps the problem was ordering omakase without being at the bar, so we could not communicate with the chef, but we left spending a lot of money and feeling disappointed in the selection.

Review1429.Review: Great restaurant with outstanding sushi. Requires a reservation, but easy to make one with open table. We were able to get in 15 min after making the reservation.

Review1430.Review: Love this spot! A hidden gem on Bush St that has the freshest fish I have ever eaten. You can go wrong with the sashimi sampler and the cucumber salad.

Review1431.Review: Great food! It's very small and has a tendency to be stuffy (I mean literally hot and a bit hard to breathe, not snobby). The prices are a bit higher than normal but the food warrants it. We loved the spider roll and the 49er were delicious! Do yourself a favor and make reservations!!

Review1432.Review: The fish was very good and fresh. The lunch time crush left the staff a bit overwhelmed. Not in favor of having to order from a waiter when sitting at the sushi bar.

Review1433.Review: I've been here many times and they never disappoint. Sashimi is always fresh and delicious. Service is always friendly and helpful.

Review1434.Review: Nice restaurant with good, fresh selection. The restaurant is small and does require reservations, so plan ahead. Tables in the back are packed very close together so try to get something towards the front for more privacy. Service was good, but food service slowed down as the restaurant filled up. Plan on spending some time eating here, but you won't be disappointed by the quality.

Review1435.Review: This is where you come for fresh fish, many exclusive items, straight from their connection in Japan.  Amazing items cured and made in house, this is my "go to" spot for great food, no limits.  Ask for the Omakase (Chef's choice), they will blow you away.  Ask for Ray, he will explain where each fish came from, what is special about it.  Akiko's takes pride in the fact that all the fish they serve is sustainably caught.  I love this place.

Review1436.Review: Had reservation for 745 with my wife and daughter. Arrived at 740 and awesome table in front window was waiting for us. This is a great place. This was not our first time here. Last time we were there it was really crowded. Seems not as many people are going out to eat. Too Bad

Review1437.Review: We had a nice experience at Akikos. Not nice enought for it to be a destination spot for us. While the sushi was VERY good the tempura appetizer was greasy. Also, the service was hit and miss. Being dessert fans (yes even in a sushi restaurant) we were disappointed when the server told us that they were sold out of all of their desserts (this seemed very odd for a Saturday night) but if we came back next week they would be sure to have something.

Review1438.Review: The sushi and service were excellent and prompt. The only thing is that it was chilly in the restaurant. I wish they had a bigger sign as we walked by it twice.

Review1439.Review: I would like to give Akiko's a good review but after waiting an hour, our food never came. We gave them a warning that we had an appt at 1 pm at 12:30 but they were not able to deliver the food within an hour of our reservation.

Review1440.Review: Akiko's offers okay food, but our experience was marred by bewilderingly poor service. We arrived at 6pm and were seated promptly...after which it went downhill quickly. The first sign of something amiss was the lack of the "Nama" speciality menu -- rare fish -- featured on their web site. So be it....we ordered...and waited....and waited. They forgot one drink order and need to be reminded. After about 30 minutes the waiter comes out to let us know they are out of tofu -- really??? --- so my appetizer needed to be reordered. Hmm....why did this take so long to notice? I asked for hamachi Kama, another staple...they were out of that. Okay, then, the mackerel.Our food arrived at 650...sans mackerel, which never came. Poor.

Review1441.Review: This was our first time here. I was impressed by how fresh their sashimi was, especially their shiro maguro! The rolls are also unique, though they are very filling so be prepared when ordering! The service was good, we had to ask for tea, water, condiments a few times (hence 4 stars and not 5), which I didn't expect since it's a small place. Will definitely come back and try the sushi bar!

Review1442.Review: Muy amable y alta calidad de comida. Los meseros sabian mucho...y nos dieron buenas respuestas a nuestras preguntas sobre el menu.

Review1443.Review: Wonderful experience, again. Great selection of super fresh seafood. Daily specials are especially interesting. Waiter again proved so knowledgable about various dishes and sake. You will be glad you asked him for advice! Ambiance cozy, the place is small and a bit noisy during the busiest time but we had no trouble talking. Reasonably priced for a high quality experience!

Review1444.Review: Great food - some of the best sushi / sashimi you will find near the financial district.

Review1445.Review: This restaurant is by reservation only and well worth it. I actually liked showing up and not having to deal with a crowd of people waiting. The fish was excellent, very fresh. I highly recommend the mixed sashimi plate.

Review1446.Review: waygu beef sushi was outstanding, but too bad the toro was no good!!! over all, its good but little pricy.

Review1447.Review: Refused to seat me because I didn't have a reservation even though the restaurant was empty so I walked outside, went to the OT app, booked my reservation, and walked right back in. Food is fresh and the rolls are amazing. Great sushi! Service is poor.

Review1448.Review: We ordered the omakase and the flavors were fresh, sometimes slightly different than the usual and excellent. The fish didn't fall off the rice when dipped upside down in the soy sauce! The place setting came with a chopstick rest, which I liked. Don't see that too often. Our only quibble is that with such good sushi, we expected tamago (egg) to be available. It wasn't that night and we were there early. Also, traditional sushi places offer a hot towel at the start of the mean, to clean your hands. That would have been nice. Service was knowledgable and attentive. Will go back to try the less expensive udon/sashimi or udon/shioyaki combination. Our meal for two was $100 for 6 piece omakase plus beer, calif roll and spinach dish.

Review1449.Review: Best Sushi restaurant in SF. As a recent NYC transplant, Akiko's feels like a bit of home. Service is outstanding, staff is always nice, helpful and accommodating. Most important - the food is delicious. Must try everything on the menu, it's all good. I definitely recommend the Volcano - I love it! I bring all my out of town guests to Akiko's.

Review1451.Review: A visit to Akiko is always part of my schedule when I come to San Francisco and I regularly miss it when I am back home. Reasonably priced and high quality.

Review1452.Review: The food is good, but overpriced. It took an hour to get our first few pieces of nigiri.

Review1453.Review: The owner suggested some off the menu special sushi...wow, it was good!

Review1454.Review: Nice little sushi place around the corner from China Town! We got a great little table by the front window. Service was slow for a not very busy time, but we weren't in a hurry, so it wasn't a problem for us!

Review1455.Review: We had the tempura udon, some nigiri and grilled mackerel. The fish was okay. The noodles were excellent. However, the tempura was not well made. It may have been fried in oil that had been used too many times. There was also too much batter and the tempura did not have the light texture it should have.The restaurant is understaffed and the wait for service was long.

Review1456.Review: Casual ambiance with killer sushi and stunningly reasonable prices. I walked by this place dozens of times before I finally walked in! Be back soon.

Review1457.Review: Best Sushi in SF... I love this place. Amakase is the only way to go and it is a MUST.

Review1458.Review: The food was fantastic and the service excellent. Nothing bad to say about the restaurant.

Review1459.Review: Fantastic no nonsense sushi! And their noodle bowls are great too

Review1460.Review: The food was delicious. The service was good, however, we ordered an appetizer for both of us and I ordered an appetizer (grilled mackeral) as my main entree while my dining partner ordered a regular entree (donbori.) The waiter didn't clarify the order and I suppose I cld have specified the mackerel as main dish but it seemed implied. next time i will. They brought the appetizer and put it in front of me. that's okay, my partner and I shared it. Then they brought my "entree." we waited and waited for my partner's dish while my dish got cold. they didn't bring it and I was done by the time his meal came. thankfully, though they generously comped my dining partner's dish. This made up for the discomfort and I would definitely return.

Review1461.Review: The food was great but the service as less than satisfactory. The waiter subbed out our drink selections for a more expensive brand and then offered to knock off one of our beers but failed to do so on the actual bill. Also, the food was brought out at very different times. One person had almost entirely finished her sushi before the other guests had been served. I would recommend this joint to small groups rather than groups over 4 people.

Review1462.Review: Nice enough food, what a pity it came in the wrong sequence and served with a side of attitude that we didn't order. Less than decent service had better be compensated for by excellent food. It wasn't.

Review1463.Review: Akiko's is a excellent sushi bar. 5 stars.

Review1464.Review: Server offered great recommendation on grilled yellowtail.

Review1465.Review: Having lived in Japan, I rate Japanese restaurants on how good their miso soup is, and there's was one of the best ever. The sushi and tempura were perfect. Would definitely return.

Review1466.Review: Great sushi and ambiance and surprisingly reasonably priced. Service leaves a lot to be desired. They are nice, but always seem overwhelmed, are not very attentive, and brought me food I did not order more times than I can count. But this is one of my favorite FiDi dinner spots. This is a fun place to grab dinner and drinks after work.

Review1467.Review: Exceptional fish selection. Not your typical, tuna, salmon, yellowtail, but regional and seasonal seafood. Was served a flight of salmon/sea trout which was unlike anything else in SF. the Ebi was crunchy and sweet, and the fried heads were crisp all the way through. Was served 4 chilled sakes. all very refreshing. Ray and his super staff offer a great combination of attentiveness and creativity.

Review1468.Review: Quality was only OK for the high price they charged

Review1469.Review: Wonderful sushi dinner in a small intimate setting. Fish was fresh and delicious and the meal was VERY affordable!

Review1470.Review: Will definitely make this our downtown Sushi restaurant! Everything was perfect.

Review1471.Review: I messed up the date of our reservation and the host had no intention of letting us get a reservation that evening - it was a Wednesday! I went on Open Table and booked a reservation a half hour later. Really? The food was very good, the spicy tuna was more a Mexican spicy than what I'm use to, the seaweed salad a bit too sweet, the tereakyi chicken good. The house warm sake was very good as well.

Review1472.Review: Great sushi but beef teriyaki wasn't good. Spider roll was the best I've had. Presentation of food was really pretty. Service was great.

Review1473.Review: Service, and particularly the host, were very unpleasant. Menu was also surprisingly small with fewer sushi selections than one would have expected. Very surprised this restaurant got such great reviews on other sites.

Review1474.Review: Very fresh sashimi! Saki was great. Staff was very attentive and extremely nice. If we lived in San Francisco, we would be regulars here. A little loud but for us we enjoyed the high energy feel it provided.

Review1475.Review: The sushi is very delicious and service is great.

Review1476.Review: Akikos is a great spot for Sushi and offers a lot of rarities not usually found at other Japanese restaurants. Very tasty food but service can be a bit slow

Review1477.Review: AMAZING!!! Loved it! Best sushi on the West Coast!

Review1478.Review: Some of the best sushi I have ever had! Excellent restaurant!

Review1479.Review: This was exceptional! Food and service were amazing! Try the 49er roll!

Review1480.Review: Food was excellent--so fresh, so clean, prepared delicately. Best sushi I have had in a long while! Service was excellent. Ambiance was relaxing and just interesting enough but not distracting.

Review1481.Review: We had a fantastic experience here. Do yourself a favor and opt for the omakase. The chefs choose from the freshest fish and nicely time various plates of sashimi and nigiri. With such a vast menu it's the best way to try new fish. You could certainly go for standard rolls, which they have and are probably better than standard, but the fish is so fresh and such high quality that a roll does it. disservice. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and provided perfect pairings of sake. Overall it was the best sushi experience we've had in the City, surpassing previous best Ozumo with better food quality and more intimate atmosphere. Will definitely go back for special occasion omakase dinners, or to try select fish at the bar.

Review1482.Review: The best authentic sushi and sashimi we've ever had. Period. And our waiter was a true gem. He planned our whole meal, brought out just the right amounts of everything so that each of the 5 in our party got a piece, and made the flow really pleasant and stress free.Were my resources unlimited, I'd eat there every week.

Review1483.Review: Love this place! great food and service, had a really great time here.

Review1484.Review: One of the best Sushi Restaurants I know. The food was exzellent and the service was very frendly.

Review1485.Review: Went in on a Tuesday night without a reservation at 7:45pm. Host and server asked if I had a reservation and I said no. They were rude and also told me nothing was available until 8:30pm for one person. I was tired from work and just wanted to eat dinner. Went outside a reserved a table for one at 8pm on opentable.com. I went back in at 7:55pm and informed the host and server I had a reservation. They ignored me and didn't even bother to smile or greet me. I was starving by then and just waited. Eventually a busser showed me to a table. Food was average and they were stingy on the ginger. Would have been better off taking my business elsewhere.

Review1486.Review: They were busy so service was off. They realized it and gave a discount on the bill to make up for it. It was a nice gesture.

Review1487.Review: Some of the best sushi I've ever had and not overpriced at all. Quality and a reasonable price is rare for a sushi place. Go if you get the chance.

Review1488.Review: Overall great place I highly recommend! Best sushi my girlfriend and I have ever eaten in our entire lives, seriously.

Review1489.Review: Fantastic restaurant with very intimate feel. Staff is nice and always very knowledgable about the fish they're serving. Make reservations, otherwise don't think about getting a seat! They hardly ever take walk-ins.We always go with the expectation to eat something extremely fresh and delivered that day.

Review1490.Review: What the others have said is true. The service here is deplorable. I was seated for 40 minutes before my sushi arrived. And the place wasn't all that busy at the time. My server was inattentive. I practically had to stand up on my table to get him to come back to the table. Most of the time I ended up flagging down some other server to get what I needed. The menu is poorly designed, hard to read, and difficult to understand if you can read it. It assumes the customer has every meal in a Japanese restaurant. Having said that, the sushi was excellent, as was the poached spinach. But I can't recommend the place, and I would never go back. There are too many excellent choices in San Francisco.

Review1491.Review: Great food and staff. Some of the finest sushi I have ever had.

Review1492.Review: Definitely make reservations for this place because they will turn you away at the door without one. Down to the food. We did not try any rolls, just nigiri. Each piece of fish tasted fresh, not slimy and had distinguishable characteristics and flavors. The main problem was the pacing of the food. The first tuna sashimi salad came out and then we waited for about 45 minutes before any food was even pointed in our direction. Luckily Akiko graciously offered us free shots of sake to apologize for the wait. I really enjoyed the nigiri here and the fish selection. I will definitely be back here in the future.

Review1493.Review: Great food! One complaint is that the restaurant itself was simply too hot to be comfortable

Review1494.Review: BEST sushi I've had in SF. Blowfish is still tops for the tuna pyramid. Akiko has excellent food, decent prices, outstanding decor. Small place and a little loud, but the food more than compensates. Had the 12 pc sashimi sampler, the most amazing Rainbow Roll I've ever had (my sushi staple, so many points of comparison), and the Dragon Roll. Wine list was not stellar, but good variety and prices. Planning to eat here often!

Review1495.Review: Sashimi was greatm but I was the first reservation of the evening and they tried to make me sit way in the dark back of the restaurant. They agreed when I asked for a window table, but why would you do that to your first customer of the day?

Review1496.Review: Before dining at Akiko's, I had read some reviews that indicated that the food was excellent, but to expect terrible service. The host who met us at the door certainly met the description we expected - he was curt and generally uncommunicative to the point of rudeness.Once seated, however, we were pleasantly surprised to discover that our waiter was top notch. We asked him just to feed us ("omakase," for those familiar with Japanese), and he brought out a veritable feast of sushi and sashimi. The selections he brought us were fantastic, fresh, and original. And the black sesame ice cream was the perfect end to a truly satisfying meal.The short of it is to make reservations, ignore any rudeness, and just let them feed you here.

Review1497.Review: Really glad I picked Akiko for a business dinner. The service was excellent at delivering delicious sushi and sake in a continuous stream, yet without ever getting in the way. It's a small place, so I recommend reservations. Also, it was easy to walk there after parking at the White House Garage on Sutter (FYI).

Review1498.Review: The food was good, but the portions were small. Especially considering the price paid. And considering the price, the service was acceptable, but not special. I would go here again, but not often because I can't afford to spend $20+ on a bento box!

Review1499.Review: This a small but fantastic restaurant. Great selection of sushi and a good selection of wines to accompany it. Staff were attentive, friendly and helpful in recommending dishes. We were on the San Fran part of our honeymoon and this was by far the best restaurant we tried. Highly recommend it. Great value for money too.

Review1500.Review: Took very long for food to come out. But otherwise, it was delicious. I would recommend as long as you weren't starving.

Review1501.Review: The sushi was great. There were a lot of options ranging from classics to unique rolls. They offer a few samplers to try a selection of sashimi, which makes ordering a bit easier if you can't decide what you want. Service was consistent, and our waiter offered good recommendations.

Review1502.Review: Small, but cozy space. Back room was very hot, but we adjusted after a few minutes. Sushi was unbelievably fresh.

Review1503.Review: Food was fabulous; service not so much. The wait staff was pretentious and condescending. We found ourselves in the neighborhood and decided to try it out base on reviews. On arrival the restaurant was empty but we were told that they only took reservations. We made reservations on our smart phone standing in the restaurant and then were seated. We watched this play out 7 more times with other patrons - refusal without reservations and then smartphone use for reservations. The other challenge was their wine/drink list. After 3 tries of trying to select a drink only to be told that it was unavailable, we abandoned the list. It's a shame the whole experience isn't as fabulous as the food.

Review1504.Review: Great meal. A little odd that soup and the entree were served at the same time, but otherwise an outstanding place. Reasonably priced as well. They require reservations.

Review1505.Review: One of the best japanese/sushi restaurants I've been to in the USA. Very fresh sushi with good presentation. Service was quick and friendly - with tea and water topped up without needing to ask. The menu selection was good for a small sushi restaurant. The sake sampler had top notch choices served in square cups :)The ambiance and decor was a bit odd for a japanese restaurant seems like Japanese decor overlayed on a more classical victorian ruin.Will definitely go back the next time I'm in San Francisco.

Review1506.Review: Fabulous sushi-amazingly fresh fish. Well done!

Review1507.Review: Great fish selection for nigiri sushi and sashimi.

Review1508.Review: Absolutely the best Japanese cuisine I've had. There was a slight hiccough with the appetizers, and they missed one, but brought it later and gave it free of charge. You absolutely have to have reservations though, as about 4-5 different groups walked in while we were eating and had to be turned away. The restaurant is pretty small but it's amazing sushi.

Review1509.Review: Awesome sushi! You have to try their volcano roll, amazing!!!

Review1510.Review: Great sushi and food. Prices high.

Review1511.Review: By far the best dining experience I have had in SOMA. Great food, great value, great service, and great ambience. There is good reason that you need a reservation.

Review1512.Review: The staff was friendly, and really set a beautiful table with great presentation. Has a Euro feel.

Review1513.Review: We had a great experience at Akiko's: very good service and amazing food. We'll definitely come back there again.

Review1514.Review: absolutely love this place!!! every time i come, it's another pleasant surprise with new menu item, new recipe! service is consistently great. fish is fresh and prices are reasonable. love it!

Review1515.Review: The best sushi I have ever eaten. The service was excellent; attentive but not intrusive. Our waiter was polite, friendly, and efficient. I can not rave enough about the quality of the food. This place is a gem for anyone that loves good sushi.

Review1516.Review: The nigiri and sushi rolls were very good. The teriyaki was also good. It is a small place and packed, but the service was good and we had a nice time. It was a very good value. Being from Philadelphia and spending a lot of time in NYC, this was a friendly, unpretentious spot, and I was surprised by the prices, because it was cheaper than Philly for sushi.

Review1517.Review: We walked out after sitting for 20 minutes without any service for our party of four. Waiters werent that busy... That is, busy talking/joking. Seems like its run by teenagers. Will not be back.

Review1518.Review: The service was okay, the waiters could have been more friendly. The food was delicious. When I couldn't finish my food and wanted to take home the leftovers, the waiters did that for me. However, they didn't give me all of my left over soup as they only put it in a small container.

Review1519.Review: We had a wonderful meal. We just told the waiter the general parameters of what we liked and told him to keep bringing food....and he did. It was a fantastic meal.

Review1520.Review: This is definitely my fav sushi place in SF!

Review1521.Review: This is a nicely appointed restaurant with good food. Our waiter was very courteous and informed about the cuisine, however our server kept clearing our plates a bit too promtly, making us feel a little rushed - there were no diners waiting to be seated, so I felt this was unnecessary. Overall a nice intimate place I would return to.

Review1522.Review: Fantastic food all around. You can pretty much throw a dart at the menu and be happy, but try the uni with the shaved monk fish liver for something a little more unusual and decadent. Service is fantastic. We absolutely love this place.

Review1523.Review: The sushi was fresh and the potstickers were tasty. I also had the green salad which was crunchy and with a tasty dressing. The service was a little lackluster. I thought this was a solid place to go for lunch but I wasn't wowed.

Review1524.Review: Some of the freshest sushi I have ever tasted...

Review1525.Review: Good value for the price. Food rather undersalted.

Review1526.Review: food is just ok. menu is quite limited, not good for a group

Review1527.Review: Great find! Volcano roll is unique and amazing- all rolls are actually pretty unique. They have a diverse specials menu of different types of fish I've never had. Will certainly go here again.

Review1528.Review: Simply some of the best sushi I've ever had!

Review1529.Review: Consistently high quality lunch fare, wonderfully presented.

Review1530.Review: Love the Volcano Sushi! Overall, their sushi is fresh and tasty.The service seems to be always slow so plan to take time especially on the busy weekend nights.

Review1531.Review: Was really pleasantly surprised. Took a client there for a business lunch and he particularly favors Sushi. He was blown away by the flavorful rolls which included Firecracker, 49er and Rainbow rolls. Incredibly tasty!

Review1532.Review: Sushi is very good. It's a lovely place. Can get a bit loud but that's true of almost every place

Review1533.Review: Stellar food - had a green salad and a few rolls. All was exceptional. Great spot; can't wait to go back

Review1534.Review: I cannot comment on the food as we couldn't order any. Nor did we get a chance to order a drink. Came on time for our 7:15 Wednesday night reservation, waited a few minutes to be seated then spent the next 20 minutes being ignored. Being able to simply order a beer would have been nice but apparently that's not on offer. A quick look around the crowded dining room revealed that over half the tables had NO food on them and they all were seated before us. Not a good sign; at that rate we'd be there until midnight just to see a hint of fatty tuna. Took the decision to abort and walked out... Got the "stink eye" from the host... yeh, my bad.....

Review1535.Review: Some of the best Sashimi I ever had. Tried new things and enjoyed it all. The staff was very helpful explaining everything. You will need a reservation for this place!

Review1536.Review: This is a gem of a restaurant tucked away near Union Square - a small place with a cozy feel. Went there for dinner and set ourselves up by the sushi bar, which gave us ample opportunity to watch the food being prepared. We ordered omakase, allowing the chef to give up his pick of the sushi. We got to try a variety of delicious dishes, all made with fresh ingredients and explained to us by the chef himself. Had a very nice meal with tasty food, good service and a nice ambiance. Would definitely go back.

Review1537.Review: Solid Sushi/Japanese place. Dish portions are on the smaller side but it's worth it because the quality of the food is high, especially the fish whether it's raw or cooked.

Review1538.Review: The quality of the fish and other sea creatures is supreme. Likewise, the preparation is as close to perfect as I have seen at a sushi restaurant. I love that this place is no-nonsense and just about the food. We ordered a few nigiri options, grilled Norwegian mackerel, seaweed salad, and a sake sampler. All were outstanding! We had an early dinner and the place was quiet, but later in the night it began to fill up. I would recommend making a reservation.

Review1539.Review: Sit at the bar and let the chef prepare what is fresh on the menu. They usually have some of the most unique offerings: flying fish, shaved monkfish liver, various kinds of toro, etc.

Review1540.Review: We loved the food here. Fish was very fresh, served attractively. Waiter very informative and helpful. Great service.

Review1541.Review: The service here was very slow - took 15 minutes to take the orders - another 20 minutes or so for the food. When it was time to pay, it took another 15 minutes just to get the bill. Waited another 15 more minutes for them to come back and get my card which they didn't come back to get so I just walked over to the bar and paid them there.They were friendly and the food was very good but if you just have an hour for lunch, this is not the place to go.

Review1542.Review: The service I thought was a bit slow but their sushi made up for it.Loved the Volcano sushi.

Review1543.Review: Food was incredible. Possibly the best tasting salmon sashimi I have ever had. Uni w/ shaved cryo monkfish liver was wonderful. The rolls I tried were good but not great. Only negative was that we were seated directly in front of the door and under a cold air duct.

Review1544.Review: poor service, very slow. food OK. Atmosphere typically SFO

Review1545.Review: Very nice place with great food, great personnel and a lovely place. But the place is tight of space and easily gets noisy.

Review1546.Review: Wonderful sushi spot, not to be missed.

Review1547.Review: This Place was absolutely amazing. really romantic nice looking place.

Review1548.Review: The fresh tuna was truly amazing.The waitstaff were wonderfully knowledgeable and helpful.Presentation was exceptional.Highly recommend.

Review1549.Review: This was a very good place for sushi, but it started out a bit rough. When I got to the restaurant I checked I and was told to wait a moment. Unfortunately the person got sidetracked on the phone for about 15min. Eventually I got to sit down. The waiter was occupied as well, so it did take a bit of time to get my order in...then things got wonderful. The waiter had good insight into the menu and offered nice advice. The food was just perfect. The sushi and sake were as good as I have had in Japan. The tekka donburi was tasty as well. Price point was just right. I will be back!

Review1550.Review: I have been here a few times. Food is generally very good and fresh. Service is historically slow. On my last two visits, it took nearly 30 minutes for Nigiri to reach my table after the order. My last time in, the place was less than half full when I placed my order. I'm not sure why this is so slow, but it is a problem during lunch. I highly recommend if you are not in a hurry, but if time is tight, I would go elsewhere.

Review1551.Review: Food was great, love it. Tamago and salmon are fresh and good. Not too loud, just too small.

Review1552.Review: Excellent sushi. Very fresh and great options.

Review1554.Review: Hands down...the best sushi I've ever had. I can't wait to go back the next time I'm in town. Absolutely amazing!

Review1555.Review: Too loud! Carpeting or acoustics of some kind would help.

Review1556.Review: Although the food was ok the service was not very good.We were put on hold every time we needed something and the place was not even full.Slow food – Quick clean up.We ordered and were told 10 minutes later that this item was not available.For the price that Akiko's charges for the menu you would expect better than average.

Review1557.Review: Had a fantastic NYE dinner at Akiko's... just tried it on a whim as we had a hotel room nearby and are SO glad we did. Service was outstanding and so was the food! We'll definitely be back.

Review1558.Review: This was a cute little restaurant that was great for small groups of 4 people or less.

Review1559.Review: the food was decent - they had a variety of rolls, although not my faborite sushi. good for a casual dinner!

Review1560.Review: Went to Akiko's based on OpenTable reviews and I must say the reviews were spot on. The sushi was the freshest I can remember having. While the sushi menu is not extensive, there are a good number rolls and creations on the menu such as to not overwhelm you while still presenting you with a fine selection. The sake list is good as well, try the sake sampler.It's a smaller place and reservations are definitely recommended. It was a pleasure watching the sushi making process from the sushi bar. Try the ocean trout!This is my new favorite sushi spot in SF.

Review1561.Review: absolutely love it! fish is always fresh, staff is very friendly and accommodating. Best sushi in town.

Review1562.Review: Sought this location out on yelp as I was in SF for fun and wanted to find a neighborhood gem. This place was all that it was cracked up to be and then some. The seafood was extremely fresh and tasty. Everything was beyond our expectation. Total hit.

Review1563.Review: Excellent sushi -- good choice -- very fresh

Review1564.Review: This is one of the best sushi restaurants in the Bay area. My previous favorite was Sushi Ran in Sausalito, but Akiko's quality is on the same level while the price is lower. They have an amazing variety of fish, so don't order the boring generic "salmon" and "tuna" and "yellow tail". Try instead the special varieties of these and other fish that you can't find in 99% of other sushi joints. Try Arctic Char, Umimasu (ocean trout), Kurodai, and the fish that they have on the specials menu that changes weekly.  You'd be glad you did.

Review1565.Review: Best sushi in town - and sustainable.

Review1566.Review: The Super buttery uni, sweet blue Ama-ebi with fried head, spicy mountainous Volcano roll, and the scallop cucumber salad were all to die for. Perhaps it was because I was there for a nice night out with my lady, but the vibe early in the evening was relaxed despite the hot green tea getting me ready for a night out.

Review1567.Review: Food was very good, and came out pretty fast.  The prices were a bit more than I wanted to spend, though.  So I don't know if I'll go there again.

Review1568.Review: Probably the best sushi in SF. Because it is small and they prepare each piece individually, can be a little slow on getting the food to table. But, service is attentive and the sushi and sashimi is worth the wait.

Review1569.Review: The food was quite tasty, and they have a great selection of beer and sake. We had a very knowledgeable waiter that gave us great recommendations. Although I understand that restaurants need to maintain their flow of customers and try to keep reservations, I do not understand asking your customers to leave so that you can seat another big party when there are plenty of other seats towards the front. Not only were we asked to leave, but the manager was not apologetic about it and told us it was our fault for being late in the first place which pushed everything else back. My friends and I were planning on buying more alcohol and food too. Good restaurant, but service could be better.

Review1570.Review: Best Sushi I've had in San Francisco!

Review1571.Review: Definitely go here! We had great sushi and pot stickers. Very tasty and fresh! Great ambiance and friendly staff.

Review1572.Review: Could not have asked for more personalized service! Recommendation were great... as usual. Fish was super fresh. My third time this year...and I live in Florida! I almost do not want to let the secret out!

Review1573.Review: Outstanding sushi in a town filled with great sushi places. Not really the best for kids (small) but they were very kind to our three.

Review1574.Review: Service was poor (sarcastic waiter), had to ask twice for more wasabi; food was not good either.

Review1575.Review: Gracious service, helpful when needed but not obtrusive. Seated promptly at reservation time. Excellent quality sushi that was flavourful, not too saucy, appropriate filling to rice ratio. If in SFO again would return.

Review1576.Review: Fantastic sushi! Definitely one of the best spots in the city. We really enjoyed it. :o)

Review1577.Review: Akiko's higiri sushi and sashimi are outstanding. I always order from their long list of special fish imported from Japan as well as locally procured. The variety of the fish is the best I've seen in the SF area except maybe for Sushi Ran in Marine County (but at a much lower price). The quality is top notch as well. The amount of fish you get for your dollar is reasonably generous.The roles are above average compared to other restaurants, but not as great as the sushi / sashimi. I would characterize them as excellent.

Review1578.Review: Reservations take priority. We saw a lot of people turned away. We were early by 1/2 hour but they were able to seat us earlier,which was very nice. We ordered sushi rolls and an appetizer. The food took awhile to come. The appetizer never showed even after eating 3 rolls so we canceled it. The rolls we ordered were too similar in style. There was nothing spectacular about presentation. Water service was very frequent. Follow up service while eating wasn't. When there was contact though, they were nice. This was our first time eating here after receiving a friend's recommendation. I would not eat here again nor recommend.

Review1579.Review: The food was amazing! I took my boyfriend here for his b-day and we both loved it. The fish was top quality, the Dynamite roll was fantastic. The only draw back was the intense noise level and the general temperature of the the place. It was very hot inside, to the point where both of us were sweating. Having said that, it was still a great meal and I would go again and recommend it to sushi lovers!

Review1580.Review: excellent sake list and nice local fresh sushi place dicovered quite by surprise.Try the Tamagawa Junmai "Heart of Oak" sake made by Philip Harper The Brit in Japan.Moderate pricing as well. Energetic young staff.

Review1581.Review: My second visit; I enjoyed it just as much - sat in the dining room versus at the counter this time.  Equally as "close" and as "loudly intimate" as the counter.  Reasonably priced and good food.  Service is not overly friendly, but courteous just the same.  While waiting for the restaurant to open, I shared a seat on a nearby front step to an apartment building with a local homeless person.  He wasn't comprehendable, but then he wasn't pushy either.  I couldn't offer him a cigarette and I couldn't understand anything else he was motioning.

Review1582.Review: Very good sushi at reasonable price!

Review1583.Review: This is, by far, my favorite sushi place in the Bay Area. The fish is always fresh, the people are great, and the Dynamite Roll is crave worthy. I take anyone visiting SF from out of town to this cozy spot, and they give rave reviews as well. I only wish it were walkable from my apartment so that I could go more often!

Review1585.Review: The service was okay. The sushi chef was very nice, even though we were sitting at a table, he kept making sure that we’re happy with our food.All the fish was very fresh and delicious, with the exception of the Albacore, it smells a bit like fishy dry bonito flakes. We had the Hanasaki crab 3-ways. It was just okay, not real fresh. The legs are extremely difficult to eat and we eat whole crabs often. The crab nigiri was okay, the sauce was a bit too sweet for my taste. The crab chawanmushi was my favorite one of the 3-ways.We’ll definitely return for sushi again, and go early so we can sit at the bar.

Review1586.Review: I love good sushi, and Akiko's quality is always top notch.It's not cheap, but where quality meets the price, Akiko's is the place to go! I frequent Akiko's at least 1-2x a month, and have never been let down. Yum

Review1587.Review: Extremely unprofessional- I made a reservation via OpenTable and the restaurant called 5 times within an hour of my reservation trying to make us have a set menu, a drink minimum, time limit for 10 PEOPLE. They said we would take up half their restaurant and we only took up 3 (small) tables. Then after we ordered the waiter came back and told us to buy more drinks because we weren't spending enough money on dinner. I will NEVER come back here nor will I refer anyone to this place. It's too bad because this would have been a cool restaurant and the food was pretty good.

Review1588.Review: Good fish, good service, overally decent experience. Decor is kind of weird, with a giant cross on one wall. ???

Review1589.Review: The recommended items were great - direct from Japan. Unique executions, pretty presentations. Missed the full bar.

Review1590.Review: The success of the team at Akiko's revolves around the incredible steady hands of sushi chef "Uncle Joe" and the creative talents of Ray Lee. Make sure you show up with a reservation or risk not eating sushi!!!!

Review1591.Review: We were all set for a night at Ozumo becasue we were told that was the place to go... However, our local "Foodie" said that Akiko was his favorite so off we went (with reservations). By far the best meal of the week. Sashimi was fantastic, special orders and modification requests honored and nailed without a pause. We love the Escolar (Some call it super white tuna) in its raw form, not seared and it was excellent. The best oily Salmon ever! Tried teh wild Hamachi from the sea of Japan, awesome but maybe not twice as good as the regular Hamachi? Anyway we had sushi sashimi platters, 10 orders of sashimi, spider roll, neggi hama, spicy tuna,finished up with chirashi don atop fantastic rice. everything was awesome! Id pass on the volcano roll

Review1592.Review: No question, one of the best sushi restaurants I have ever eaten at. That's compared to Japan and other trendy US restaraunts like Nobu. Make a reservation to guarantee a spot.

Review1593.Review: Great sustainable seafood from raw to tempura and every way in between. Special daily dishes according to the catch. Helpful, well-informed servers, cheerful, unpretentious, friendly atmosphere. I come back whenever I'm looking for a great meal downtown but not crowded and noisy! (around the corner from Cafe Claude which is another kind of great).

Review1594.Review: Wonderful place for sushi, sashimi, nigiri. Very fresh and flavorful. Waiter was happy to help us neophytes deal with the many options available in ordering; he made some very good suggestions regarding our guests' choice of a saki. Top notch!

Review1595.Review: This is a restaurant that knows its fish. There were 4 different types of salmon available the night we came. We were the last ones in the door, which meant that by the time we were finishing dinner, the staff was closing up. This meant that the chef gave us the left over bits of salmon from that day, which were delicious. I definitely plan to go back.

Review1596.Review: This was the slowest service I've ever experienced and the staff was in no way apologetic. I would not go back and would not recommend this place to anyone. The food was ok, but definitely not worth the service.

Review1597.Review: ugh! its a hole in the wall! no air conditioning which we didn't fully realize until we ate hot soup... waitstaff was overwhelmed and unorganized. they forgot my sushi and when i asked about it they brought sashimi instead. my husband raved about the fish and said it was fresh, but come on!!!! i ordered 2 pieces of sushi and a soup and you couldn't even get that right?! never again! do NOT recommend!

Review1598.Review: Akiko's has had many updates in the past year or so. The place looks and feels great, but the best part is that they didn't lose any of the quality of their food. Everything is super fresh and served with a smile.

Review1599.Review: Fantastic! And this is coming from someone who eats sushi at least once a week back home in Chicago! The quality of the fish was outstanding as was the presentation. The special rolls were creative and unusual. I could not get enough of the Forty-Niner roll.Great service and a relaxing environment.

Review1600.Review: Great place to go on a date or to catch up with an old friend as the measured pace of ordering and delivery combined with the moderate noise level makes a rich meandering conversation possible and comfortable. The sashimi and sushi are impeccably fresh and elegantly presented. Their servings are a bit on the small side, making the food somewhat more expensive that appears, but the quality is first rate and worth the visit. Easy parking at nearby Stockton Garage.

Review1601.Review: Loved the quality of the food and the service was excellent. I even ordered a special roll not on the menu and the server said no problem and made it happen. Great experience!!

Review1602.Review: I like this place. It's my first time dining at Akiko. The ambiance is very soothing, cozy and yet sophisticated.I felt everything was finely prepared and presented, but as for quality of the sashimi, I need to go back and try a few more varieties in order to be more accurate on my review for this restaurant. Two big disppointments I had with them are 1)they were out of the grilled Hamachi Kama and 2) the Chef's sashimi combo only came with tuna and salmon. I was anticipating more varieties.The service was very good and the ambience is very elegant. I would recomend that you call before you dine at the restaurant to be sure they have what you like in stock.

Review1603.Review: Possibly the freshest and best presented authentic sushi and sashimi I've had in SF. Attentive, professional, knowledgeable staff.

Review1604.Review: Food was great but service was extremely slow. Not easy to eat soup without a spoon!

Review1605.Review: The food was prepared very well. I am not going to break it down dish by dish. The seafood was very fresh. The non-sushi foods were very tasty. The only exception was the volcano roll. It was just heavy handed and lacked the delicate flavors of the other dishes. The presentation was clean, simple, and classic.BTW - I had never tried Himachi Jawbone. I will definitely be having it again. The fish was so delicate and tender.Service:The service was friendly, professional, and polite. We were seated quickly. Even though there were only two of us, they seated us at a table for four. Lol, we needed the room for all of the food we ordered. The food came out in an orderly fashion with dishes being removed promptly along the

Review1606.Review: This is a truly special sushi restaurant in a city lucky enough to have scores of sushi spots. The fish selection is vast and varies each day, which makes it easy to order something different on every visit. The restaurant would be perfection if the space were larger and the decor updated, but it's far better to have the owners investing in the food instead of in furniture.

Review1607.Review: The sushi here was great - very fresh! However - we waited for an hour before we even got our edamame. The servers were all very nice and polite, but make sure you eat a snack before you go. By the time our rolls came out I think we had been sitting there for an hour and a half.

Review1608.Review: Fantastic sushi, best Volcano Roll and 49er roll
